column2: India’s Minister of State for AYUSH Shripad Naik held a press conference claiming that Prince Charles followed the rules of Ayurveda, due to which he is recovering so soon.
column8: Ella Lynch, a spokesperson for the Royal House of England, told The India Express via Gmail that false claims were being made in the media about Prince Charles recovering from a coronavirus infection.

column2: Ministry of Health blocked the respirators that Seat was producing in Spain.
column8: Union sources in Seat explain that the Health Ministry requested some final tests to avoid interference of these products with other ICU devices before their mass production.

column2: Government and media hides death and coffins in a parking in Spain.
column8: The images were shown on national tv and talked about in the media.

column2: This is the video of Conress leaders Rahul and Priyanka Gandhi breaking coronavirus lockdown by stepping out.
column8: The viral video is four months old and has no connection to coronavirus.

column2: News about COVID-19 can only be shared after seeking the government’s permission.
column8: The Indian government had reached out to the Supreme Court that had turned down the government's appeal stating that media and news houses should be more focused and spread verified news about the virus.

column2: A decree that allows euthanisia in dependant senior homes has been passed in France.
column8: The decree approves the use of a sedative outside hospitals but euthanasia is still forbidden by law.

column2: Mostly Dr. Charles Lieber, a Harvard professor, was arrested for creating coronavirus and selling it to China.
column8: Dr Charles Lieber was arrested by US authorities for concealing Chinese funding. This arrest has no connection to coronavirus.

column2: Mostly Brazilians observed Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s “lights out” call.
column8: The viral video was available on Internet even days before PM Modi's April 3 speech. So the viral claim is misleading.

column2: A message claims you need to sterilize products with a hair dryer
column8: Several supermarkets deny having sent this message.

column2: Mostly WHO has released “protocols and procedures” of lockdown periods to fight Covid-19.
column8: WHO has not released any such protocol for lockdown periods.

column2: The World Health Organization has prescribed a lockdown strategy to tackle COVID-19 which India is following.
column8: The much shared protocol is from a Cambridge study that forecasts the best possible ways to tackle the coronavirus epidemic and is not shared by the World Health Organization.

column2: Amid COVID19 Lockdown Food being distributed in Indian State of Tamil Nadu.
column8: It's an old image from Gambia (West Africa)

column2: A video of a confrontation between drug users in “crackland”, a run down part of central São Paulo, and municipal guard. In the caption, it is stated that this is what is happening while the city is lockdown
column8: The video is from November 2019, not related to the COVID-19 lockdown.

column2: Two WhatsApp audio files claim that gangs of roughly 30 drug addicts are looting shops and terrorizing workers in central São Paulo during the COVID-19 lockdown.
column8: These crimes have not been registered by São Paulo state police. Locals claim not to have seen anything that has been described in the audio file.

column2: A picture of a queue in a Bom Prato (a chain of state run popular restaurants that offers low cost meals to poor people in São Paulo). The caption states that João Dória, São Paulo governor, opened the restaurants and allowed the agglomeration, while, at the same time, forbade regular restaurant to open.
column8: The picture was published on January 2019. While Doria did open the Bom Prato restaurants, people are only allowed to take away their food. The same rule applies to regular restaurants.

column2: Amid COVID19 Lockdown Food being distributed in Indian State of Tamil Nadu.
column8: It's an old image from Gambia (West Africa)

column2: A video is being shared on various social media platforms and in WhatsApp groups in which a person allegedly infected with COVID-19 can be seen lying unconscious on the ground and shaking violently.
column8: According to the testimony of a doctor working in the hospital, the person shown in the video is not infected with the COVID-19 but epilepsy attack, it can be concluded that the video is being shared with a ‘Misleading’ claim.

column2: A Whatsapp forward claiming all calls will be recorded by the Indian government..
column8: The message is not from the government, Assam police has clarified it via their Twitter handle.

column2: Image showing Indian Political party (DMK) workers demonstrating with Go Corona Back balloon.
column8: The image of the balloon is edited to add "Corona" instead of "P.M Modi" and Its an old image.

column2: Two WhatsApp audio files claim that gangs of roughly 30 drug addicts are looting shops and terrorizing workers in central São Paulo during the COVID-19 lockdown.
column8: These crimes have not been registered by São Paulo state police. Locals claim not to have seen anything that has been described in the audio file.

column2: Video of a man who committed suicide in US due to COVID-19
column8: It's an old video from Ghana. It has got nothing to do with COVID-19.

column2: misplaced A video that shows the dead bodies being taken away in a convoy of cars is from a hospital in Iran.
column8: The viral video doing rounds on social media claiming that this is a scene outside a hospital in Iran due to the novel coronavirus is false. The viral video is of a funeral procession for pilgrims who died during Hajj in 2019.

column2: Muslim youth is spreading COVID-19 by licking plates in Nizzamuddin Markaz in India.
column8: The video is 2 years old. and the people in the video belongs to Dawoodi Bohra society. In their tradition dishes are washed only after eating and licking the utensils. This is done so that no food grains are wasted.

column2: A picture of a queue in a Bom Prato (a chain of state run popular restaurants that offers low cost meals to poor people in São Paulo). The caption states that João Dória, São Paulo governor, opened the restaurants and allowed the agglomeration, while, at the same time, forbade regular restaurant to open.
column8: The picture was published on January 2019. While Doria did open the Bom Prato restaurants, people are only allowed to take away their food. The same rule applies to regular restaurants.

column2: A viral screenshot of a story allegedly published by the BBC claiming Ghana has recorded its first confirmed coronavirus case.
column8: It was denied by the BBC correspondent in Ghana and the Ghana Health Service. We found that the misinformers modified the HTML codes from the BBC website to create the false headline and story.

column2: Homemade masks prevent the spread of coronavirus.
column8: The claim is false; the photos actually show the aftermath of a strong earthquake that hit the Croatian capital of Zagreb in March 2020.

column2: A video of food packets deposited on a street has been viewed millions of times on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim it shows food donations for people in Turkey during a novel coronavirus lockdown.
column8: The claim is false; the video shows donations for victims of a deadly earthquake that struck eastern Turkey in January 2020, almost two months before Turkey recorded its first case of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.

column2: A photo of a Sri Lankan military hospital has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts alongside a claim that it has been reserved exclusively for the use of “VIPs” who test positive for COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus.
column8: The claim is misleading; Sri Lankan military and hospital authorities told AFP that the military hospital and the country's other medical facilities are being prepared for all COVID-19 patients.

column2: A photo of a man and woman embracing has been shared hundreds of times on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim that it shows two Italian doctors who died of a novel coronavirus, COVID-19, after contracting the disease from the patients they treated.
column8: The claim is false; this is an Associated Press photo of a couple kissing at an airport in Barcelona, Spain.

column2: A photo of a Sri Lankan military hospital has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts alongside a claim that it has been reserved exclusively for the use of “VIPs” who test positive for COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus.
column8: The claim is misleading; Sri Lankan military and hospital authorities told AFP that the military hospital and the country's other medical facilities are being prepared for all COVID-19 patients.

column2: A video of food packets deposited on a street has been viewed millions of times on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim it shows food donations for people in Turkey during a novel coronavirus lockdown.
column8: The claim is false; the video shows donations for victims of a deadly earthquake that struck eastern Turkey in January 2020, almost two months before Turkey recorded its first case of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.

column2: Homemade masks prevent the spread of coronavirus.
column8: The claim is false; the photos actually show the aftermath of a strong earthquake that hit the Croatian capital of Zagreb in March 2020.

column2: A claim that 500 body bags were delivered to an ice skating rink outside the Australian city of Adelaide has been shared widely on Facebook during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; South Australian health authorities said the claim is a “myth” and a spokesperson for the local ice rink said “the rumour is completely false”.

column2: Mariano Rajoy, Esperanza Aguirre or Christine Lagarde have said that if pensioners died the world would save money.
column8: Neither the former president of Spain, the former president of Madrid or the former director of the International Monetary Fund have said that if pensioners died it would be a saving for the world economy.

column2: A video has been viewed hundreds of times in multiple social media posts alongside a claim it shows Chinese Muslims performing a communal Friday prayer in a mosque despite the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; the video has circulated in reports about Muslims performing a mass prayer at a mosque in the western Chinese city of Xining in 2011, nine years before the novel coronavirus outbreak.

column2: Spanish hospitals are injecting MMS to COVID-19 patients to cure them.
column8: The Spanish Ministry of Health denies that MMS is being used in Spanish hospitals by injecting it into the vein against the coronavirus. MMS does not cure any disease.

column2: For every click on the Italian song Rinascerò rinascerai, YouTube donates money to a hospital in Bergamo.
column8: YouTube's normal revenue model is in effect for the song; no extra donations are made per click. The singer did declare to donate the song's full returns to the hospital.

column2: The Sanytol brand is sending an email to give away disinfecting wipes.
column8: Sanytol is not offering free samples of disinfecting wipes by email, it is a hoax and it is phishing.

column2: A video shows a truck dropping bodies covered with plastic into a ditch and claiming that this is the situation in Italy right now.
column8: The video which is being widely circulated on social media is not from Italy. It is a movie scene that had been taken from a 2007 US television miniseries 'Pandemic'.

column2: A Whatsapp message offering food for families that the Spanish charity Caritás will donate.
column8: It's false. Caritas will not give 800,000 food aid to families. It is a case of phishing.

column2: Posts on social media claim there is a US patent on the novel coronavirus and a European one for a vaccine, citing specific patent numbers.
column8: This is false; the US number relates to an application about a different coronavirus, and the European number is for a patent aimed at a disease that afflicts poultry.

column2: 5,000 kilos of masks have not been delivered in Zaragoza because customs closes at 3:00 p.m.
column8: A news item from the Spanish media, Okdiario, stated that 5000 kilos of masks that were to arrive in Zaragoza did not enter because customs are closed since 3 in the afternoon. It was denied by the authorities and the package was delivered.

column2: Mariano Rajoy, Esperanza Aguirre or Christine Lagarde have said that if pensioners died the world would save money.
column8: Neither the former president of Spain, the former president of Madrid or the former director of the International Monetary Fund have said that if pensioners died it would be a saving for the world economy.

column2: Facebook posts shared thousands of times recommend various practices to prevent COVID-19, including gargling salt water, drinking tea and avoiding ice cream.
column8: Health experts told AFP there is no evidence to support these claims and say washing your hands regularly is the best way to stay healthy.

column2: Posts shared more than 20,000 times on Facebook feature a photo of a crying child and two others showing a woman and a man in hospital beds, claiming that the boy’s parents are infected with the novel coronavirus
column8: This is false, the pictures do not depict a family and circulated online prior to the COVID-19 pandemic.

column2: The Sanytol brand is sending an email to give away disinfecting wipes.
column8: Sanytol is not offering free samples of disinfecting wipes by email, it is a hoax and it is phishing.

column2: A Whatsapp message offering food for families that the Spanish charity Caritás will donate.
column8: It's false. Caritas will not give 800,000 food aid to families. It is a case of phishing.

column2: A video has been viewed hundreds of times in multiple social media posts alongside a claim it shows Chinese Muslims performing a communal Friday prayer in a mosque despite the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; the video has circulated in reports about Muslims performing a mass prayer at a mosque in the western Chinese city of Xining in 2011, nine years before the novel coronavirus outbreak.

column2: A video shows a truck dropping bodies covered with plastic into a ditch and claiming that this is the situation in Italy right now.
column8: The video which is being widely circulated on social media is not from Italy. It is a movie scene that had been taken from a 2007 US television miniseries 'Pandemic'.

column2: Trupti Desai, a well known social activist from India, was arrested for illegally buying liquor during the Covid19 lockdown.
column8: The video shown with the above claim is 7-months-old. Trupti Desai was detained by the Pune police after she threatened to offer a garland of liquor bottles to then CM Devendra Fadnavis.

column2: Picture of Sao Paulo graveyard, being prepared secretly for Covid 19 victims by Brazil government.
column8: The image is an old image from Manaus in Brazil and is unrelated to recent events due to COVID-19.

column2: “Queen Elizabeth tests positive for COVID-19.”
column8: No credible reports claim that Queen Elizabeth II tested positive for COVID-19. Buckingham Palace recently said she remains in good health.

column2: A viral video showcasing an emergency treatment of a COVID-19 patient in Maharasthra, an Indian State. The video is shared in the names of different cities of Maharashtra.
column8: Our investigation revealed that the video is of a mock-drill conducted at Jabhua city of Madhya Pradesh (different State). It was neither a real patient nor from Maharashtra.

column2: Guatemala Secretary of Economy shared a video where the NYT praises the management of Guatemalan Governement during this COVID-19 crisis.
column8: We talked with the NYT PR department and they denied any relation with that video. The video was completely false.

column2: Indian Home ministry declares posting about COVID-19 on WhatsApp groups a punishable offence.
column8: Indian Home ministry have not issued any such message.

column2: Trupti Desai, a well known social activist from India, was arrested for illegally buying liquor during the Covid19 lockdown.
column8: The video shown with the above claim is 7-months-old. Trupti Desai was detained by the Pune police after she threatened to offer a garland of liquor bottles to then CM Devendra Fadnavis.

column2: Image of piles of money scattered on the street and a text saying that “Italian people are throwing money on the streets as a reminder that money can’t buy everything, as exemplified by the COVID-19 pandemic”
column8: Actually, the pictures were taken in Venezuela in 2019, after a bank robbery. The currency had changed and those bills were worthless

column2: A businessman from Brazil killed himself after firing 223 employees due to the current crisis.
column8: The story happened in 2016. A businessman commited suicide after firing 223 employees. It is not clear whether this was the actual reason, since he was also being prosecuted for massive tax evasion.

column2: Is there a censorship against the use of chloroquine as a treatment.
column8: French scientst promoting chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine have created not only enthusiasm for this "treatment", but also acusations that the French government or the Big Pharma, are hiding this cure.

column2: Says COVID-19 remains in the air for eight hours and that everyone is now required to wear masks “everywhere.”
column8: There are different definitions of what is considered “airborne,” and while COVID-19 is spread through the air via droplets, it isn’t believed to be as transmissible as typical airborne illnesses, such as measles. There is no evidence that the virus stays in the air for eight hours and there is no requirement for “everyone” to wear masks everywhere.

column2: “Queen Elizabeth tests positive for COVID-19.”
column8: No credible reports claim that Queen Elizabeth II tested positive for COVID-19. Buckingham Palace recently said she remains in good health.

column2: Video of kids from Italy yelling at stars assuming them to be their dead mother.
column8: It's an old video from El Salvador and has no connection with recent events in Italy.

column2: Video of Al-Aqsa mosque after Israel allows photography inside it.
column8: The video is not of Al-Aqsa in Jerusalem but Cave of the Patriarchs in Hebron.

column2: Posting anything on coronavirus will be a punishable offence because Disaster Management Act has been implemented.
column8: As per the Disaster Management Act, there is no provision that mentions that apart from government departments, no other citizen can be allowed to talk, update or share any news related to a disaster.

column2: Chewing betel nut can prevent covid-19 infection.
column8: WHO has iterated that while some traditional medicines, western medicines, and home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms of COVID-19, there is no evidence of a single medicine to prevent COVID-19 currently. WHO has confirmed that betel nut is carcinogenic.

column2: Image of herd of deer sitting on a street interpreted as different locations in Sri Lanka and India.
column8: Original image of the herd of deer on streets belong to an old incident in Nara, Japan.

column2: Indian Home ministry declares posting about COVID-19 on WhatsApp groups a punishable offence.
column8: Indian Home ministry have not issued any such message.

column2: A viral video showcasing an emergency treatment of a COVID-19 patient in Maharasthra, an Indian State. The video is shared in the names of different cities of Maharashtra.
column8: Our investigation revealed that the video is of a mock-drill conducted at Jabhua city of Madhya Pradesh (different State). It was neither a real patient nor from Maharashtra.

column2: While China built a hospital for 1 thousand people in 10 days and everyone cheered, the Brazilian Army built field hospitals for 2 thousand COVID-19 patients in only 48 hours, and nobody cared.
column8: Since the beginning of the crisis, the Brazilian Army helped to build one field hospital in Roraima with 80 beds, not 2 thousand. It took more than 48 hours to build and it is still not open. The Army also started working on adapting a hangar to serve as a hospital for COVID-19 patients, but the expected capacity is 70 patients.

column2: The United States are “recruiting” doctors to confront COVID-19.
column8: The U.S. Embassy in Havana wishes to clarify that the US it is not recruiting foreign medical professionals to assist in the response to COVID-19. The announcement only covers individuals already approved and notified by the Department of Homeland Security

column2: The Disaster Management Act 2005 is going to be implemented in India, according to which no citizen is allowed to post any update or share any forward related to COVID-19.
column8: There is no such restriction on citizens to share any news or updates about the COVID-19 situation, as long as it is not false information.

column2: Alleged resignation of the ministry of health in Costa Rica.
column8: "It is absolutely false", confirmed the Minister of Communication, Nancy Marín, to La Nación.

column2: RAI TV news report from 2015. proves SARS-CoV-2 was made in a Chinese laboratory
column8: The news report in question was not related to SARS-CoV-2.

column2: Video of empty hospitals is proof that the pandemic is not real.
column8: Hosiptal in Bologna confirms that the claim is false.

column2: The United States are “recruiting” doctors to confront COVID-19.
column8: The U.S. Embassy in Havana wishes to clarify that the US it is not recruiting foreign medical professionals to assist in the response to COVID-19. The announcement only covers individuals already approved and notified by the Department of Homeland Security

column2: People who got a flu shot are at a greater risk from Covid-19.
column8: There is no evidence that a flu vaccine makes things worse for COVID-19 patients.

column2: partly Sneezing spreads droplets as far as 8 meters, and these droplets can stay suspended in the air for up to 24 hours. The velocity of sneezing is up to 35 meters per second.
column8: How long the coronavirus survives in the air depends on temperature, humidity, and the level of ventilation of the environment. Although droplets can travel and suspend in the air for a long time, the virus doesn't.

column2: Muammar Gaddafi predicted “they” will create viruses and sell us the cures.
column8: Gaddafi has not made the claim that's being attributed to him.

column2: The video says that Italian elderly over 65 are taken into custody ; Spanish elderly are asked not to leave home, and violators will be sent to a concentration camp.
column8: The video documents the violent arresting action toward protesters, which was conducted by the police in Baku, Azerbaijan, on October 19, 2019.

column2: Covid-19 pandemic is being used as an excuse to put microchips into babies.
column8: It's an old false claim, in circulation since 2014.

column2: People older than 60 not given medical help in Italy anymore.
column8: Italian doctors are treating as many patients as they can manage, regardless of their age.

column2: Christine Lagarde admits that something must be done about old people living for too long.
column8: C. Lagarde has never made the statment that is being attributed to her.

column2: 5G is the cause of the coronavirus pandemic.
column8: Neither 5G nor other means of electromagnetic transmission are causing virus epidemics.

column2: Covid-19 is no more harmful than the common cold.
column8: There is numerous evidence that COVID-19 is much more dangerous than the common cold.

column2: Covid-19 no longer considered a dangerous disease in the UK.
column8: The false claims misrepresents UK's system for disease classification.

column2: Covid-19 no longer considered a dangerous disease in the UK.
column8: The false claims misrepresents UK's system for disease classification.

column2: Covid-19 is no more harmful than the common cold.
column8: There is numerous evidence that COVID-19 is much more dangerous than the common cold.

column2: Christine Lagarde admits that something must be done about old people living for too long.
column8: C. Lagarde has never made the statment that is being attributed to her.

column2: Costa Rica is at the peak stage of the virus.
column8: Health authorities and experts explain that it is impossible to determine exactly when the maximum point of infections of the novel coronavirus will appear.

column2: A trucker assures in a video that he transports material to France and that it does not arrive in Spain because the Government does not pay for it.
column8: The material that was sent to France was not for hospitals but office supplies.

column2: Putin had a press conference and gave people a choice between 15 days isolation and 5 years in prison.
column8: Putin never held a press conference where he made such a statement.

column2: The Government is not getting the test to detect COVID-19 from the company Genomica because it is run by the sister of a former opposition minister.
column8: The Ministry of Health has acquired the Genomica tests and also those of Cestest, another Spanish company cited in the viral messages. None produces quick tests, but kits to do PCR tests.

column2: Croatia to be put in “total quarantine” due to secret deal between authorities and Red Cross.
column8: Red Cross doesn't have anything to do with implementing quarantine rules, nor did they attend a secret meeting with the Croatian government.

column2: Iranian child celebrity Anahita is sufferenig from COVID-19.
column8: The family of the girl denied the claim on the girl's instagram account. the girl also appeared on a video 30/3/2020 and is appearing healthy.

column2: Castilla La-Mancha prohibits the use of adapted diving masks in patients with COVID-19.
column8: The Castilla-La Mancha Health Service ensures that its use "is left to the professionals' discretion".

column2: A new born baby suffering from birth defects predicted that using Turmeric can cure Coronavirus in India.
column8: The baby was suffering from Anencephaly and was stillborn and has no connection with COVID-19.

column2: Home Ministry of India have issued an order that sharing of any news related to Coronavirus is an punishable offense under the IT Act.
column8: The viral order is fake and was not issued by the Home Ministry of India.

column2: Viral message claiming that disinfection will be conducted with the usage of helicopters in Poland.
column8: It was debunked by local authorities.

column2: Arbido is a miracle cure for Covid-19.
column8: Arbidol is among the drugs being tested to see if it can help in treating COVID-19 but there's no proof it can cure the disease.

column2: There is an old undocumented man that  “does not remember anything” hospitalized in the “La Paz Hospital”.
column8: The image was viralized in 2017 related with the same history, is not from now.

column2: Home Ministry of India have issued an order that sharing of any news related to Coronavirus is an punishable offense under the IT Act.
column8: The viral order is fake and was not issued by the Home Ministry of India.

column2: Antibiotic invented in Croatia cures coronavirus.
column8: There's no proof that the antibiotic in question has any effect against COVID-19.

column2: Viral message claiming that disinfection will be conducted with the usage of helicopters in Poland.
column8: It was debunked by local authorities.

column2: The father of Pablo Iglesias, vice-president of Spain, is hospitalized at the Clinical Hospital of Salamanca, (the photo is from 2016).
column8: The image is from 2016.

column2: All communications between citizens will now be recorded by the government in France.
column8: It's a message that already existed in 2017. Spread in several languages, in 20+ countries.

column2: A new born baby suffering from birth defects predicted that using Turmeric can cure Coronavirus in India.
column8: The baby was suffering from Anencephaly and was stillborn and has no connection with COVID-19.

column2: Iranian child celebrity Anahita is sufferenig from COVID-19.
column8: The family of the girl denied the claim on the girl's instagram account. the girl also appeared on a video 30/3/2020 and is appearing healthy.

column2: Hydroxychloroquine and Azithromycin are a cure for Covid-19.
column8: There are hopeful trials but they are small, early and have methodological issues raised by experts. There is no controlled clinical trial. Some trials are ongoing.

column2: PM Modi announced internet suspension due to viral fake news related to COVID-19.
column8: The news bulletin image is digitally edited. No announcement of Internet ban was announced by PM Modi.

column2: UN is giving humanitarian aid in coronavirus emergency.
column8: UN is not delivering food aid. The message is a phishing scam.

column2: Rubbing mustard oil on your nostrils can prevent Coronavirus.
column8: Rubbing mustard oil cannot prevent coronavirus.

column2: Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte broke down amid Covid19 deaths in his country.
column8: The image in question is old. The man in the image is not Italy’s Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte but shows Brazil’s President Jair Bolsonaro who was overwhelmed while speaking about an attack on him

column2: Spraying with boilling water eliminates coronavirus.
column8: There is no scientific evidence that proves that boiling water eliminates the new coronavirus.

column2: WHO reported that Coronavirus lasts upto 8 hours on cabbages thus, cabbage consumption should be restricted.
column8: WHO did not publish any such report.

column2: Indian Army has built a 1,000-bed hospital in Rajasthan in eight days for the treatment of COVID-19.
column8: The Indian Army has mentioned that the news that it is building a thousand-bed hospital for the treatment of COVID-19 in Barmer (Rajasthan) is false. Also, the photos in the post are old.

column2: Rubbing mustard oil on your nostrils can prevent Coronavirus.
column8: Rubbing mustard oil cannot prevent coronavirus.

column2: Photo of Deer on Ooty-Coimbatore road during the current lockdown (COVID-19).
column8: It is an old photo. The photo is on the internet atleast since 2014. It was taken in Japan, not in India.

column2: Video of Police strictly implementing lockdown in Spain.
column8: The video is not related to COVID-19 lockdown in any country. The video shows Azerbaizan Police (not Spain) dispersing a protest in October 2019.

column2: Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte broke down amid Covid19 deaths in his country.
column8: The image in question is old. The man in the image is not Italy’s Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte but shows Brazil’s President Jair Bolsonaro who was overwhelmed while speaking about an attack on him

column2: PM Modi on 2nd April ’20 announced extension of nationwide lockdown till 4 May 2020.
column8: PM Modi has not made any announcement for extension of nationwide lockdown till 4 May 2020. The image is digitally edited.

column2: PM Modi announced internet suspension due to viral fake news related to COVID-19.
column8: The news bulletin image is digitally edited. No announcement of Internet ban was announced by PM Modi.

column2: “Mainstream media” used photo from 2017 movie as an image from Italy’s coronavirus morgue.
column8: The original photo is from a 2013 news report showing an airport hangar filled with coffins of African migrants who died in a shipwreck near an Italian island. It has not appeared in any recent media reports.

column2: Governors across U.S. are announcing that the current school year will be repeated due to coronavirus school closings.
column8: The posts are April Fool's jokes, created using a prank-generating website to make fake headlines.

column2: UN is giving humanitarian aid in coronavirus emergency.
column8: UN is not delivering food aid. The message is a phishing scam.

column2: A video of a man committing suicide by jumping from a hotel in Italy as his entire family died due to coronavirus.
column8: The video has been on the internet since December 2019. But, the first death due to COVID-19 was reported in January, 2020. So, there is no relation between the video and COVID-19. Also, the hotel in the video is in Spain.

column2: WHO reported that Coronavirus lasts upto 8 hours on cabbages thus, cabbage consumption should be restricted.
column8: WHO did not publish any such report.

column2: The executive order to restrict worship in South Korea for prevention of epidemics is religious oppression.
column8: It is possible to forbid by Korean infectious disease prevention law.

column2: Video of Muslims gathered on roads despite the curfew to curb the spread of Coronavirus.
column8: The video is from Ahmedabad (Gujarat) and was taken in December 2019. So, the video is of an incident that took place prior to the announcement of lockdown in Gujarat.

column2: India TV telecasted news that Bollywood Actor Shahrukh Khan donated 450 million (45 Crore) Rupees to Pakistan Oil tanker blast victims.
column8: The video is a clipped version of India TV’s fact-check video. In the original fact-check video, India TV has debunked the same claim and concluded that Shahrukh has not made any donation to Pakistan Oil tanker blast victims.

column2: People of Italy throwing money on the streets as they felt that the money couldn’t save them from COVID-19.
column8: The photos are not related to the recent COVID-19 outbreak. They were taken in Venezeula, not in Italy. Some people threw the notes as they became valueless due to hyperinflation in the country.

column2: It is possible to self-diagnosis by holding breath for 10 second.
column8: There is no medical evidence for this.

column2: The flight which was chartered for Korean people by the Korean government only served Chinese people?
column8: It turned out to be a chartered flight for Chinese people by a Chinese travel agency.

column2: Person who fainted at a subway station has Covid-19.
column8: It was not. It was another disease.

column2: There is no way to forbid religious gatehrings temporarily in South Korea to prevent the virus from spreading.
column8: They can be forbidden by the Korean infectious disease prevention law.

column2: Crackdown on drunken driving stopped due to risk of Covid-19 transmission
column8: The crackdown is ongoing ; it's a separate operation.

column2: The covid-19 test kits from a Korean company are deemed suspicious by U.S. Congress.
column8: Not true. Some Korean media reported this because of a translation error.

column2: Ministry of Economy and Finance in South Korea and pharmaceutical companies had a secret meeting.
column8: There was no meeting.

column2: Video of Muslims gathered on roads despite the curfew to curb the spread of Coronavirus.
column8: The video is from Ahmedabad (Gujarat) and was taken in December 2019. So, the video is of an incident that took place prior to the announcement of lockdown in Gujarat.

column2: Vitamin C can cure covid-19.
column8: Not based on medical evidence.

column2: Quarantined person fled from a facility in Daegu south Korea?
column8: The photos are manipulated.

column2: Koreans who were on the cruiseship ‘Diamond Princess’ cannot be brought back.
column8: It is possible by negotiating with Government of Japan.

column2: India TV telecasted news that Bollywood Actor Shahrukh Khan donated 450 million (45 Crore) Rupees to Pakistan Oil tanker blast victims.
column8: The video is a clipped version of India TV’s fact-check video. In the original fact-check video, India TV has debunked the same claim and concluded that Shahrukh has not made any donation to Pakistan Oil tanker blast victims.

column2: Video of Police strictly implementing lockdown in Spain.
column8: The video is not related to COVID-19 lockdown in any country. The video shows Azerbaizan Police (not Spain) dispersing a protest in October 2019.

column2: Video of a person infected with coronavirus comitting suicide in New York.
column8: The video was taken in 2015. It shows a pregnant woman jumping off a building top after finding that her husband was having an affair with her mother.

column2: Photo of Kanika Kapoor meeting Prince Charles during her recent visit to United Kingdom. Prince Charles was tested positive for coronavirus just after the meet.
column8: The photo was taken in 2015 when singer Kanika Kapoor attended the Elephant family charity, 'Travels to my Elephant', hosted by Prince Charles and Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall.

column2: Crackdown on drunken driving stopped due to risk of Covid-19 transmission
column8: The crackdown is ongoing ; it's a separate operation.

column2: People from Wuhan share a laundry room although they are in quarantine.
column8: People in Wuhan should clean their clothes in their room, by themselves.

column2: South Korean presidential Blue House forbids the term ‘Wuhan pneumonia’.
column8: It was based on guidance of calling infectious desease from WHO.

column2: A video has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook which claim it shows bodies of novel coronavirus victims being thrown into a ditch in Italy.
column8: The claim is false; the footage was taken from the 2007 US television programme Pandemic.

column2: Multiple articles widely shared on Facebook claim that 59 church members died after drinking household disinfectant which their pastor said would prevent coronavirus infections.
column8: The claims, although based on an old story, are false -- South African police denied any current investigations on their part.

column2: A post has been shared multiple times on Facebook in March 2020 that claims China and Japan are “free” of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.
column8: The claim is false; data from the World Health Organization (WHO) shows new cases continue to be reported in both countries.

column2: A claim that a trolley collector at a supermarket in the Australian state of New South Wales tested positive for the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, in March 2020 has been shared hundreds of times in multiple posts on Facebook.
column8: The claim is false; the shopping centre where the supermarket is located said that it had no confirmed COVID-19 cases in March 2020; local health officials in New South Wales also did not report any confirmed cases in the suburb cited in the misleading Facebook posts in the final days of March.

column2: A post that said coronavirus “was released by the Chinese Communist Party” and that is a mixture of HIV and tuberculosis.
column8: There is no evidence that the coronavirus was created in a laboratory and it is proven that its incubation period is 14 days and not 27, as the text states.

column2: A message that offers food assistance to people at risk of social exclusion in Spain.
column8: A WhatsApp chain says that due to the coronavirus quarantine they are "granting the new food card bonuses" with "initial benefits of 550.65 ₤". It is phishing.

column2: A photo has been shared hundreds of times in multiple Facebook posts alongside a claim that it shows a hospital car park in Singapore which will be converted into wards during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is misleading; the hospital clarified its car park would temporarily be used to test patients suspected to have been infected with the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, but it would not be converted into “wards”.

column2: Novel coronavirus came to South Korea through yellow sand storm.
column8: The virus dies after staying in the air for some time.

column2: A photo of a group of people holding a banner that bears the Chinese and Malaysian flags has been shared thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it shows Chinese doctors arriving in Malaysia to combat the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: The claim is misleading; the photo actually shows medical supplies donated by China that were delivered to a hospital in Malaysia.

column2: Seven photos have been shared repeatedly in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter, alongside a claim that they show vegetables donated to disadvantaged people during a curfew prompted by the novel coronavirus pandemic in Sri Lanka.
column8: The photos have been shared in a misleading context; they actually show vegetables being donated at an event in southern Sri Lanka in August 2019, more than eight months before the curfew was implemented.

column2: A video has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook which claim it shows bodies of novel coronavirus victims being thrown into a ditch in Italy.
column8: The claim is false; the footage was taken from the 2007 US television programme Pandemic.

column2: A claim that a trolley collector at a supermarket in the Australian state of New South Wales tested positive for the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, in March 2020 has been shared hundreds of times in multiple posts on Facebook.
column8: The claim is false; the shopping centre where the supermarket is located said that it had no confirmed COVID-19 cases in March 2020; local health officials in New South Wales also did not report any confirmed cases in the suburb cited in the misleading Facebook posts in the final days of March.

column2: A photo of a group of people holding a banner that bears the Chinese and Malaysian flags has been shared thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it shows Chinese doctors arriving in Malaysia to combat the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: The claim is misleading; the photo actually shows medical supplies donated by China that were delivered to a hospital in Malaysia.

column2: A photo has been shared hundreds of times in multiple Facebook posts alongside a claim that it shows a hospital car park in Singapore which will be converted into wards during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is misleading; the hospital clarified its car park would temporarily be used to test patients suspected to have been infected with the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, but it would not be converted into “wards”.

column2: A claim has circulated in multiple Facebook, Twitter and YouTube that a “new virus” named hantavirus has emerged in China in March 2020. The posts were viewed hundreds of thousands of times as the world battled the spread of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.
column8: The claim is false; scientists say hantavirus is not a new virus and was first detected during the Korean War in the 1950s; the US-based Centre for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) says the virus has almost exclusively been found to pass from rodents to humans, rather than from person to person.

column2: A 9 minute viral video in a woman claims India has entered stage-3 of COVID-19. She claims that her husband is employed with a major news channel and the information was passed to him by some Dr.Gyani who heads the Indian Covid team and asks people to stock up on food, medicines and baby food for one month. She also cautions people about the Army being deployed to enforce a strict lockdown in the upcoming days.
column8: Our investigation revealed that the claims made in the video are false and baseless. Dr. Gyani, an expert mentioned in the video as a source of the information, denied the claims and deemed the video as completely false. Also, the Indian government has already clarified that messages about Army deployment during the lockdown are false.

column2: partially A table comparing COVID-19 stats for countries that did impose lockdown against countries that didn’t.
column8: Although the numbers are accurate, some of the countries marked as "not on lockdown" are actually on lockdown. Also, the comparison ignores all other factors, including initial response and current stage.

column2: Video shows the suicide of an American man because he is affected by coronavirus.
column8: The video is from a suicide from 2015 of a 37 year old American man at Center City’s Embassy Suites Hotel in Philadelphia.

column2: An inmate who was released from prison under COVID-19 “humanitarian house arrests” was arrested again in Campo Bom. Police officers found more than 100 kg of cocaine in his house, and several guns.
column8: Campo Bom police officers did arrest a former inmate with 100 kg of cocaine in his house. His prior release had nothing to do with COVID-19. Actually, he had finished serving his term.

column2: Government of an Indian state Madhya Pradesh ordered shoot-at-sight to enforce lockdown.
column8: Our research revealed that a screenshot of a news channel report is circulating without context. MP government has not given any such order. MP government and Jabalpur police clarified it on Twitter.

column2: Myanmar president and state counselor are under 14 days quarantine after meeting with COVID-19 patient from Switzerland.
column8: State counselor addressed about the COVID-19 updates few hours the post is published. President office spoke person U Zaw Htay has also confirmed to media that both president and state counselor is not in quarantine.

column2: Indian State of Kerala’s government is paying news channels to telecast CM’s interview.
column8: All these claims are raised by using some screenshots of sponsored posts in Asianet News fb page & some pics of CM's press meet which is broadcasted in different tv channels with a sponsored tag. But the fact is the sponsored program is not CM's press meet. That's a program called 'Naam Munnottu' to give awareness about the government's different projects and also to interact with the CM. The last episode was about Kerala's hard work to eradicate corona & for that they used a one minute portion from CM's press meet video. That pics was used in the fb post claiming gov giving money to channels to retelecast the press meet.

column2: An image of a doctor goes viral with the claim that Dr. Usman Riyaz died while treating coronavirus patients in Delhi, India.
column8: he photo that has been gone viral is of Dr. Riyaz Usman from Dubai. He is alive and healthy. He does not work in Delhi. He has put out a Facebook post rubbishing the rumors of his death. We also found that one Dr. Osman Riyaz has died in Pakistan due to COVID-19. We also confirmed with Delhi Health Department that no doctor has been died due to coronavirus in Delhi.

column2: João Doria, governor of São Paulo, forbade doctors to give chloroquine to COVID-19 patients.
column8: Authorization for medication use in Brazil is not under state jurisdiction, but federal jurisdiction. Doctors are allowed to prescribe chloroquine for patients with severe cases of COVID-19 in Brazil since March 27. It is not different in São Paulo.

column2: João Doria, governor of São Paulo, forbade doctors to give chloroquine to COVID-19 patients.
column8: Authorization for medication use in Brazil is not under state jurisdiction, but federal jurisdiction. Doctors are allowed to prescribe chloroquine for patients with severe cases of COVID-19 in Brazil since March 27. It is not different in São Paulo.

column2: A 9 minute viral video in a woman claims India has entered stage-3 of COVID-19. She claims that her husband is employed with a major news channel and the information was passed to him by some Dr.Gyani who heads the Indian Covid team and asks people to stock up on food, medicines and baby food for one month. She also cautions people about the Army being deployed to enforce a strict lockdown in the upcoming days.
column8: Our investigation revealed that the claims made in the video are false and baseless. Dr. Gyani, an expert mentioned in the video as a source of the information, denied the claims and deemed the video as completely false. Also, the Indian government has already clarified that messages about Army deployment during the lockdown are false.

column2: Actor Vijay donated 3 billion (300 crore) rupees for coronavirus relief.
column8: It is fake news claimed using a fake news card of Dinamalar news channel. The channel has denied broadcasting such news.

column2: Last picture of Indonesian doctor Hadio Alo bidding farewell to his family.
column8: This image was uploaded in Malaysia and this is not related to Indonesia.

column2: Images of money thrown on streets by helpless Italians.
column8: Old image from Venezuela shared with false context.

column2: Indian State of Kerala’s government is paying news channels to telecast CM’s interview.
column8: All these claims are raised by using some screenshots of sponsored posts in Asianet News fb page & some pics of CM's press meet which is broadcasted in different tv channels with a sponsored tag. But the fact is the sponsored program is not CM's press meet. That's a program called 'Naam Munnottu' to give awareness about the government's different projects and also to interact with the CM. The last episode was about Kerala's hard work to eradicate corona & for that they used a one minute portion from CM's press meet video. That pics was used in the fb post claiming gov giving money to channels to retelecast the press meet.

column2: An inmate who was released from prison under COVID-19 “humanitarian house arrests” was arrested again in Campo Bom. Police officers found more than 100 kg of cocaine in his house, and several guns.
column8: Campo Bom police officers did arrest a former inmate with 100 kg of cocaine in his house. His prior release had nothing to do with COVID-19. Actually, he had finished serving his term.

column2: Russia released 500 lions to ensure people would stay inside houses.
column8: This photo was is from 2016, South Africa, part of a movie production.

column2: partially A table comparing COVID-19 stats for countries that did impose lockdown against countries that didn’t.
column8: Although the numbers are accurate, some of the countries marked as "not on lockdown" are actually on lockdown. Also, the comparison ignores all other factors, including initial response and current stage.

column2: Myanmar president and state counselor are under 14 days quarantine after meeting with COVID-19 patient from Switzerland.
column8: State counselor addressed about the COVID-19 updates few hours the post is published. President office spoke person U Zaw Htay has also confirmed to media that both president and state counselor is not in quarantine.

column2: Government of an Indian state Madhya Pradesh ordered shoot-at-sight to enforce lockdown.
column8: Our research revealed that a screenshot of a news channel report is circulating without context. MP government has not given any such order. MP government and Jabalpur police clarified it on Twitter.

column2: Two men identified as “the owner of Carrefour” supermarkets in Brazil in videos where they criticized lockdown measures.
column8: The largest shareholder of Carrefour holds less than 10% of the shares, so the company does not have a single owner. The men in the videos have no relationship whatsoever with the company.

column2: The COVID-19 epidemic is almost finished in the Netherlands. The government did not close a single shop. Tweeted initially by a former Bolsonaro minister, Osmar Terra, on March 31.
column8: The COVID-19 epidemic is not anywhere near the end in the Netherlands, and the government did impose lockdown measures, although lighter than in neighbouring countries.

column2: Mostly Video of a waitress saying, “I lost my job. But I’ll sleep better knowing” that the coronavirus relief bill included funding for the Kennedy Center, refugee resettlement, PBS, and congressional salaries: “Thanks, Democrats”
column8: The post accurately cites several provisions that are in the coronavirus relief bill passed in late March. But it’s misleading to suggest the financial needs of a laid-off waitress aren’t addressed in the bill.

column2: As of April 1st, all coronavirus patients from Blumenau, Brazil, were cured.
column8: As of April 1st, there were 33 people still sick with COVID-19 in Blumenau.

column2: There no coronavirus in Africa because there is no money there and they cannot get into debt with the International Monetary Fund.
column8: African countries are also being affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, and the IMF is already preparing some financial instruments to support these countries.

column2: A PSOL (Brazilian left-wing oppositon party) state representative was arrested, heavily intoxicated, while attending a party during the COVID-19 lockdown in Niterói, Rio de Janeiro.
column8: The story itself is true, but the man is a member of PSL, Bolsonaro's party until late 2019.

column2: World Health Organization condemned lockdown measures against COVID-19.
column8: WHO did not condemn lockdown. During an interview, Tedros Adhanom Gheybresus acknowledge lockdown measures have serious economic impact, especially on the poor, but he did not say countries with epidemic focuses should abandon it.

column2: Ronaldo Caiado, governor of the Brazilian state Goiás, was beaten up due to his lockdown decrees. A gallery of photos “prove” it.
column8: Pictures that support the claim were taken in 2013, and the man being kicked is just a lookalike.

column2: Medical masks have 2 ways to wear it depending on your purpose: if you are sick, put the white side on your mouth and if you fear infection, wear it the oppisite way.
column8: There is only one correct way to wear the medical masks: colored side on the outside.

column2: Putting eucalyptus (Vicks VapoRub) in the nose prevents COVID-19.
column8: Eucalyptus has some antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties, but is not virucidal and there is no evidence that it fights SARScov-2.

column2: Mostly Video of a waitress saying, “I lost my job. But I’ll sleep better knowing” that the coronavirus relief bill included funding for the Kennedy Center, refugee resettlement, PBS, and congressional salaries: “Thanks, Democrats”
column8: The post accurately cites several provisions that are in the coronavirus relief bill passed in late March. But it’s misleading to suggest the financial needs of a laid-off waitress aren’t addressed in the bill.

column2: Swiss newspaper says president of México is the “worst example” of how COVID-19 is handled.
column8: They manipulated the translation. It really says "Where the coronavirus is most dangerous"

column2: A video of a man, standing at a fresh food distribution center in Contagem, Brazil, claiming there was a shortage of food in Minas Gerais caused by lockdown measures. He claims the video was shot on March 31. ]The video was tweeted by Jair Bolsonaro, who, later, deleted it.
column8: The video was staged. It was shot while the place was being cleaned, so all the food stalls were taken away.

column2: The COVID-19 epidemic is almost finished in the Netherlands. The government did not close a single shop. Tweeted initially by a former Bolsonaro minister, Osmar Terra, on March 31.
column8: The COVID-19 epidemic is not anywhere near the end in the Netherlands, and the government did impose lockdown measures, although lighter than in neighbouring countries.

column2: Two men identified as “the owner of Carrefour” supermarkets in Brazil in videos where they criticized lockdown measures.
column8: The largest shareholder of Carrefour holds less than 10% of the shares, so the company does not have a single owner. The men in the videos have no relationship whatsoever with the company.

column2: China creates meat from the dead bodies of coronavirus victims and transport them to Africa.
column8: The photos used in the claim came from different sources: 1. some from a store in london was selling for Resident Evil game 2. most images are sculptures made from bread  3. some photos are from burying ritual in China.

column2: Video shows Italy turns to Islam after giving up by the Italian authoritis
column8: The video is from Hamburg protest in Germany in solidarity with Uyghurs, which was held 18 january 2020.

column2: The video of unprecedented stone rain in Rome suggests the fate of pro-communist Italy.
column8: The video shows hail filmed in Zalau, Romania, on May 28. 2019.

column2: A boy is called COVID-19 in Monterrey, Mexico.
column8: Until March 18 we do not have records of people bearing that name in Monterrey, México.

column2: Before reaching the lungs, The coronavirus remains in the throat for three or four days and at this time the person begins to cough and have sore throats. If you drink a lot of water and gargle with warm water and salt or vinegar, remove the virus.
column8: The WHO does not include among its recommendations drinking or gargling with any liquid as a prevention method. Also, that can damage the throat.

column2: The photo of a porn actor used to pass as a health professional.
column8: Several publications on Facebook and Twitter, some with up to 24 thousand interactions, present Ángel Muñoz, popularly known as "Jordi el Niño Polla", as part of various teams to deal with the pandemic due to the new coronavirus.

column2: Video shows a supermarket in Louisiana had a breakdown: people were plundering goods with armed soldiers onsite.
column8: The video documented that Mexican people were robbing a supermarket to protest against the raise to gasoline in January 2017.

column2: Drinking alcohol beverages can help prevent COVID-19.
column8: Photo being spread online is of is a fake hospital news release saying alcoholic beverages would help reduce risk of getting coronavirus.

column2: Video shows that the Italian government/ Brisbane police used zombie robots/ drones to chase their citizen and make them stay home.
column8: The video was a prank scene filmed in 2016 in Brazil.

column2: Vladimir Putin says that world leaders are trying to reduce the population.
column8: The Spanish subtitles are manipulated and the video is from 2016.

column2: Kids are not allowed to say goodbye to their parents before being hospitalized for COVID-19.
column8: Kids are allowed to say googbye to their families. If they die, 5 to 10 people are allowed at the funeral.

column2: List of UNICEF recommendations against COVID-19 includes drinking hot water.
column8: All the recommendations issued by Unicef are focused on the care of children and families during the pandemic. None of those included in the viral chain belong to or were cited by Unicef.

column2: List of UNICEF recommendations against COVID-19 includes drinking hot water.
column8: All the recommendations issued by Unicef are focused on the care of children and families during the pandemic. None of those included in the viral chain belong to or were cited by Unicef.

column2: Kids are not allowed to say goodbye to their parents before being hospitalized for COVID-19.
column8: Kids are allowed to say googbye to their families. If they die, 5 to 10 people are allowed at the funeral.

column2: Lukewarm water with lemon or water with lemon and bicarbonate are preventive measures for COVID-19.
column8: There is no scientific evidence that hot water or vitamin C prevents COVID-19.

column2: Vladimir Putin says that world leaders are trying to reduce the population.
column8: The Spanish subtitles are manipulated and the video is from 2016.

column2: People will not be allowed to organise a funeral for any family members who die of COVID-19. Instead, the State will take care of the disposal of the body.
column8: The rules around funerals have changed as gatherings are currently not allowed, but families are still allowed to look after funeral services for their loved ones without the involvement of the State.

column2: The Irish Prime Minister/Taoiseach Leo Varadkar has urged people not to use the Houseparty video messaging app due to security concerns.
column8: Prime Minister Leo Varadkar never said this. The tweet was doctored and is false. He did not say anything publicly about using Houseparty.

column2: Confidential studies from Universities of New York, USA states that some patients infected with COVID-19 were healed with eucalyptus.
column8: There is no studies with scientific support about the cure of COVID-19.

column2: Mostly The coronavirus is a bioweapon by the USA, says German politician Wolfgang Gedeon in a parliament speech.
column8: International scientists, the WHO and German Robert Koch Institute see strong evidence that the coronavirus is of natural origin and its outbreak related to bats.

column2: Mostly The army is patrolling all the streets, towns and villages in Ireland.
column8: New and unprecedented measures have been introduced to help curb the spread of the coronavirus, but the post false describes that those rules actually are. Police are patrolling parts of the country, but not all of it, and there are no plans at present for the army to patrol the streets.

column2: Mostly By clicking on an italian Youtube song you donate money to a hospital in Bergamo
column8: Direct clicks are not giving out money, but the singer of the song on he video said he would donate proceeds.

column2: Five helicopters are spraying desinfectants over German cities.
column8: There are no helicopters spraying desinfectants over Germany and also no plans to do so.

column2: Leaving half an onion in your home will ‘catch’ the coronavirus and prevent people from getting it.
column8: Onions are not a way to prevent the coronavirus from entering your home. The claim that onions can help prevent illness has been around since the 1930s.

column2: Vitamin C kills viruses.
column8: There is no evidence that vitamin C can kill viruses or helps against COVID-19.

column2: Doctors and nurses in Italy are dying and are lying dead on the ground due to the Coronavirus outbreak.
column8: The image does not depict dead doctors and nurses in Italy. It is a part of a demonstration by youngsters to spread awareness about coronavirus in Bogota.

column2: Bolivian education, Minister Victor Hugo Cárdenas, said: “Students will repeat the school year”.
column8: The image is edited, Victor Hugo Cardenas actually said: “The COVID-19 is going to affect our school calendar, let's wait that this interruption will be short and the classes can resume normaly to make the readjustment to the scholar calendar.

column2: Doctors and nurses in Italy are dying and are lying dead on the ground due to the Coronavirus outbreak.
column8: The image does not depict dead doctors and nurses in Italy. It is a part of a demonstration by youngsters to spread awareness about coronavirus in Bogota.

column2: If you can hold your breath for more than 10 seconds, you are not infected by coronavirus.
column8: By holding your breath for 10 seconds, you cannot confirm whether you are infected with coronavirus or not.

column2: Vitamin C kills viruses.
column8: There is no evidence that vitamin C can kill viruses or helps against COVID-19.

column2: Mostly The coronavirus is a bioweapon by the USA, says German politician Wolfgang Gedeon in a parliament speech.
column8: International scientists, the WHO and German Robert Koch Institute see strong evidence that the coronavirus is of natural origin and its outbreak related to bats.

column2: Leaving half an onion in your home will ‘catch’ the coronavirus and prevent people from getting it.
column8: Onions are not a way to prevent the coronavirus from entering your home. The claim that onions can help prevent illness has been around since the 1930s.

column2: In India from 24th March 2020 during lockdown all grocery, milk, chemist, vegetable shops will be open from 9.00 am to 11.30 am in the morning and 4.30 pm to 7.00 pm in the evening. Anybody found moving around after this or opening any kind of outlet will be strictly detained by the police. It also claims that no home deliveries will be available.
column8: Delhi Police has clarified that the viral message on social media is Fake.

column2: The Irish Prime Minister/Taoiseach Leo Varadkar has urged people not to use the Houseparty video messaging app due to security concerns.
column8: Prime Minister Leo Varadkar never said this. The tweet was doctored and is false. He did not say anything publicly about using Houseparty.

column2: Five helicopters are spraying desinfectants over German cities.
column8: There are no helicopters spraying desinfectants over Germany and also no plans to do so.

column2: Post claiming that a national-wide committee to prevent, control, and treat COVID-19 led by Myanmar state counselor was dissolved.
column8: The committee dissolved by the announcement made on 31st March from the president office is the central committee for prevention and treatment of COVID-19 led by a union minister, not the committee led by Myanmar state counselors.

column2: Hindu God Ganesha’s idol placed and worshiped inside an Italian Church.
column8: It is an old video of celebration of a Hindu Festival called Ganeshotsav in a Spanish church which is shared with misleading context.

column2: Neem leaves can cure COVID-19.
column8: WHO has iterated that while some traditional medicines, western medicines, and home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms of COVID-19, there is no evidence of a single medicine that treats COVID-19 currently.

column2: No deaths have been reported in Israel due to COVID-19 because they have found a cure for the disease. A solution of hot water, baking soda and lemon is the cure for COVID-19.
column8: There have been 15 deaths in Israel due to COVID-19 plus the solution of lemon, hot water and bicarbonate is not proven to cure COVID-19.

column2: Srilanka’s KDU hospital to be dedicated to treat only VIP COVID19 patients.
column8: Hospital director, Chief Epidemiologist and Defence Secretary all refuted the claim and said the hospital is ready to admit any patient.

column2: Indian Police personel beaten by a person while enforcing lockdown. Claim made through an image.
column8: The image is old and shared out of context to make a false claim.

column2: Post claiming that a national-wide committee to prevent, control, and treat COVID-19 led by Myanmar state counselor was dissolved.
column8: The committee dissolved by the announcement made on 31st March from the president office is the central committee for prevention and treatment of COVID-19 led by a union minister, not the committee led by Myanmar state counselors.

column2: American scientists have developed a cure for Coronavirus.
column8: The viral image on social media is not a vaccine for coronavirus but it is a COVID-19 test kit recently developed by South Korea.

column2: Supermarkets in Germany will only open on two days a week. A screenshot shows a report about this from the media outlet Focus.
column8: Supermarkets are open like usual. The screenshot is doctored; Focus did not report this.

column2: Mostly You should take high doses of vitamin D against COVID-19; children don’t get sick because they lack the receptors for the virus to bond; the coronavirus is an unnatural mutation; it is not susceptible to temperatures, which is why infections will not sink in summer; the oldest patients will not be treated and left to die; 5G harms the immune system.
column8: There is no evidence that vitamin D can cure or prevent COVID-19; children can get sick but it is unknown why they usually suffer less than adults; experts are convinced the virus originated in nature; the warmer weather will probably make the infection rate sink but not stop the virus; no patients are sorted out only because of their age and electromagnetic fields like 5G can't harm the human body.

column2: Hindu God Ganesha’s idol placed and worshiped inside an Italian Church.
column8: It is an old video of celebration of a Hindu Festival called Ganeshotsav in a Spanish church which is shared with misleading context.

column2: Partly Turkey helped Italy with 200.000 masks and other equipment but nobody took notice.
column8: Important context is missing. It was not a humanitarian aid delivery. Italy bought 200.000 masks from a company in Turkey and they were blocked at the customs for more than two weeks before Turkey decided to let them be exported.

column2: False People in Italy have thrown all of their money on the roads outside saying that this money is useless to save them from death.
column8: The images doing rounds on social media are not from Italy but from Venezuela when the country was facing economic collapse in 2018.

column2: Srilanka’s KDU hospital to be dedicated to treat only VIP COVID19 patients.
column8: Hospital director, Chief Epidemiologist and Defence Secretary all refuted the claim and said the hospital is ready to admit any patient.

column2: False A video is going viral on WhatsApp and Sharechat claiming that the man and woman in the video are doctors who treated 75 coronavirus patients and now they both are infected by it.
column8: The claim associated with the video is false and misleading. They are not Italian doctors who treated 75 coronavirus patients and got infected but are actors from a Mexican television series called ‘Triunfo del Amor’.

column2: Indian Police personel beaten by a person while enforcing lockdown. Claim made through an image.
column8: The image is old and shared out of context to make a false claim.

column2: No deaths have been reported in Israel due to COVID-19 because they have found a cure for the disease. A solution of hot water, baking soda and lemon is the cure for COVID-19.
column8: There have been 15 deaths in Israel due to COVID-19 plus the solution of lemon, hot water and bicarbonate is not proven to cure COVID-19.

column2: The ex-Health Minister Nikola Todorov, otherwise a lawyer by profession, is a consultant of the current Minister of Health for expert advice and expertise in the field of epidemiology.
column8: Denial about this information came from the Minister of Health himself, who explained that the expert epidemiologist and former VMRO-DPMNE minister is actually a doctor, Dragan Danilovski.

column2: PARTLY A set of claims passed as instructions to be followed during the COVID-19 Pandemic period.
column8: Some of the claims about COVID-19 are true. However, it contains factually incorrect claims such as drinking hot beverages can kill the novel coronavirus and coronavirus remains in throat and can be digested by the stomach if we intake enough fluids.

column2: Restrictions to transit by your ID-number due to coronavirus.
column8: Even there are some restrictions and schedules to transit and buy, there are not by ID-numbers in Venezuela. Text in Whatsapp mixes measures from Colombia, Bolivia and Ecuador.

column2: The maps shows the cases by provinces in Turkey.
column8: The data does not show the local cases but calculated on proportionality to population in every provinces. Turkish authorities do not announce the local figures yet.

column2: A Chinese study is the definitive proof that Chloroquine works.
column8: A widely shared video on social media claims that Chinese studies prove that chloroquine cures almost all of COVID-19 patients. Even though there have been some encouraging initial results, the researchers are in fact very cautious.

column2: Doctored image of Donald Trump shared claiming he asked people to chant Hare Krishna Hare Rama.
column8: The claim is fake and the image is doctored.

column2: A group of Muslim boys licking utensils to spread coronavirus.
column8: The people seen in the video are Dawoodi Bohras, who are licking the utensils in an attempt to follow their belief of zero wastage of food.

column2: Indian Actor Kamal Hassan put under quarantine.
column8: Kamal Hassan and his party has issued an official statement saying there was a misunderstanding between officials as his daughter has self-isolated herself. It was presumed that Hassan had met his daughter in Mumbai. However, he did not meet his daughter and later the officials were also convinced about it and they removed quarantine poster from his wall.

column2: A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts which claim it shows a man wiping his sweat on the buttons of a lift in a residential block in Hong Kong.
column8: The claim is false; the footage has circulated in media reports about an incident in Thailand.

column2: Italians bidding goodbye to the world because of coronavirus.
column8: The video dates back to November 2019 and has nothing to do with the coronavirus pandemic. It is actually from an anti-fascist protest held in Italy.

column2: After 23:30, the city will be disinfected by a helicopter and the doors and windows should be closed.
column8: This has not been announced by authorities. This hoax has spread in many other countries.

column2: Restrictions to transit by your ID-number due to coronavirus.
column8: Even there are some restrictions and schedules to transit and buy, there are not by ID-numbers in Venezuela. Text in Whatsapp mixes measures from Colombia, Bolivia and Ecuador.

column2: FALSE and If people get infected with CoVid-19, they may not be able to fully recover.
column8: It is quite understandable that people with chronic illnesses and the elderly are at greater risk of this virus and this is repeatedly stated by the relevant institutions so that they can be more careful. But whether they will have, if they heal, lasting consequences, have not been confirmed, at least not by a single relevant global health institution.

column2: Video shows Muslim prayers at a chuch in Switzerland due to the outbreak.
column8: The video goes back to 2017, an interfaith peace event in Switzerland, Olten.

column2: PARTLY A set of claims passed as instructions to be followed during the COVID-19 Pandemic period.
column8: Some of the claims about COVID-19 are true. However, it contains factually incorrect claims such as drinking hot beverages can kill the novel coronavirus and coronavirus remains in throat and can be digested by the stomach if we intake enough fluids.

column2: The text claims that mass media owners, called “Satanists” in the text, are forcing the public to voluntarily look for a coronavirus vaccine. It also describes the vaccine (which still does not exist) as: “A vaccine in which the beast’s mark is present in liquid form with nano-technology, and he will completely control the world and all people”.
column8: Regardless of their religious feelings, believers, and everyone else, should remain rational, sober, and informed for their own good only from relevant sources. Postings on social networks, if not from officials, no matter where they come from, should be taken with great care and checked before they can be trusted.

column2: The ex-Health Minister Nikola Todorov, otherwise a lawyer by profession, is a consultant of the current Minister of Health for expert advice and expertise in the field of epidemiology.
column8: Denial about this information came from the Minister of Health himself, who explained that the expert epidemiologist and former VMRO-DPMNE minister is actually a doctor, Dragan Danilovski.

column2: The maps shows the cases by provinces in Turkey.
column8: The data does not show the local cases but calculated on proportionality to population in every provinces. Turkish authorities do not announce the local figures yet.

column2: France needs tests for its population however Paris sent tests to Algeria.
column8: A thousand tests have been sent to Algeria to slow the spread of the coronavirus epidemic. But it was the Institut Pasteur which sent them to the other establishments in its international network, and not the French state.

column2: Restrictions to transit by your ID-number due to coronavirus.
column8: Even there are some restrictions and schedules to transit and buy, there are not by ID-numbers in Venezuela. Text in Whatsapp mixes measures from Colombia, Bolivia and Ecuador.

column2: An email from Caixabank that ask people to change data related to their account.
column8: An email allegedly sent by CaixaBank requesting account verification through a link in less than 24 hours to prevent unauthorized access. It is a case of phishing.

column2: A sensationalist headline: “LATEST NEWS / SOMETHING BIG IS HAPENING IN EUROPE”
column8: This is blank text, no information, no facts, no source of information and nothing that can serve the reader. The purpose of this article is only to cause panic and to collect as many clicks as possible. The text is no longer available.

column2: A image of a 24-year-old doctor that coronavirus killed.
column8: An image that says that doctor Francisco 'Paco' Pérez of the Hospital de La Paz in Madrid died at the age of 24 from the coronavirus accompanied by a photo of the porn actor Jordi 'el niño polla'.

column2: “Italians remove EU flag and put the flag of the PR of China,” the headline says, suggesting that such a phenomenon is happening in Italy – people are removing the flag of the European Union and are replacing it with the Chinese flag.
column8: Those were individual cases in which citizens or companies, in a revolt from the EU's attitude towards their country in the most difficult moments of the epidemiological crisis, have taken the EU flag off. But this is not a general trend.

column2: Army trucks are deployed in Paris and in other big French cities because of the coronavirus epidemic
column8: Photos shared thousands of times on social media show military vehicles transported by truck on the highway near Paris. But the French Ministry of Armed Forces denies any link with the coronavirus epidemic and explains that it is a routine logistical operation.

column2: A sensationalist headline claiming that there is a new virus in China – the Hantavirus.
column8: Passengers have been isolated and tested because of the suspicion that the coronavirus may be the cause of the deteriorating health of the passenger, not because of the danger of transmitting the hantavirus. The hantavirus first appeared in 1950, not nowadays.

column2: A photo of the vicepresident of Spain in the hospital allegadly visiting his father sick of coronavirus.
column8: The vice president of Spain, Pablo Iglesias, did not visit his father at the Hospital Clinico Universitario de Salamanca, who is neither ill nor admitted. The photo is not current.

column2: Does stage 4 of the epidemic mean “quarantine for all cities in France”?
column8: Stage 4 of an epidemic in France doesn't imply general quarantine, on the contrary. The fourth and last stage of an epidemic means a gradual return to normal situation. France is still in stage 3, according to the authorities and to medical experts.

column2: Iceland is testing its entire population.
column8: In Iceland, 3,5% of the population has been tested so far, according to the government. Iceland is doing a massive testing, with an average of 582 tests every day since mid-March. But even at this rate, it would take more than a year and a half to test all of the residents.

column2: A document that talks about the benefits of wine to prevent coronavirus.
column8: The Spanish Federation of Oenology published on March 23 a statement about the coronavirus that helps better oral hygiene and that the virus does not survive in wine. No substance prevents the coronavirus.

column2: COVID-19 was invented and patented years ago by the Institut Pasteur, a French medical research center
column8: The patent, filed in 2004, relates to vaccinal research on SARS-CoV-1, responsible for the SARS epidemic in 2002 and 2003, and not the SARS-CoV-2, that causes the current COVID-19 epidemic.
