column2: There is a connection between COVID-19 outbreak and 5G technology.
column8: There is no proven connection between the viral infections and radio waves.

column2: Boil weed and ginger for COVID-19 victims, the virus will vanish.
column8: There is no evidence supporting the claim that marijuana and ginger can cure COVID-19. To date, there is no specific treatment available for COVID-19, although clinical trials evaluating certain existing drugs are underway.

column2: Iceland is testing its entire population.
column8: In Iceland, 3,5% of the population has been tested so far, according to the government. Iceland is doing a massive testing, with an average of 582 tests every day since mid-March. But even at this rate, it would take more than a year and a half to test all of the residents.

column2: A document that talks about the benefits of wine to prevent coronavirus.
column8: The Spanish Federation of Oenology published on March 23 a statement about the coronavirus that helps better oral hygiene and that the virus does not survive in wine. No substance prevents the coronavirus.

column2: There is a connection between COVID-19 outbreak and 5G technology.
column8: There is no proven connection between the viral infections and radio waves.

column2: A headline that alleges that the first pregnant woman with coronavirus gave birth in Macedonia.
column8: The event did not happen in Macedonia, but in Serbia.

column2: Prof. Shenme Minzi from Zanjan University told that lemon cure is helpful for COVID-19.
column8: There is no Zanjan University in China (it's in Iran), and no researcher named Shenme Minzi at all. Lemon contains vitamin C which is helpful to enpower the immune system but does not cure the disease.

column2: Partially A message that claimed that an electric company in Spain was offering 25% discount to its customers for the coronavirus.
column8: Iberdrola, an electrical company in Spain, carried out a 25% discount campaign to a sector of its customers. The campaign existed but not for all its clients.

column2: The lockdown due to Coronavirus has led to the reemergence of a large flock of birds at the riverfront in Ahmedabad.
column8: These birds are a regular site at the riverfront in Ahmedabad and the video has been shared with a false narrative.

column2: Says certain states are banning the sale of alcohol.
column8: Claims that states are banning alcohol sales appear to have originated on a prank page.

column2: WhatsApp group admins were detained for sharing coronavirus messages in Dadar, Mumbai.
column8: Mumbai Police spokesperson rubbished the claim that Mumbai police's cyber cell was registering cases against 52 WhatsApp group admins and called it fake.

column2: India has decided to extend its financial year to July 1 due to the current COVID-19 outbreak.
column8: The Income Tax department tweeted that the financial year has not been extended and that this gazette was for the collection of stamp duty on security market instruments through stock exchanges and clearing corporations.

column2: Two audio clips stating that the Mumbai police commissioner is going to enforce strict actions during the 21 day lockdown in India and that there will be a spike in cases after March 27, 2020.
column8: Mumbai Police officials denied that this audio was of the city police commissioner. The voices in both the videos were different.

column2: Video shows re-opened wet market in China .
column8: The video dates back to 2017 and recorded in Indonesia. Wet markets are currently closed down in Hubei.

column2: Old “Martinelli” and “Whatsapp Gold” hoaxes surface in Belgium in wake of Corona infodemic.
column8: Messages circulating on Whatsapp of people sharing "insider"-information (self-declared government officials) on the virus percolate quickly. A localized version of the Martinelli & Whatsapp Gold hoaxes surface in Belgium as well, adding further confusion and unrest.

column2: WhatsApp group admins were detained for sharing coronavirus messages in Dadar, Mumbai.
column8: Mumbai Police spokesperson rubbished the claim that Mumbai police's cyber cell was registering cases against 52 WhatsApp group admins and called it fake.

column2: Partially A message that claimed that an electric company in Spain was offering 25% discount to its customers for the coronavirus.
column8: Iberdrola, an electrical company in Spain, carried out a 25% discount campaign to a sector of its customers. The campaign existed but not for all its clients.

column2: People in Italy are threw away their money after they lost their family members to coronavirus.
column8: The claim along with the images is false. The images are old and are not related to the ongoing coronavirus pandemic in any way.

column2: Prof. Shenme Minzi from Zanjan University told that lemon cure is helpful for COVID-19.
column8: There is no Zanjan University in China (it's in Iran), and no researcher named Shenme Minzi at all. Lemon contains vitamin C which is helpful to enpower the immune system but does not cure the disease.

column2: A claim on Facebook that began to circulate around Wednesday, March 25, says that putting a peeled onion in any room can remove “all viruses and bacteria including coronavirus.”
column8: Putting peeled onions in a room will not prevent COVID-19 or a coronavirus infection, according to the National Onion Association (NOA) in the US. There are no official cures or vaccines for COVID-19, according to the World Health Organization (WHO) as of Tuesday, March 31, though there are cures and vaccines in testing.

column2: Health care workers union “suddenly finds stash of 39 million face masks”.
column8: Health care workers’ union launched a nationwide search on March 21 for face masks and other protective gear that have been in short supply since the COVID-19 pandemic swept across the U.S. On March 26, the union announced that it had found a supplier with 39 million masks.

column2: Says certain states are banning the sale of alcohol.
column8: Claims that states are banning alcohol sales appear to have originated on a prank page.

column2: In the Philippines, Senator Manny Pacquiao was the only senator who responded to the coronavirus crisis.
column8: Other senators, and not just Pacquiao, also responded to the outbreak by providing aid to frontliners and those affected by the enhanced community quarantine, among others.

column2: Partially Polish government confiscated coronavirus testing mashine which was originally bought by local hospital in Grodzisk Mazowiecki city.
column8: Article is misleading. Although hospital did indeed collect the money for buying the mashine, it didn't buy it eventually as the mashine was redirected to the city where it was much more needed. Polish government didn't take if forcefully or confiscated it as articles were suggesting.

column2: Video clip of a massive stadium converted into a graveyard claimed to be scenes from Italy related to ongoing COVID19 outbreak.
column8: Scene from movie “Flu 2013” portrayed as scenes from Italy.

column2: An image of a baby born with deformities claims that the baby was suffering from Coronavirus.
column8: This image is of a still born baby suffering from anencephaly wherein the baby is born without parts of the brain/skull.

column2: Johns Hopkins University says that the fatality of coronavirus in Colombia is the third lowest in the world.
column8:
Neither Johns Hopkins University said that the fatality of COVID-19 in Colombia is the third lowest in the world nor the data that
excongressman Alfredo Rangel gave in his tweet is correct.

column2: French professor Didier Raoult, big defensor of chloroquine treatment, insulted ex-European MP Daniel Cohn-Bendit, after Cohn-Bendit criticized his scientific work.
column8: Professor Didier Raoult denied having insulted Cohn-Bendit on his real Twitter account.

column2: Johns Hopkins University says that the fatality of coronavirus in Colombia is the third lowest in the world.
column8:
Neither Johns Hopkins University said that the fatality of COVID-19 in Colombia is the third lowest in the world nor the data that
excongressman Alfredo Rangel gave in his tweet is correct.

column2: A chart comparing those infected and killed by the coronavirus in Argentina and Spain.
column8: The data on the chart was incorrect and it is not advised to compare and make projections with information from different countries, that are experiencing the pandemic in different stages.

column2: You shouldn’t open your windows.
column8:
A study published in the New England Journal of Medicine warned that the novel coronavirus remains viable for up to: three hours floating in the air, four hours on copper coins, a whole day on cardboard surfaces and as long as two or three days on plastic surfaces or stainless steel faucets. This scientific data went viral on social media as an oversimplified, false message: “The virus no longer spreads simply by being in contact with infected people or in places where the infected have been. The virus is now in the air. We have entered a new phase, ” reads an audio message sent around on Whatsapp. 

However, research by the United States National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases published in the New England Journal of Medicine mentions no such new phase. To date, the World Health Organization (WHO) reports that the viability of the novel coronavirus in the air does not imply that the contagion is like measles, which can live up to two hours in the air where an infected person has coughed or sneezed.

column2: The Indian Army has been called to control seven areas in Mumbai that are nor following the 21 day lockdown and are out of the Mumbai police’s control.
column8: The Mumbai police has not called in the army and the seven areas are duly following the lockdown prescribed by the government.

column2: French professor Didier Raoult, big defensor of chloroquine treatment, insulted ex-European MP Daniel Cohn-Bendit, after Cohn-Bendit criticized his scientific work.
column8: Professor Didier Raoult denied having insulted Cohn-Bendit on his real Twitter account.

column2: An image of a baby born with deformities claims that the baby was suffering from Coronavirus.
column8: This image is of a still born baby suffering from anencephaly wherein the baby is born without parts of the brain/skull.

column2: The Indian Home Ministry considers posting anything about Coronavirus as a punishable offence.
column8: The message was attributed to a non existent Home Ministry official and the ministry has not passed any circular stating that any message about coronavirus should not be shared.

column2: Two malaria medications work to treat COVID-19.
column8: President Donald Trump announced that the FDA already has a treatment for COVID-19. In his announcement, he mentioned two drugs used to treat malaria as well as an antibiotic. However, a comprehensive review of available scientific evidence shows hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine have not yet shown sufficient efficacy for treating respiratory disease caused by the novel coronavirus. These medications are still in early-phase clinical trials for treating the disease.

column2: Marathi newspaper reports conspiracy theory of Coronavirus being a bioweapon.
column8: The conspiracy theory is actually picked up from a Reddit thread which hosts contests for fictional stories that are inspired from real events.

column2: Police in India lashed sticks at filmmaker Sudhir Mishra for not following the rules of lockdown.
column8: The viral video has been falsified based on the tweet made by Sudhir Mishra himself on the viral clip.

column2: WHO admitted coronavirus is airbone transmitted cause is on the air for 8 hours.
column8: Using a real CNBC link claimed the opposite of what WHO discovered and found.

column2: Partially Polish government confiscated coronavirus testing mashine which was originally bought by local hospital in Grodzisk Mazowiecki city.
column8: Article is misleading. Although hospital did indeed collect the money for buying the mashine, it didn't buy it eventually as the mashine was redirected to the city where it was much more needed. Polish government didn't take if forcefully or confiscated it as articles were suggesting.

column2: French professor Didier Raoult, director of IHU Marseille, told Africans not to take “Bill Gates’ vaccine” against coronavirus because it is “poisonous”.
column8: The IHU Marseille has denied that its director made such comments, and there is currently no vaccine or approved treatment. If scientific research is underway, no vaccine should be released until at least next year.

column2: Partially Drug for coronavirus was found.
column8: Article is misleading. Research is still ongoing and it's too early to say that drug for coronavirus was found.

column2: Video clip of a massive stadium converted into a graveyard claimed to be scenes from Italy related to ongoing COVID19 outbreak.
column8: Scene from movie “Flu 2013” portrayed as scenes from Italy.

column2: Chain message warns against accepting immunisation from coronavirus; says they are rather implanting COVID-19 through the said vaccine.
column8: The whole plot screams foul play! First, no news platform has published anything close, besides this, WHO has said there’s no vaccine yet for the virus. Also, a reverse image search proved that the claim-author manipulated one of the many images shared by health workers to encourage people to stay home during this trying time.

column2: Announcement on social media according to which markets in North Macedonia (Ramstore Capitol, Ramstore Center, Tinex Dramski, Tinex Prvomajska) had workers infected with coronavirus. Citizens are also urged to avoid these markets.
column8: This is fake news that was soon denied by companies whose stores were on the list - Tinex and Ramstore.

column2: To defeat the coronavirus, China had built a thousand bed hospital in 10 days, while India has prepared a modern hospital of 6370 beds overnight, at a very low cost.
column8: A close study on the viral claim revealed that a 6370-bed hospital has not been constructed overnight in the country. Isolation wards have been made in some bogies of the country's first medical train Jeevan Rekha which was run in the year 1991.

column2: A Facebook publication ensures that “there is a new generation of genetic vaccines ready to be inoculated in the world population.”
column8:
Genetic vaccines are being tested and the specific effects on DNA are unknown.
There is a North American company that is testing these vaccines for coronavirus, but it is not known if, specifically, for COVID-19.

column2: COVID-19 is a secret American weapon aimed for depopulation purposes.
column8: Article is based on debunked conspiracy theories.

column2: Partially Italian priest died, refusing to use respirator as he sacrificed it to a younger person.
column8: He didn't sacrifice the respirator. He didn't use it due to medical preconditions.

column2: A post with photos claiming that COVID-19 infected patients in Italy are left in the street.
column8: The photos were from a hospital in Croatia after the earthquake struck the capital of Zagreb on March 22.

column2: The new coronavirus COVID-19 is a US biological weapon against China and Italy ; Milorad Dodik, the Serb member of the BiH presidency, is infected with COVID-19.
column7: North Macedonia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina
column8: Considering the impact of novel coronavirus on the US people, such a claim doesn't make any sense. It's also completely unfounded. Radovan Kovačević debunked the false news about Milorad Dodik being infected with COVID-19.

column2: The virus can be overcome by drinking hot water every 15 minutes, avoiding cold drinks and ice cream, going out in the sun to kill the virus, as well as the “self-diagnostic guideline”, i.e. if you hold your breath for 10 seconds and then you do not cough, you do not choke,you do not feel any tension in the lungs than you have no cystic fibrosis in the lungs and the situation is not irreversible.
column5: 2020/04/03 Macedonia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Greece
column7: North Macedonia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Greece
column8: All of this misinformation has nothing to do with the truth, because the virus not only enters the oral cavity but also the nose, so drinking hot water will not carry the virus to the stomach. Viruses are destroyed at higher temperatures than those normally tolerated by humans, and even sun exposure and body heat have no effect.

column2: Audio from the Secretary of Risk Management for Cali on the exponential growth of coronavirus.
column8: The voice is not from politician Rodrigo Zamorano but from the doctor César Augusto Arias, interviewed on a radio program.

column2: Myanmar’s former military junta donated Ks 1000 Lakhs to COVID-19 fund.
column8: The list of donors in The Mirror daily circulated on March 26 shows no name of former military junta or current army chief or former president.

column2: There is now a COVID19 cure from USA.
column8: It was a test kit from South Korea, that was shared as an American-made vaccine for COVID-19.

column2: About a thousand people wait to enter the Military Medical Academy (VMA) in Belgrade for examinations.
column8: People came for routine check-ups and only their temperature was measured. Many people were only accompanying those who went for a check-up and were not allowed to enter thus causing queues outside.

column2: A statement saying: “‘Serbs have’ lion’s genes’ that protect them from coronavirus, unlike Italians who have ‘weaker genes'” by pulmonologist Branimir Nestorovic.
column7: North Macedonia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina
column8: Nestorovic claims that he did not say such a thing, nor did he think Serbs had superior genes, but only different ones, and that such a "statement" was filled by the tabloid.

column2: Viral video shows a man having great difficulty breathing. Even the medical team keeps a safe distance from this man. These videos are shared as patient suffering from COVID-19.
column8: Upon investigation, we found out that all three clips are from Indian State of Gujrat. The man seen in the clips is mentally unstable. Health Authorities from the state confirmed that the man does not have coronavirus infection.

column2: A post shared repeatedly on WhatsApp and Facebook claims a Chinese doctor has discovered that drinking tea is effective in curing and relieving symptoms of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: The claim is false; health experts say there is insufficient scientific evidence to show that drinking tea is effective in preventing or curing COVID-19 infections; as of March 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) has said there is no cure for COVID-19.

column2: pH level of coronavirus varies from 5.5 to 8.5 and to beat the virus we should consume more alkaline food.
column8: Speaking to The Quint, Dr Shaheed Jameel, a leading virologist said that viruses do not have pH values.

column2: Italian President breaks down and surrenders in front of COVID-19 epidemic.
column8: An old image of Brasilian President Jair Mesaias Bolsonaro has been used to make the false claim.

column2: false and Harvard scientists explain: Here’s how you can cure the coronavirus yourself before the vaccine comes out and a WhatsApp message stating: “The Ministry of Health has approved an immediate 350 euro reward for those staying home.” The first child that lost its life because of coronavirus.
column8: The "information" contained in the WhatsApp message was denied by the Minister of Health and Social Affairs. The link didn't bring to an existing page. The British media article was about an infected child, not a child who lost his life. There is no exact data so far, but according to WHO, children are less at risk of coronary heart disease when they catch the novel coronavirus.

column2: If you are infected with the new coronavirus, for high fever you should not take ibuprofen (Brufen) or paracetamol ; Adults should drink a strong black coffee every few hours.
column5: 2020/04/03 Macedonia, Greece, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina
column7: North Macedonia, Greece, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina
column8: There are no clinical trials or practice data that would suggest that brufen should not be taken with COVID-19 infection. The Specialist pneumophysiologist and family medicine doctor, Dobrinka Granzov - Kozlina. debunked the fake news about drinking coffee against coronavirus.

column2: Hydroxychloroquine (HCQ) can prevent COVID-19.
column8: The USFDA has however approved the drug for treatment of COVID-19 as this anti-malarial drug might ease some symptoms. However, it is not proven to build resistance and prevent COVID-19 and its use without Doctor's prescription is not recommended.

column2: A claim has been shared thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter that an emergency decree issued in Thailand due to the novel coronavirus pandemic included a strict curfew.
column8: The claim is false; the emergency decree declared on March 25, 2020 by Thailand’s prime minister did not include a curfew.

column2: A video of police arresting a man has been viewed thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it shows police in Italy detaining a man who flouted a national lockdown during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; the footage in fact shows police arresting a knife-wielding man in the Brazilian city of Sao Paulo.

column2: Actor Vijay’s father criticized government for enforcing curfew to abate COVID-19.
column8: The newscard shared to make the claim is fake. The news channel has not published any such news.

column8: The USFDA has however approved the drug for treatment of COVID-19 as this anti-malarial drug might ease some symptoms. However, it is not proven to build resistance and prevent COVID-19 and its use without Doctor's prescription is not recommended.

column2: If you can hold your breath for 10 seconds without coughing or chest pain, you are good, you don’t have COVID-19, and If your nose is clogged or runny, it’s just a cold.
column8: Dr Robert Legar Atmar told CNN that these are not accurate because someone with an acute viral infection breathes with difficulty because the airways are irritated, but being able to hold his/her breath for 10 seconds does not mean he/she is not infected with coronavirus. Similarly, the expert rejected other claims on the list, calling them myths.

column2: A video of police arresting a man has been viewed thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it shows police in Italy detaining a man who flouted a national lockdown during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; the footage in fact shows police arresting a knife-wielding man in the Brazilian city of Sao Paulo.

column2: A web publication shared hundreds of times on Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp in Nigeria claims the government will pay each citizen 8,500 naira ($23.60) monthly to encourage Nigerians to stay at home in a bid to slow down the spread of the novel coronavirus.
column8: The claim is false; officials have dismissed the claim, and the author of the viral publication admitted it was incorrect.

column2: A screenshot of a World Health Organization (WHO) webpage has been shared in multiple posts on Facebook, Twitter and messaging app Line alongside a claim it shows international health authorities raised Thailand’s pandemic stage to a “level 4” during the novel coronavirus crisis.
Italian President breaks down and surrenders in front of COVID-19 epidemic.
column8: An old image of Brasilian President Jair Mesaias Bolsonaro has been used to make the false claim.

column2: In a seemingly careless message being sent as an e-mail, recipients in Greek are warned that if a company (shop) has to shut down because of the new coronavirus or staff illness or other reason, the sender must notify the sender of that message about the termination of the employment of an employee.
column8: This message contains an "attachment" that carries a high risk of being a malicious software, such as a virus, a Trojan, or other form of malware. The e-mail address is @gmail.com. No legitimate public institution (even a private company) will write to you from a gmail address or any other free service.

column2: Garlic can protect you from the virus and the most vulnerable group with the new coronavirus are people with blood type A.
column7: North Macedonia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia
column8: Garlic can really help boost immunity, but it can neither protect nor cure because although it has antibacterial properties, the World Health Organization (WHO) has not confirmed that it can cure the new virus and also statistics show that 38 percent of those infected in the city of Wuhan in China had blood type A, but also that as much as 31 percent of the city's population is with that blood type.

column2: A photo where Pablo Iglesias, vice president of the Spanish government, is praying in a Catholic church before beginning his COVID-19 quarantine.
column8: the image where Pablo Iglesias, vicepresident of Spain,  appears praying in a catholic church is a montage putting his face on the body of another person. The original photograph was published years earlier on the internet.

column2: Coronavirus infections are linked to a lack of vitamin D.
column8: There is no evidence that vitamin D reduces the risk of coronavirus infection. Some preliminary studies suggest that it could prevent it, but drawing premature conclusions about studies or publications can be a risk for the general population.

column2: Supposedly according to the new decree issued by the Spanish government to regulate non-essential activities during confinement, customs officers must not work and therefore goods would not enter Spain.
column8: The decree published by the Spanish government to regulate the performance of non-essential activities during confinement authorizes the work of customs agents, as an essential activity.

column2: Lies spread by Serbian authorities about COVID-19. For example:  the virus does not affect pregnant women, children and young people, that no newborn is infected with the corona virus and that the virus does not last long on objects, the number of respiratory machines that Serbia posesses etc.
column8: There have been cases of infected and pregnant and newborns as well as people of different ages, their claim is untrue. When it comes to persistence of the virus on different surfaces, according to the latest research from the US National Institutes of Health, it has a stable presence in aerosols for a duration of three hours, on copper up to four hours, can remain on cardboard for 24 hours and two to three days of plastic and inox.

column2: PARTLY A photo making the rounds on social media claims to show people who have died from the coronavirus in Italy.
column8: The coffins in the photo are those of the victims of the Lampedusa maritime tragedy in 2013.

column2: A photo where Pablo Iglesias, vice president of the Spanish government, is praying in a Catholic church before beginning his COVID-19 quarantine.
column8: the image where Pablo Iglesias, vicepresident of Spain,  appears praying in a catholic church is a montage putting his face on the body of another person. The original photograph was published years earlier on the internet.

column2: A link offering registration for United States humanitarian aid to other countries for the coronavirus
column8: A web page called borrowed.xyz is faking CNN image with an alleged offer from the United States to give humanitarian aid vouchers to citizens of other countries. It is a case of phising.

column2: Coronavirus patients in Italy are now on the streets because hospitals are no longer able to accommodate them.
column8: The photos were taken in the aftermath of the 5.4-magnitude earthquake that struck Croatia on March 22.

column2: Santiago Abascal, general secretary of VOX (political party), allegadly didn’t respect the quarantine period after being tested positive for COVID-19
column8: Santiago Abascal, secretary general of the VOX political party, respected the statutory quarantine periods after being positive by COVID-19 and did not skip the quarantine to go to the Congress of Deputies.

column2: Supposedly according to the new decree issued by the Spanish government to regulate non-essential activities during confinement, customs officers must not work and therefore goods would not enter Spain.
column8: The decree published by the Spanish government to regulate the performance of non-essential activities during confinement authorizes the work of customs agents, as an essential activity.

column2: Not a single Muslim died of Coronavirus in China.
column8: There is no such claim made by China so far that not a single Muslim has died of coronavirus. China has not released any list of people who have died in coronavirus.

column2: A claim circulating on social media and messaging apps says that keeping your throat moist will wash the coronavirus down to your stomach where the virus will die.
column8: Both the World Health Organization (WHO) and doctor Norberto Francisco, chief of clinical trials and research at the Lung Center of the Philippines, say that drinking water will not prevent a coronavirus infection.

column2: Coronavirus infections are linked to a lack of vitamin D.
column8: There is no evidence that vitamin D reduces the risk of coronavirus infection. Some preliminary studies suggest that it could prevent it, but drawing premature conclusions about studies or publications can be a risk for the general population.

column2: Mostly WHO has said, do not eat Cabbage as it will increase the chance of Coronavirus infection.
column8: WHO has not said anything that shows cabbage has any relation to coronavirus.

column2: The WHO allegedly announced that face masks do not protect and are not effective for walking on the street.
column8: The WHO says that masks should be used rationally and appropriately due to the scarcity of this protection worldwide, not that it does not protect when going on the street.

column2: Mostly Drinking bitter gourd juice cures Coronavirus
column8: There is no proven evidenvce from any research so far which establishes that bitter gourd juice cures coronavirus.

column2: Ibuprofen ramps up coronavirus 10 times.
column8: There is no evidence that ibuprofen or other similar drugs exacerbate the disease. Instead, the notion is simply a hypothesis that has not been tested.

column2: Ibuprofen ramps up coronavirus 10 times.
column8: There is no evidence that ibuprofen or other similar drugs exacerbate the disease. Instead, the notion is simply a hypothesis that has not been tested.

column2: Mostly Says Nevada Governor Steve Sisolak “has banned the use of an anti-malaria drug that might help cure coronavirus.”
column8: A Nevada emergency regulation restricts the prescription of chloroquine for COVID-19 patients in outpatient settings, but not in hospitals and emergency rooms. Gov. Steve Sisolak signed the order on the recommendation of state health officials, who said there is the potential for stockpiling the drug.

column2: The Brazilian Government is handling a 600 brazilian reais monthly COVID-19 emergency allowance to poor citizens. To access it, you need to fill out an oficial form (link to the form).
column8: Although the COVID-19 emergency allowance itself is a real thing, it has not been formaly approved by the Senate yet (March 30, morning). The Brazilian government has not announced how it will be payed. The given URL directs to a non-governmental internet address, registered abroad, quite possibly a phishing scam.

column2: Governor of Maranhão, Brazil, Flávio Dino, giving food baskets to a crowd of poor people, in spite of reccomendations against crowds during the COVID-19 crisis.
column8: The picture is from 2019. The man in the picture is not Flávio Dino, but Roberto do Posto, mayor of a small town in Maranhão.

column2: A message from Brazilian Workers’ Party (PT), Gleisi Hoffmann, asking party affiliates to boycott the 600 reais monthly COVID-19 emergency allowance. Eligible PT voters should reject it and denounce it, since it is being paid by a “fascist government”.
column8: PT, as all Brazilian parties with seating representatives, voted for the COVID-19 emergency allowance, not against it. Gleisi Hoffmann published a text on her Facebook account denying this request.

column2: Luciano Hang, Roberto Justus (Brazilian businessmen, pro-vertical isolation tactics) and Eduardo Costa (singer, Bolsonaro supporter) donated 4 million Brazilian reais and 90 respirators to SUS (National Health Care system).
column8: Hang told us he donated 2 respirators to a hospital in his hometown, Brusque. Justus said he donated to "some iniciatives" against COVID-19, but did not disclose the amount. Costa said he's trying to gather some businessmen together to purchase some respirators for Minas Gerais hospitals, but nothing concrete has happened so far (March 30). Thus, none of the statements are correct.

column2: An audio file from an alledged state official from Ceará, Brazil, named Ricardo Certi, asking the directors of a local TV station to criticize Bolsonaro and praise Ceará’s government COVID-19 policies.
column8: Ricardo Certi, the man who allegedly recorded the message, does not exist. There's not a single person with this name working for the Ceará state government.

column2: Says imposters in hazmat suits are going door to door in Stockton, California, saying they are checking residents for fever or COVID-19, but they “will enter your home and physically attempt robbery.”
column8: Posts around the nation warn people not to open their doors to imposters who say they are doing coronavirus testing but actually want to rob the residents. Like other such claims, this one about an alleged scam in Stockton, Calif., is false, according to police.

column2: Pangolin proven to be ‘responsible’ for coronavirus.
column8:
No investigation to date has concluded or established with absolute certainty that the pangolin, a mammal under protection regime and that inhabits Asia and Africa, is part of the chain of species through which the sars-cov2 virus mutated and it happened to humans.
The publications (1) in which the “responsibility” of this species is reiterated are the result of the erroneous interpretation of investigations in which, through genetic analysis studies of pangolin-associated coronaviruses, some relationships between these infectious agents and sars-cov2, which causes COVID-19.

column2: Increase in cases of pneumonia in Mexico.
column8:
In Mexico, what has been verified is that it is false that the cases of pneumonia and bronchopneumonia have registered an increase so far in 2020, according to the last report from the authority in mid-March.
Although the rumor of the data of some supposed 70 deaths linked to the new coronavirus has spread in networks, data that some businessmen from funeral homes in the Toluca Valley, State of Mexico, reportedly provided; This has been ruled out by some authorities and even by the same source to which the report was attributed.

column2: Bombay High Court is extending Maharashtra’s lockdown to April 31.
column8: The High Court had only extended its interim orders and not the lockdown.

column2: Tips from Professor Wong Kin-Chung to delay the progress of COVID-19 condition: rinsing mouth with cold salty water; drinking water and red wine; taking vitamin C; having chicken soup, shiitake mushroom, astragalus, codonopsis, and ginseng.
column8: There is no evidence that those mentioned in the claim can prevent COVID-19. Plus, we are not able to identify Professor Wong Kin-Chung, a medical professor, doctor as well as a nutritionist in the USA, who allegely made that claim.

column2: Mostly Most of the passengers in the Ethiopian airlines flight from Italy are infected with Coronavirus.
column8: The viral video is of a mockdrill from Senegal.

column2: News graphic saying Indian Prime Minister has asked for internet to be shut down in the country.
column8: The news graphic is photoshopped and fake. The Prime Minister did not make this statement.

column2: A website claiming that China has confirmed that patient zero had sex with a bat.
column8: World News Daily is a website generating fake news and it is scientifically seen that the virus has emerged from an animal source.

column2: Mosly Vaccines to cure COVID-19 are ready.
column8: Viral image is of a COVID-19 testing kit. A cure is still being researched.

column2: A Facebook post suggests that a scientist in the United States has found a cure for coronavirus.
column8: There is currently no cure for COVID-19. A breakthrough suggesting otherwise would warrant notice of international TV coverage; not a mere social media posting or blog site.

column2: Mostly Italian PM said that the country has surrendered to the Covid-19 pandemic
column8: The quote attributed to Italian PM is made up.

column2: Donald Trump said, “People are dying who have never died before”
column8: The quote has been on the internet for over a decade attributing it to different people at different times.

column2: Mostly Due to the fear of Coronavirus, Muslims in China are offereing Namaz in the open street.
column8: The viral video is four years ols and has no relation with coronavirus.

column2: mostly Lions released on Russian streets by Vladimir Putin to force people inside.
column8: This viral picture is from Johannesburg in South Africa and about four years old.

column2: Tips from Professor Wong Kin-Chung to delay the progress of COVID-19 condition: rinsing mouth with cold salty water; drinking water and red wine; taking vitamin C; having chicken soup, shiitake mushroom, astragalus, codonopsis, and ginseng.
column8: There is no evidence that those mentioned in the claim can prevent COVID-19. Plus, we are not able to identify Professor Wong Kin-Chung, a medical professor, doctor as well as a nutritionist in the USA, who allegely made that claim.

column2: Timings for sale of milk, newspapers, grocery and medical stores have been issued by the Mumbai Police commissioner.
column8: It is a hoax. The Mumbai Police commissioner has not issued any such order.

column2: Bombay High Court is extending Maharashtra’s lockdown to April 31.
column8: The High Court had only extended its interim orders and not the lockdown.

column2: China Killed Pigs For Fear of coronavirus.
column8: The video is misleading.

column2: The Chinese President Visits A Mosque To Ask Muslims’ Prayers To Fight coronavirus
column8: Misbar investigated the video, and found it dates back to 2016, when Chinese President Xi Jiping visited a mosque in northwest China.

column2: This Man Travelled Alone On A Plane To China.
column8: Misbar investigated the image, and found that it belonged to a young man with Egyptian nationality, and he was not going to Beijing, but was returning from China to Egypt.

column2: Videos showing police raids or army raids against people who don’t respect confinement measures in Algeria or Morrocco.
column8: The video was shot on March 7th, 2020. It shows the dispersal of an antigovernmental demonstration by the security forces, with no link with confinement measures or coronavirus.

column2: A list of ten claims about the coronavirus, allegedly from a doctor who worked in a hospital in Shenzhen.
column8: Most of the claims in the message are false and many are misleading. Drinking warm water will not protect you from getting the coronavirus, for example, and there is no evidence that the virus is killed by a temperature of 26/27 degrees either.

column2: America Predicted The Outbreak of coronavirus 9 Years Ago.
column8: America predicts COVID-19 9 years ago, and the proof is the movie "Contingent." This news is fake because of the clear difference between talking about intersections between the film's story and the spread of COVID-19.

column2: The Sudanese Minister Did Put A Mask While Meeting The Chinese Ambassador.
column8: Misbar found the original image posted on the official page of the Sudanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs on Twitter, on February 3 of this year.

column2: Drinking tea can help cure COVID-19.
column8: There is no evidence that drinking tea can help mitigate the effects of the coronavirus.

column2: News of The death of Two Girls Infected With coronavirus In Northern Syria?
column8: An official source denied news that COVID-19 had arrived in Syria and had killed two girls in Aleppo countryside.

column2: North Korean Leader Will Execute Anyone Who Is Infected With coronavirus.
column8: Execution of anyone infected with COVID-19 in North Korea. After researching the news, whether in the official North Korean agencies or international news agencies, we have not found a basis for the news source.

column2: Three Misleading Pictures of coronavirus Hospitals In China.
column8: Misleading Pictures.

column2: Misleading video claims a Chinese market is the cause for the coronavirus.
column8: Video claims that a Chinese market brought the COVID-19. Misleading video.

column2: Image Shows People Falling On The Streets of Wuhan.
column8: Upon verification, Misbar found that the image was from 2014.

column2: Fake Video Clip Shows Killing of Infected People With COVID-19.
column8: The clip is fabricated and made up of 3 non-related clips.

column2: mostly Tea can cure COVID-19 patients suggested by China’s whistleblower doctor Li Wenliang, the news was published by CNN.
column8: No scientific proof as of yet to suggest that tea can cure COVID-19 patients , CNN didn’t publish this news.

column2: Rapper Eminem contacted coronavirus.
column8: Viral post is a hoax. Eminem has not contacted coronavirus till the time of the article got published.

column2: America Predicted The Outbreak of coronavirus 9 Years Ago.
column8: America predicts COVID-19 9 years ago, and the proof is the movie "Contingent." This news is fake because of the clear difference between talking about intersections between the film's story and the spread of COVID-19.

column2: Epidemics Spreads In The Twentieth Year Every Hundred Years.
column8: False allegations.

column2: Twenty Million Chinese Convert To Islam After coronavirus.
column8: Misbar checked the circulating news, and found that it was not true; no Chinese website published this news or even similar. As for the image circulated in the memorial service of the President of the Islamic Association of Shanghai Province in 2018 upon his death, no official party has announced that a large number of Chinese have embraced Islam after the spread of COVID-19.

column2: Fake Video Clip Shows Killing of Infected People With COVID-19.
column8: The clip is fabricated and made up of 3 non-related clips.

column2: Iraqi Ministry of Health Demanded To Close The Border With Iran Because of coronavirus.
column8: The news is not true, as Misbar did not find it published in any official Iraqi media.

column2: Iran Bury coronavirus’ Dead In Iraq, Or The Video From The Najaf Cemetery.
column8: A video of the burial of Iranians who were infected with COVID-19 in Al-Ahwaz cemetery. The same video was also published as a leak from the Najaf cemetery to bury a person who had died after being infected with the COVID-19. The video is old from 2019, and it is for burying a person named Mohamed Nasri who died of CCHF in Al-Ahwaz in 2019.

column2: False Translation Infects football player Alexis Sanchez With coronavirus.
column8: Misbar checked the news and confirmed its falsehood.

column2: Death of A Child In Damascus Infected With coronavirus.
column8: Misbar checked the circulating news, and found that the director general of Al-Mujtahid Hospital in Damascus, Dr. Samer Khadr, categorically denied any cases of COVID-19 infection.

column2: Coronavirus Is Spreading In Egyptian Schools.
column8: Misbar investigated into the authenticity of the video found that it was due to a poisoning incident at the Technical Secondary School for Girls in Sherbin City, Dakahlia Governorate, north of Cairo.

column2: Kuwait Boycotted The Products of The Saudi Almarai Company
column8: Misbar found it fake.

column2: Evacuation of Yemeni Students by the Sultan of Oman In China.
column8: Misbar verified the news and turned out to be fake.

column2: No Confirmation That North Korea Executed An Official After Breaking The Quarantine.
column8: North Korea executes a commercial official suspected of being infected with the COVID-19, for breaking a quarantine and going to a public toilet. There is no evidence to substantiate the claim.

column2: China Declares Nuclear War On America.
column8: The news is false, as Misbar did not find a basis for it in the Chinese official media, or in the credible international media.

column2: The State of Qatar Did Not Report Any Infection Cases With COVID-19.
column8: Misbar found after verification that the Ministry of Public Health in Qatar announced the registration of a confirmed case of respiratory syndrome in the Middle East for a 65-year-old.

column2: Swarms of Crows Attack The Streets of Wuhan.
column8: The videos are fake.

column2: China Declares Nuclear War On America.
column8: The news is false, as Misbar did not find a basis for it in the Chinese official media, or in the credible international media.

column2: Pictures of The Korean Delegation Infected With coronavirus In Palestine.
column8: Misbar verified the allegations and found that the delegation visited Palestine last January, according to the assurances of the tourer of the delegation, Ahmed Amayreh, which prompted some news sites, such as Ramallah News, to delete the photos and apologize.

column2: Swarms of Crows Attack The Streets of Wuhan.
column8: The videos are fake.

column2: Map of The Spread of coronavirus In The Coming Months.
column8: The map in circulation is spurious, as Misbar investigated and found to be from Worldpop organization.

column2: Iraqi Ministry of Health Demanded To Close The Border With Iran Because of coronavirus.
column8: The news is not true, as Misbar did not find it published in any official Iraqi media.

column2: Evacuation of Yemeni Students by the Sultan of Oman In China.
column8: Misbar verified the news and turned out to be fake.

column2: False Translation Infects football player Alexis Sanchez With coronavirus.
column8: Misbar checked the news and confirmed its falsehood.

column2: Kuwait Boycotted The Products of The Saudi Almarai Company
column8: Misbar found it fake.

column2: Coronavirus Is Spreading In Egyptian Schools.
column8: Misbar investigated into the authenticity of the video found that it was due to a poisoning incident at the Technical Secondary School for Girls in Sherbin City, Dakahlia Governorate, north of Cairo.

column2: An Egyptian Writer Predicted The New coronavirus Six Years Ago.
column8: The Egyptian writer, Dr. Ahmed Khaled Tawfiq, foretold the novel coronavirus, and published in his book "Shorbet Hajj Dawood" in 2014, an article about the presence of the virus in Egypt. Misbar has verified the news, which is misleading.

column2: Four Cases of coronavirus Were Reported In The West Bank.
column8: 4 cases of COVID-19 were recorded among tourists in Beit Jala in the West Bank. Misbar checked the news and found that Ma'an News Agency had modified it with another news entitled "coronavirus In Bethlehem and The Ministry of Health Is Calling For Calm and Waiting For Instructions."

column2: Qatar Shed Iranian Fruits For Fear of coronavirus.
column8: Misbar investigated the incident, and did not find any official country data on the disposal of any Iranian fruit on the market.

column2: In Kuwait, He Sneezed During Friday Sermon, And The Worshipers Expelled Him.
column8: Video showing how worshipers in Kuwait expelled a sneezing man during Friday sermon, for fear that he might have COVID-19. The video is misleading because it is old and have been circulationing before the appearance of the virus.

column2: The Success of An Egyptian Serum In Treating coronavirus.
column8: China has officially announced the success of the Egyptian Serum to cure COVID-19. The Egyptian Ministry of Health denied the news.

column2: Prince of Qatar Infected With coronavirus.
column8: The Emir of Qatar has been bedridden for several days, and his temperature is high, indicating that he had COVID-19. Misbar investigated the events narrated by Qatar Live, and found it just a story invented by the website.

column2: A Picture of The Chinese President In Wuhan Without A Mask.
column8: The Chinese president in Wuhan, China, without wearing a mask. The image is old and has been posted on the official Chinese news agency Xinhua website since October 2018.

column2: Arab medieval historian Abu Al-Hassan Al-Masoudi Predicted The Present Crises.
column8: Misbar verified several editions of the book Akhbar Alzaman, and did not find this text, which differs in the way he wrote poetry from the way Abu Hasan Almasoudi wrote his historical narration of Akhbar al-Zaman. Also, the number of pages in the largest editions did not exceed 280, so page number 365 does not exist as the fake posts claims, which was shared by dozens of pages and met with great interaction.

column2: After Contracting coronavirus.. Did Tom Hanks Get Wilson’s Ball In Quarantine.
column8: The original image is from an old video published in February 2015.

column2: In Kuwait, He Sneezed During Friday Sermon, And The Worshipers Expelled Him.
column8: Video showing how worshipers in Kuwait expelled a sneezing man during Friday sermon, for fear that he might have COVID-19. The video is misleading because it is old and have been circulationing before the appearance of the virus.

column2: Sisi Raised The Numbers of coronavirus Cases In Egypt, In The Hope of Billions From The World Bank.
column8: "When I announced a $ 10 billion grant to the countries in which Coruna Virus was prevalent, President Sisi called me and confirmed 8,000 cases of infection in his country," the World Bank president said at a conference. Misbar checked the news and found it to be false. Returning to the official website of the World Bank, Misbar found that the World Bank announced an initial financing package worth $ 12 billion to tackle COVID-19 spread in more than 60 countries in the world.

column2: Four Cases of coronavirus Were Reported In The West Bank.
column8: 4 cases of COVID-19 were recorded among tourists in Beit Jala in the West Bank. Misbar checked the news and found that Ma'an News Agency had modified it with another news entitled "coronavirus In Bethlehem and The Ministry of Health Is Calling For Calm and Waiting For Instructions."

column2: Former Iraqi President Saddam Hussein Talking About coronavirus.
column8: Fabricated Video of Former Iraqi President Saddam Hussein Talking About coronavirus.

column2: Turkish president Erdogan Revealed A Mask That Kills coronavirus In A Minute.
column8: Erdogan announces Turkey's production of a smart mask, killing COVID-19 in less than a minute. Misbar investigated the story to find that it was not mentioned in any of the Turkish media.

column2: The Success of An Egyptian Serum In Treating coronavirus.
column8: China has officially announced the success of the Egyptian Serum to cure COVID-19. The Egyptian Ministry of Health denied the news.

column2: Crown prince of Abu Dhabi Mohammed bin Zayed Infected With coronavirus.
column8: Misbar has verified the prosecution and is likely to be false, as there is no official news so far about bin Zayed's infection with the virus.

column2: China Did Not Apologize to Muslims In A Song.
column8: Fake Translation.

column2: Coronavirus First Infection In Jeddah..
column8: The first infection with COVID-19 in Jeddah, a woman from an Asian country showing symptoms of suspected coronavirus, and falling on a street. The Emirate of Makkah Province denied, on its Twitter account, what was circulated about the infection of a Chinese woman with the virus.

column2: An Egyptian Writer Predicted The New coronavirus Six Years Ago.
column8: The Egyptian writer, Dr. Ahmed Khaled Tawfiq, foretold the novel coronavirus, and published in his book "Shorbet Hajj Dawood" in 2014, an article about the presence of the virus in Egypt. Misbar has verified the news, which is misleading.

column2: Juventus player Paulo Dybala denies contracting coronavirus.
column8: Paulo Dybala, on his Twitter account, denied on March 13 that he had contracted the virus.

column2: Photo shows Palestinians Solidarity With Italy
column8: Misbar found that the photo showed Israel's solidarity, not Palestine.

column2: Video From The German Government To Its Citizens About coronavirus.
column8: The video is old, and it was posted in 2010 by the University Hospitals Birmingham Hospital via its online platforms.

column2: Emirati singer Ahlam’s Mask Is Crowned With Diamonds.
column8: Misbar investigated the claim and found that it is just a joke from a fan called Mannol, who shared a photoshopped photo of a mask crowned with diamonds.

column2: Does Israeli Minister of Health Provide Information On coronavirus to Palestinians.
column8: Misbar investigated the claim and found that it is misleading; despite the existence of information on the Israeli minister of health website in Arabic, but all of it are preliminary in comparison with what it is published in Hebrew.

column2: Photo shows Palestinians Solidarity With Italy
column8: Misbar found that the photo showed Israel's solidarity, not Palestine.

column2: Bahraini Women Escape From Quarantine.
column8: A video depicts Bahraini women escape quarantine and the police are chasing them. The video depicts part of the clashes that occurred between protesters and the Bahraini police during the protests that broke out in 2012.

column2: Trump: Swiss Company Roche Discovered A Cure for coronavirus.
column8: US President states that the Swiss company Roche have discovered a cure for COVID-19. The video is out of context and the claim is fake.

column2: French Fans Cheered With Joy When President Macron Announced Holiday To Fight coronavirus.
column8: Misbar investigated the video and found it belonged to England fans during a football match between the Wales and England national teams.

column2: The Italian Medical Sector Is Angry At Ronaldo.
column8: The first claim deals with attributing a tweet to a Spanish biology researcher who blames her government for the poor salary biologists receive, while the second claim deals with the content of the tweet itself that Cristiano Ronaldo receives one million euros, unlike doctors who receive 1,300 euros per month. The news is misleading.

column2: A Photo of Coffins In Italy Relates To coronavirus.
column8: Misbar investigated the photo and found that it belongs to dead people in an unauthorized migration boat accident.

column2: French Company Produces The First coronavirus Drug.
column8: Misbar investigated the claim and found that there no cure for COVID-19 until this moment, and the proposed drug has dangerous side effects when used without doctor consultation.

column2: A Video Shows Chinese Celebrating Overthrowing coronavirus.
column8: Misbar investigated the video and found it is old, dating back to 2019, and showing martial arts tournaments during the spring festival in China.

column2: Military Helicopters Sprays Pesticides For coronavirus In Egypt.
column8: Misbar investigated the claim and found it is fake; no such decision has been made by the Egyptian military forces

column2: Leader of North Korea Kim Jong-Un Visits an Infected Woman Without Wearing Mask.
column8: Misbar investigated the picture which accompanied the claim, and it turned out to be old, dating back to April 2018.

column2: Qatari Deputy Minister of Health leaves an Interview Because of coronavirus
column8: The claim isn't true. While in an interview, the host broke his chair which made the interviewee stand and helps him.

column2: Egyptian Sterilization Team Dances To The Beats of Bent Aljeeran.
column8: Misbar investigated the video and found that it is misleading; the video was shot in Iraq, not Egypt.

column2: French Fans Cheered With Joy When President Macron Announced Holiday To Fight coronavirus.
column8: Misbar investigated the video and found it belonged to England fans during a football match between the Wales and England national teams.

column2: Does Israeli Minister of Health Provide Information On coronavirus to Palestinians.
column8: Misbar investigated the claim and found that it is misleading; despite the existence of information on the Israeli minister of health website in Arabic, but all of it are preliminary in comparison with what it is published in Hebrew.

column2: Ronaldo Bought an Island To Isolate Himself from coronavirus.
column8: Misbar investigated the news and confirmed its falsity, as Cristiano Ronaldo did not buy an island to isolate him with his family, and the fact is that after suspending the Serie A matches due to the outbreak of COVID-19, he returned to the Portuguese island of Madeira, his hometown in the Atlantic Ocean.

column2: The Italian Medical Sector Is Angry At Ronaldo.
column8: The first claim deals with attributing a tweet to a Spanish biology researcher who blames her government for the poor salary biologists receive, while the second claim deals with the content of the tweet itself that Cristiano Ronaldo receives one million euros, unlike doctors who receive 1,300 euros per month. The news is misleading.

column2: The title of the article states: “The first pregnant woman with coronavirus in Macedonia gave birth.”.
column8: The assertion in the headline that the first pregnant woman with coronavirus gave birth in Macedonia is false. Actually it is an event that happened in Serbia.

column2: Putin Declares “Comply With Quarantine or Face Prison for Five Years”
column8: Exaggerated sanctions to be on anyone who refuse to comply with the quarantine in Russia.

column2: PARTIALLY Israel’s Ministry of Defense said the best measure against the pandemic is isolating the elders.
column8: In the video, published on March 20, Naftali Bennett says that the most important thing to contain the COVID-19 crisis is that young and old do not live together. However, publications that disseminated the material omit that the minister himself corrected himself four days later, in a video published in his official account, and defended the massive lockout.

column2: A Video Shows Chaos in London While coronavirus Spread.
column8: Misbar investigated the video and it turned out to be old and dating back to August 2011.

column2: Trump faints, is infected with coronavirus.
column8: A video shows a sudden fainting of US President Donald Trump while making a speech before a group of people. It turns out to be an old video dates back to 2016.

column2: Brazillian President Declares “Gaza is the Only coronavirus Free City”.
column8: Misbar investigated the claim and found that the Arabic translation with the video is fake.

column2: Video Shows A Woman falling down in Jeddah.
column8: Misbar investigated the video and found that the woman is mentally unstable, which caused her to fall, according to Saudi authorities.

column2: Tire repairer who died in a work accident was included in the death figures for COVID-19.
column8: In a note to Aos Fatos, the Pernambuco's Department of Health reported that the death certificate of a 57-year-old man who circulates in social media publications is true, but the cause of death was rectified after further laboratory tests concluded that he died on account of another respiratory virus. The state agency also reported that the man's death was never included in state statistics as a result of COVID-19.

column2: Italian prime minister Conte: We Lost Control Over coronavirus, Everything in the Hands of God.
column8: Misbar investigated the claim and found that it is fake; no such statement had been released from the PM on any official record.

column2: US Army Sells Food Just Like Egyptian Army
column8: US army sells food with discounted fares just like the Egyptian army. A misleading photo, which shows the US army distributing free food in New York.

column2: Coronavirus is Nothing But Sarin Gas.
column8: Coronavirus outbreak is nothing but a cover for Sarin gas leaks from an American lab in Afghanistan, but this claim is false according to the WHO.

column2: Did Pollution Rate Decreased in the Aftermath of coronavirus Outbreak?
column8: Misbar found that the claim is misleading; the pollution rate did decrease in some cities.

column2: Trump faints, is infected with coronavirus.
column8: A video shows a sudden fainting of US President Donald Trump while making a speech before a group of people. It turns out to be an old video dates back to 2016.

column2: Coronavirus is Nothing But Sarin Gas.
column8: Coronavirus outbreak is nothing but a cover for Sarin gas leaks from an American lab in Afghanistan, but this claim is false according to the WHO.

column2: PARTIALLY Photo shows a man that was cured of COVID-19 by hydroxycloroquine.
column8: The image in question is from a 2019 brazilian RBS report, prior to the coronavirus pandemic and any case recorded worldwide. The man is Walter Hugo Balestra Pombo, a patient with pulmonary emphysema admitted to the ICU of the Moinhos de Vento hospital in Porto Alegre due to treatment for pulmonary emphysema.

column2: Video Shows A Woman falling down in Jeddah.
column8: Misbar investigated the video and found that the woman is mentally unstable, which caused her to fall, according to Saudi authorities.

column2: PARTIALLY Graphic shows that COVID-19 killed less people daily than other diseases.
column8: In addition to bringing old data (February 11), the graphic ignores that the number of daily deaths caused by the pandemic has been growing rapidly - the average daily mortality jumped from 78.7 in the first month of infection to 419.7 in the second. Experts consulted by Aos Fatos claim that the comparison with other diseases masks the severity of the current situation, because, even if the mortality of the new coronavirus is not the highest, it spreads very quickly and overloads health systems.

column2: Saudi English-language Magazine Sayidaty Addresses Novel coronavirus Since 2013
column8: The magazine addressed the middle east respiratory coronavirus back then, which means that the claim is misleading.

column2: Egyptian Health Minister Arrives to Italy with Secret coronavirus Cure.
column8: Egyptian ministry of health denied any intention to visit Italy, and Misbar could not find any report published in the Foreign Policy regarding the claim.

column2: Putin Declares “Comply With Quarantine or Face Prison for Five Years”
column8: Exaggerated sanctions to be on anyone who refuse to comply with the quarantine in Russia.

column2: Garlic, onions, and other traditional medicine recipes are the treatments against the new coronavirus.
column8: There is no evidence that garlic can protect from the new coronavirus - WHO. As well as there is no support that traditional medicine can help with the new coronavirus.

column2: In the city of Lviv (or Vinnytsia) the coughing man was thrown out of the bus.
column8: The security service of Ukraine stated that the video is not related to the new coronavirus and was recorded well before the start of the pandemic or quarantine in Ukraine.

column2: Terrible conditions in Ukrainian hospitals for ordinary people on the photo.
column8: The photo of the hospital is not new. It was taken in Horlivka in 2014.

column2: mostly Hot air application through hairdryer will beat coronavirus.
column8: There is no proven evidence that hot air application through a hairdryer will cure coronavirus.

column2: Auto-hemotherapy cures COVID-19.
column8: Auto-hemotherapy it's not among the prevention or treatment measures for the new coronavirus recommended by national and international health authorities. In addition, documents from medical entities and Anvisa (Brazilian National Health Surveillance Agency) published before the COVID-19 pandemic already warned of the risks of the practice, which has no scientific backing and may offer health risks.

column2: Vaccine made by Roche Medical Company cures COVID-19 in 3 hours.
column8: It is not true that a vaccine against the coronavirus was discovered that cures the patient in three hours, as stated by publications circulating on the networks. The photo that accompanies the text is actually a quick test for the detection of COVID-19 produced by the South Korean pharmaceutical company Sugentech. There are no approved vaccines against the new coronavirus yet.

column2: mostly A viral post claiming there is a French state scandal about chloroquine, additioning 20 different claims.
column8: Most of the claims are false or out of context.

column2: Brazilian government iniciated the registration process for the coronavirus financial aid by WhatsApp.
column8: The message has been accompanied by links that can be used to steal personal data and redirect users to suspicious websites. The false information was denied by the brazilian government and Ministries of Citizenship and Economy.

column2: H1N1 was more lethal than COVID-19 in Brazil.
column8: The pieces of misinformation are misleading when comparing the number of cases in the first weeks of COVID-19 in Brazil with the accumulated eight months of swine flu. In the 28 days since its arrival in the country, the new coronavirus infected 1,891 people and killed 34; H1N1 infected 627 people and killed one in its first month.

column2: French champion of chloroquine Didier Raoult is supposed to have said not to use Bill Gates’ vaccines.
column8: Raoult's team denies he made such a statement.

column2: Actor Tom Hanks died due to coronavirus.
column8: This is a hoax. Tom hanks and his wife is recovering from coronavirus.

column2: After coronavirus pandemic, Chinese president said it’s China’s time to lead the world.
column8: The excerpt highlighted today on social media, in fact, is from a speech by Xi on October 18, 2017 at the opening of the 19th Congress of the Chinese Communist Party, which takes place every five years. In the speech, Xi Jinping spoke about the achievements of his first government and said that he wanted to further strengthen China's role on the international stage.

column2: In the city of Lviv (or Vinnytsia) the coughing man was thrown out of the bus.
column8: The security service of Ukraine stated that the video is not related to the new coronavirus and was recorded well before the start of the pandemic or quarantine in Ukraine.

column2: Brazilian government will apply fees to everyone who gets caught on the street after March 24.
column8: Although the brazilian Ministry of Health recommends that the population avoid agglomerations so as not to stimulate the spread of the new coronavirus, no legislation or regulation that prohibits the movement of people on the streets is contained in the Official Gazette of the brazilian Union, where all acts of the are published.

column2: The brazilian doctor Drauzio Varella defends that the population don’t need lockout.
column8: The video brings outdated information about the COVID-19 crisis and creates confusion by mixing real recommendations, how not to create panic, with others now ineffective, how to maintain normal life. Sites also amplify misinformation and use false titles to disorient. In a note on its website, the team that works with the doctor classified this type of disclosure as "disservice", which, according to them, is "confusing the population".

column2: mostly Hot air application through hairdryer will beat coronavirus.
column8: There is no proven evidence that hot air application through a hairdryer will cure coronavirus.

column2: One can get free masks from the government to fight coronavirus by filling this form in the web link.
column8: These are dubious web links. The government is not making any such offer.

column2: Mostly Clapping together at 5 pm will create a vibration which will destroy coronavirus.
column8: There is no proven evidence that vibration created by collectively clapping can destroy coronavirus.

column2: Mostly An audio clip claiming to be of renowned heart surgeon Dr Devi Shetty is going viral on Facebook, Twitter, and WhatsApp.
column8: The viral clip has been falsely attributed to Dr Devi Shetty.

column2: Mostly Dolphins and swans return to Italy waterways after COVID-19 lockdown.
column8: Dolphins and swans are spotted on Italy's waterways and this has nothing to do with the coronavirus lockdown.

column2: Mostly Clapping together at 5 pm will create a vibration which will destroy coronavirus.
column8: There is no proven evidence that vibration created by collectively clapping can destroy coronavirus.

column2: A declaration of the director of the Center for Coordination of Health Alerts and Emergencies of Spain about tests of COVID-19 to health personnel
column8: Fernando Simón, the director of the Center for Coordination of Health Alerts and Emergencies of Spain said that all the health personell in contact with a infected collegue with COVID-19 during a public speech, this was denied by the Health Ministery, the protocols and the personnel.

column2: Woman burned her hands while putting on the stove due to high alcohol content in hand sanitiser.
column8: It is a hoax. Alcohol in hand sanitisers evaporate completely once applied on the hands.

column2: Mostly The viral image is of a doctor couple in Italy who gave their lives treating coronavirus patients.
column8: This photograph was taken in Barcelona airport, Spain. No such news report of the Italian doctor couple found.

column2: The text from a Macedonian website, and more specifically the headline says that the Leader of the French National Front, Marine Le Pen, is the first victim from the EU from coronavirus.
column8: It is a bad translation from foreign media. Marin Le Pen has never stated that she is the first coronavirus victim in the EU. She said in an interview with the French edition of Russia Today that "the EU is a victim of coronavirus". This is very different from the text's claim that "Le Pen is a coronavirus victim".

column2: Live stream about the infected foreigners coming to Ukraine from Italy, which went viral.
column8: It turned out later that the people on that plane were not infected and some of the information by the speaker was lies.

column2: Mostly Tokyo Olympics logo has been redesigned on the theme of social distancing.
column8: The Tokyo Olympics logo has not been redesigned.

column2: A licensed guide from Rome and the Vatican named Katya tells what is really going on with the coronavirus epidemic in Italy.
column8: Several statements do not correspond to scientific facts and official statements.

column2: Video of bats found under the tiles of many roofs in Hubei, China. They were the source of coronavirus.
column8: The video was not taken in China. It’s an old video uploaded on 05 July 2011 by a Miami based roofing company called ‘Istueta Roofing’. The bats in the video were found under the tiles during the process of replacing a roof for a customer in Miami (US).

column2: Dettol sanitizer can kill coronavirus. The company knew about the coronavirus back in 2019.
column8: The ‘Coronavirus’ mentioned on Dettol bottle is the previous strains of coronavirus, not the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV). Also, Dettol manufacturer (‘RB’) has clarified that they do not yet have more details of the new virus and are not yet in a position to confirm levels of effectiveness against the new strain.

column2: 2019 novel coronavirus can be cured by one bowl of freshly boiled garlic.
column8: World Health Organization (WHO) has issued a clarification that garlic may have some antimicrobial properties but there is no evidence that it can protect people from the 2019 novel coronavirus.

column2: Video of police killing COVID-19 affected people in China.
column8: The posted video was edited with three unrelated clips to falsely claim that Police with arms are killing people. The Yiwu Police have clarified that the armed Police in the video were on their duty to kill a rabid dog. And, the last clip is related to an accident.

column2: China court gave permission to kill 20,000 patients affected with coronavirus.
column8: There is no evidence for the claim that the Chinese court had ordered to kill the 20,000 patients affected with coronavirus. Also, the website that published this news had published few fake news stories in the past.

column2: Image of coronavirus victims in China.
column8: The image is from Germany and it shows people lying down in a pedestrian zone, as part of an art project in Frankfurt, in remembrance of victims of the Katzbach Nazi concentration camp.

column2: China court gave permission to kill 20,000 patients affected with coronavirus.
column8: There is no evidence for the claim that the Chinese court had ordered to kill the 20,000 patients affected with coronavirus. Also, the website that published this news had published few fake news stories in the past.

column2: 2019 novel coronavirus can be cured by one bowl of freshly boiled garlic.
column8: World Health Organization (WHO) has issued a clarification that garlic may have some antimicrobial properties but there is no evidence that it can protect people from the 2019 novel coronavirus.

column2: Drug ”ibuprofen” can be an aggravating factor , one should use “paracetamol” instead.
column8: Based on currently available information, WHO does not recommend against the use of of ibuprofen.

column2: Coronavirus is found in Broiler Chicken.
column8: No evidence to prove that Coronovirus found in the broiler chickens. WHO has clarified that meat cooked properly can be consumed.

column2: Ministry of Home Affairs in India has directed people to not post anything related to coronavirus.
column8: The message has been undersigned by the Principal Secretary to the Home Minister but in reality there is no such post of person in the ministry.

column2: Video of police killing COVID-19 affected people in China.
column8: The posted video was edited with three unrelated clips to falsely claim that Police with arms are killing people. The Yiwu Police have clarified that the armed Police in the video were on their duty to kill a rabid dog. And, the last clip is related to an accident.

column2: Effects of coronavirus on an affected persons lip.
column8: The video shared a effect of Coronovirus on a patient lip is found to be on the internet at least since November-2019 i.e. before the recent epidemic broke out. So, it is not related to the recent coronavirus epidemic.

column2: Video of bats found under the tiles of many roofs in Hubei, China. They were the source of coronavirus.
column8: The video was not taken in China. It’s an old video uploaded on 05 July 2011 by a Miami based roofing company called ‘Istueta Roofing’. The bats in the video were found under the tiles during the process of replacing a roof for a customer in Miami (US).

column2: Videos of Pigs being buried in China due to the coronavirus outbreak.
column8: The videos posted are old. They are in no way related to the recent coronavirus outbreak.

column2: Dettol sanitizer can kill coronavirus. The company knew about the coronavirus back in 2019.
column8: The ‘Coronavirus’ mentioned on Dettol bottle is the previous strains of coronavirus, not the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV). Also, Dettol manufacturer (‘RB’) has clarified that they do not yet have more details of the new virus and are not yet in a position to confirm levels of effectiveness against the new strain.

column2: Hold your breath for 10 seconds to check if you have coronavirus or not.
column8: The fact is that most young COVID-19 patients will be able to hold their breaths for much longer than 10 seconds, while on the other hand, many elderly without the virus won’t be able to do it.

column2: Precautionary measures suggested by the UNICEF.
column8: The viral message was not issued by the UNICEF. Some of the measures suggested in the message contradict the WHO’S view on COVID-19. Also, some have no scientific evidence.

column2: Video of goats affected by Coronavirus.
column8: The video is an old one. It was taken before the recent coronavirus outbreak. Also, the Minister for Animal Husbandry, Dairying and Fisheries has clarified that there is no evidence to show that eating mutton can transmit coronavirus.

column2: Scientists have found that drinking bitter gourd juice can cure Coronavirus.
column8: The World Health Organization (WHO) or the Ministry for Health & Family Welfare (India) hasn’t announced that drinking bitter gourd juice will cure coronavirus. The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has clarified that the message is ‘fake’.

column2: Video of passengers infected with Coronavirus on an Ethiopian Airlines flight from Italy that reached Addis Ababa airport.
column8: The video is of an ‘Emergency Exercise’ at Blaise Diagne International Airport (Senegal) in November 2019. So, the video is of a drill that was conducted a month earlier before the first coronavirus case was detected in China.

column2: Press Release on movement restriction for COVID-19 outbreak by National Security Council, PMO (India).
column8: The press release in the post was issued by the Malaysian Government, not by the Indian Government.

column2: Details of three Coronavirus positive cases reported in Kothapet (Hyderabad, India).
column8: Dr G Srinivasa Rao (Director of Public Health, Telangana) has told FACTLY that the viral message is not true. Also, Rachakonda Police has tweeted that a FIR has been filed in the Chaitanyapuri PS (Kothapet area) on the person who spread the fake news.

column2: Coronavirus patients in China are being caught by officials on a highway.
column8: The video in the post is the video of a ‘Mock drill’. The China SWAT team in the video is ‘practising’ to deal with coronavirus patients.

column2: Gargling warm water with either salt or vinegar can eliminate coronavirus.
column8: The World Health Organisation (WHO) or Indian government has not mentioned anywhere that the gargling of warm water with salt or vinegar can eliminate coronavirus. Indian government’s Press Information Bureau (PIB) has also said that the message that was circulating on social media is fake.

column2: Precautionary measures suggested by the UNICEF.
column8: The viral message was not issued by the UNICEF. Some of the measures suggested in the message contradict the WHO’S view on COVID-19. Also, some have no scientific evidence.

column2: Video of the new hospital set up by China for coronavirus patients.
column8: The video is found to exist on the internet at least since 2018. So, the claim that it shows the new hospital set up by China for coronavirus patients is FALSE.

column2: Video of police in China taking into control suspected COVID-19 patients in the country.
column8: The video shows Police in Hong Kong taking into control demonstrators who were protesting against the introduction of a controversial bill that would have allowed extraditions to mainland China.

column2: Indian PM Modi is providing free masks to people under ‘Swachh Bharat Mission’ to keep them protected from Coronavirus outbreak.
column8: The website in the post is a dubious one and there is no government scheme of PM Modi under which free masks are being provided to people.
