The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has also clarified that there is no Central government scheme that provides free masks to people to keep them protected from coronavirus outbreak.

column2: Recently, Petrol companies have reduced Rs. 6.40 on petrol and on Diesel Rs. 6.80.
column8: Recently, the petrol and diesel price has not reduced by Rs.6:40 and Rs.6.80 respectively. Petrol and diesel prices have come down by about Rs.2 in the last three weeks.

column2: European Health Organization (EHO) announced that eating beaf can cure coronavirus.
column8: There is no official institution with the name European Health Organization (EHO). Also, no authority in the European Union has announced that eating beaf will cure coronavirus.

column2: Images of BJP men smearing cow dung on one another after their party leader Suman Haripriya has said that cow dung may help cure Coronavirus.
column8: Assam BJP MLA Suman Haripriya has made those statements on 02 March 2020. But the images are from ‘Goraihabba’ festival that was celebrated in Thalavadi (Tamil Nadu) on 30 October 2019.

column2: Video of American President Donald Trump announcing that Roche Medical Company will launch the vaccine for COVID-19.
column8: In the video, American President Donald Trump hasn’t said that Roche Medical Company will launch the vaccine for COVID-19. He announced FDA’s approval of a coronavirus ‘test’ developed by a company ‘Roche’ to increase and accelerate the country’s capacity to test for the virus.

column2: European Health Organization (EHO) announced that eating beaf can cure coronavirus.
column8: There is no official institution with the name European Health Organization (EHO). Also, no authority in the European Union has announced that eating beaf will cure coronavirus.

column2: Images of BJP men smearing cow dung on one another after their party leader Suman Haripriya has said that cow dung may help cure Coronavirus.
column8: Assam BJP MLA Suman Haripriya has made those statements on 02 March 2020. But the images are from ‘Goraihabba’ festival that was celebrated in Thalavadi (Tamil Nadu) on 30 October 2019.

column2: Coronavirus can live only up to 12 hours on any surface
column8: According to a scientific study, coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) was stable on some surfaces (like plastic and stainless steel) for up to 72 hours (3 days). Also, on the WHO website, it can be read that virus ‘may persist on surfaces for a few hours or up to several days’.

column2: Photo of the prime minister of Italy crying and expressing his helplessness that he couldn’t save coronavirus patients in Italy.
column8: The person in the photo is not the PM of Italy. He is Jair Bolsonaro, the President of Brazil. The photo was taken when he cried at an ‘Evangelical Thanksgiving Service’. The PM of Italy has not expressed helplessness that he couldn’t save coronavirus affected patients in Italy.

column2: Image of the people who died of Coronavirus in Italy.
column8: The photo is not related to recent coronavirus deaths in Italy. It was taken in Frankfurt (Germany) in 2014 as part of an ‘art project’ in remembrance of 528 Katzbach victims of the Nazi concentration camp.

column2: Video of the current situation in Italy due to coronavirus.
column8: The video is of an ‘Emergency Exercise’ at Blaise Diagne International Airport (Senegal) in November 2019. The mock drill was conducted to ensure if the crew can handle emergency situation at the airport.

column2: Video of Italian police taking down a man who has come on to the streets despite lockdown in the country.
column8: The video is from Brazil and it shows Police taking down an alleged knife-wielding-man in Sao Paulo on 19 March.

column2: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) extended the year closing till 30 June 2020.
column8: The normal financial year in India followed by the government & all other institutions including for taxation purpose is 01 April to 31 March. However, RBI’s accounting/financial year is from 1 July to 30 June. There is no change in the normal financial year.

column2: There is science behind Indian Prime minister Modi’s 5 PM clapping initiative: Clapping generates vibration which can kill Coronavirus. Also, 22 March 2020 is Amavasya.
column8: There is no scientific evidence to prove that vibration from clapping hands can kill coronavirus. The Press Information Bureau of India has clarified that the message is fake. Also, Amavasya is not on 22 March 2020.

column2: The Russian president, Putin, has left 800 lions outside to make people stay in their homes.
column8: The photo in the post has no connection to Russia. It is a photo of a movie shooting in South Africa. Putin did not leave 800 lions outside to make people stay in their homes.

column2: Government of India has announced a ‘National Lockdown’ in the country from 20 March 2020.
column8: No, the Government of India hasn’t announced a ‘National Lockdown’ in the country from 20 March. PM Modi, in his recent address to the nation about the coronavirus outbreak, has asked people to practice ‘social distancing’ and to stay home as much as possible for the coming few weeks to combat COVID-19. Also, the Press Information Bureau (PIB) has clarified that the message is ‘fake’.

column2: People shouting ‘Allahu Akbar’ in Europe after the Coronavirus outbreak.
column8: The video is not related to COVID-19 outbreak in Europe. The video was found to be on the internet since 13 January 2020, whereas the first COVID-19 case in Europe was reported on 24 January 2020. The video was taken in Germany, where the first COVID-19 case was reported on 28 January 2020.

column2: Photo of a vaccine developed by US scientists for COVID-19.
column8: The photo shows a COVID-19 diagnostic test kit developed by Sugentech, a South Korean based company. It is not a vaccine. As on 23 March 2020, there is no vaccine for COVID-19. Also, Trump announced FDA’s approval of a coronavirus ‘test’, not a vaccine, developed by a company ‘Roche’ to increase and accelerate the country’s capacity to test for the virus.

column2: Audio clip of a conversation claiming that Government of India will announce shutdown of the country in the coming days from 15 April to 15 June in the wake of Coronavirus outbreak
column8: PIB termed the audio clip of the phone conversation discussing ‘complete lockdown’ of the country from 15 April to 15 June as ‘fake’. WHO India has also confirmed that the audio is fake.

column2: Photo of the prime minister of Italy crying and expressing his helplessness that he couldn’t save coronavirus patients in Italy.
column8: The person in the photo is not the PM of Italy. He is Jair Bolsonaro, the President of Brazil. The photo was taken when he cried at an ‘Evangelical Thanksgiving Service’. The PM of Italy has not expressed helplessness that he couldn’t save coronavirus affected patients in Italy.

column2: Video of the current situation in Italy due to coronavirus.
column8: The video is of an ‘Emergency Exercise’ at Blaise Diagne International Airport (Senegal) in November 2019. The mock drill was conducted to ensure if the crew can handle emergency situation at the airport.

column2: The Russian president, Putin, has left 800 lions outside to make people stay in their homes.
column8: The photo in the post has no connection to Russia. It is a photo of a movie shooting in South Africa. Putin did not leave 800 lions outside to make people stay in their homes.

column2: There is science behind Indian Prime minister Modi’s 5 PM clapping initiative: Clapping generates vibration which can kill Coronavirus. Also, 22 March 2020 is Amavasya.
column8: There is no scientific evidence to prove that vibration from clapping hands can kill coronavirus. The Press Information Bureau of India has clarified that the message is fake. Also, Amavasya is not on 22 March 2020.

column2: Government of India has announced a ‘National Lockdown’ in the country from 20 March 2020.
column8: No, the Government of India hasn’t announced a ‘National Lockdown’ in the country from 20 March. PM Modi, in his recent address to the nation about the coronavirus outbreak, has asked people to practice ‘social distancing’ and to stay home as much as possible for the coming few weeks to combat COVID-19. Also, the Press Information Bureau (PIB) has clarified that the message is ‘fake’.

column2: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) extended the year closing till 30 June 2020.
column8: The normal financial year in India followed by the government & all other institutions including for taxation purpose is 01 April to 31 March. However, RBI’s accounting/financial year is from 1 July to 30 June. There is no change in the normal financial year.

column2: People shouting ‘Allahu Akbar’ in Europe after the Coronavirus outbreak.
column8: The video is not related to COVID-19 outbreak in Europe. The video was found to be on the internet since 13 January 2020, whereas the first COVID-19 case in Europe was reported on 24 January 2020. The video was taken in Germany, where the first COVID-19 case was reported on 28 January 2020.

column2: Image of dead bodies of coronavirus victims in Italy.
column8: The image shows coffins containing the dead bodies of Lampedusa shipwreck victims. In 2013, a boat packed with around 500 African migrants caught fire and sank around half a mile from the Italian island Lampedusa leading to the death of more than 300 people.

column2: COVID-19 patients will not show symptoms for the first 14 days.
column8: On the WHO website, it can be read that the incubation period for COVID-19 range from 1-14 days. But, most commonly COVID-19 patients show symptoms in around five days.

column2: Photo of Deer on Ooty-Coimbatore road during the current lockdown (COVID-19).
column8: It is an old photo. The photo is on the internet at least since 2014. It was taken in Japan, not in India.

column2: COVID-19 was known to humans before its outbreak in 2020.
column8: The new SAR-CoV-2 virus (which cause COVID-19) was first reported in December 2019. All the old images and videos being shared on social media refer to the virus as coronavirus, not as SAR-CoV-2 (or COVID-19). coronaviruses were known to human decades ago. All the references made on social media were about the coronaviruses, a general term for various viruses which cause diseases ranging from the common cold to Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS).

column2: A video of a policeman taking down a man wandering during ‘lockdown in Italy’.
column8: The video is from Brazil and it shows Police taking down an alleged knife-wielding-man in Sao Paulo on 19 March.

column2: A video showing a pile of corpses in Italy.
column8: The video in the post is not real. It was a movie clip from a 2007 mini-series called 'Pandemic'.

column2: Photo of an Indonesian doctor, Hideo Ali, looking at his children and pregnant wife for the last time.
column8: The one in the photo is not Indonesian doctor, Hideo Ali. He is a doctor from Malaysia. A Malaysian man posted this picture on Facebook saying that the doctor is his cousin and because of the spread of COVID-19 across the country, he had to leave his family and work constantly. Since, he doesn't have time he is looking at his family from a distance, and the photo is related to that instance.

column2: Another new disease called ‘Hanta virus’ in China.
column8: Hanta virus' has infected people in different countries for many years. That's not a new virus. In the US, between 1993 and 2017, approximately 728 people were infected with the virus which can be seen on the CDC website.

column2: Photos of coronavirus patients being treated on the road in Italy.
column8: The photos in the post are related to the earthquake in Croatia on 22 March. Patients at the hospital were evacuated because of the earthquake.

column2: A video of a policeman taking down a man wandering during ‘lockdown in Italy’.
column8: The video is from Brazil and it shows Police taking down an alleged knife-wielding-man in Sao Paulo on 19 March.

column2: Photo of an Indonesian doctor, Hideo Ali, looking at his children and pregnant wife for the last time.
column8: The one in the photo is not Indonesian doctor, Hideo Ali. He is a doctor from Malaysia. A Malaysian man posted this picture on Facebook saying that the doctor is his cousin and because of the spread of COVID-19 across the country, he had to leave his family and work constantly. Since, he doesn't have time he is looking at his family from a distance, and the photo is related to that instance.

column2: Iranian girl Anahita Hashemzadeh has contracted Coronavirus.
column8: Anahita Hashemzadeh hasn’t contracted coronavirus. In the comments section of her Instagram videos, her mother has clarified multiple times that she is ‘safe and healthy’ and the news regarding Anahita getting infected with coronavirus is ‘fake'.

column2: In a statement, Russian President Valdimir Putin said that Russian citizens have to choose between quarantine and prison.
column8: Putin has not enacted this, although it is a possible punishment in Moscow and there is a bill that could send those who break the quarantine and cause infections to jail.

column2: Coronavirus (COVID-19) is ‘mix of SARS, HIV, tuberculosis and malaria’.
column8: A WhatsApp audio assures this, but neither that statement, nor several others that he mentions, have scientific support.

column2: True A WhatsApp chain cites real research on the survival of different coronaviruses in various materials and in the air.
column8: SARS-CoV-2 does last hours or days on some surfaces, others need to be studied. One of the studies cited found that the SARS-CoV-2 virus survives: Three hours dispersed in air, Four hours in copper, 24 hours in cardboard and Two to three days in plastic or stainless steel.

column2: An image accompanies the text: The Italian Prime Minister wept when he recognized that they were losing the battle against the Coronavirus.
column8: Message assures that the Italian leader cried over the situation of COVID-19 in his country, but the image that supposedly proves it is of Jair Bolsonaro from Brazil at a religious ceremony in 2019.

column2: Claims that Columbian President Iván Duque approved collective dismissals of workers due to the emergency by COVID-19. Some of the messages attach as proof screenshots of Resolution 0803 of 2020 of the Ministry of Labor.
column8: Government has not approved collective dismissals for coronavirus. Resolution 0803 of 2020 of the Ministry of Labor does not authorize collective dismissals. Other measures require the employee to agree.

column2: On WhatsApp a video circulating of Rabbi Dan Ben Avraham, International President of the Netzarita AMI Alliance, according to their Twitter. In the video, the rabbi says that “the Israeli Minister of Health has officially declared that Israel has the coronavirus vaccine.” And sentence, “Israel has the vaccine already.” But this is not true. Although Israel is working on a vaccine, it is not ready yet.
column8: According to the WHO, the necessary safety approvals to bring a viable vaccine to market could take up to 18 months.

column2: Ecuadorean government gives money to people from Venezuela.
column8: The government doesn't give money to Venezuelans.

column2: Three photos showing coffins lined up in an enclosed space have been released on social media with a message about the coronavirus pandemic in Italy. “This is Italy,” he said.
column8: The images correspond to migrants killed in shipwrecks in the Mediterranean in 2013.

column2: In audio, they warn of the arrival of COVID-19 at Suba hospital.
column8: Health entities in the capital confirmed that this is misinformation. So far, there are no cases of coronavirus in the Suba hospital.

column2: Video broadcast on networks allegedly shows the ‘first killed by COVID-19 in Ibagué’, in Columbia.
column8: The images were taken out of context. It is actually the first coronavirus patient in this city to be discharged from the hospital.

column2: China Seeks Court’s Approval To Kill 20000 coronavirus Patients.
column8: Post claiming China seeks court’s approval to kill 20000 coronavirus patients is fake.

column2: Fake news, conspiracy theory, manipulation of facts, disinformation, Coronavirus was created in the lab in order to destroy the Chinese economy. The vaccine is already available.
column6: Fake news, conspiracy theory, manipulation of facts, disinformation, clickbait
column8: Claims that the "mutation of the virus corona was caused artificially in the laboratory" and that it was a "biological war" and that the virus was "released to weaken the Chinese economy" are rated as conspiracy theories because there is no evidence or argument for them.

column2: Nostradamus predicted the coronavirus pandemic.
column8:
In the book Prophecies of Nostradamus it doen´t say any of the words that are now being spread.
The prophecies that record the words "plague" and "dust" are different from the one that circulates in the image that went viral.

column2: Audio from WhatsApp in which the head of Cardiology at the Gregorio Marañón Hospital states that we are in a moment of uncontrolled coronavirus infection.
column8: The public health authorities of the Community of Madrid have classified the audio that supposedly belongs to the head of Cardiology at the Gregorio Marañón Hospital as false.

column2: Neuroscientist Rodolfo Llinás says that if you can last 10 seconds without coughing and without discomfort it means that there is no fibrosis in the lungs and therefore no coronavirus infection.
column8: Rodolfo Llinás claims that he has not said that and there is no evidence that these recommendations are effective.

column2: Madrid’s government has announced students will have to make-up classes during summer.
column8: Madrid's government hasn't announced the students will have to make-up classes during summer: the shared photo is fake.

column2: A WhatsApp message suggests holding the breath during 10 seconds and drink water every 15 minutes are effective methods fighting coronavirus.
column8: There are no medical and scientifical evidences of this.

column2: Cocaine kills coronavirus.
column8: Fake story was generated by a website that allows people to create their own news stories. Previously busted claim.

column2: CDC Recommends Men Shave Their Beards To Protect Against coronavirus.
column8: The claim is based on a Centers for Disease Control chart created in 2017 to advise medical workers on the best practices for wearing "filtering facepiece respirators" during contact with viral patients. It was not intended for the general public - nor specifically for preventing the spread of coronavirus.

column2: Coronavirus found in Broiler Chicken.
column8: No evidence to prove that Coronovirus found in the broiler chickens. WHO has clarified that meat cooked properly can be consumed.

column2: Viral claims propogating UNICEF Message About coronavirus.
column8: Mr. Jeremy Sprigge, Communication Specialist of UNICEF Sri Lanka confirmed that “these messages are NOT UNICEF statements and henceforth FALSE” and that an official communication regarding the same would be published via UNICEF’s social media channels.

column2: China builds a hospital in 48 hours for Coronavius patients.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: A man with a gas mask at a supermarket in Lugo (Galicia, Spain).
column8: The picture was taken in Austria, not Spain.

column2: Partially Chinese elderly couple infected with coronavirus say goodbye while they are in a hospital.
column8: The elderly couple hospitalized for other conditions such as lung cancer and respiratory failure.

column2: A monkey is been infected with coronavirus in this photo.
column8: The photo is a capture of a video taken at least two months before the first symtoms of COVID-19.

column2: Bats that hide under Wuhan rooftops caused the COVID-19 outbreak.
column8: The video was filmed in Miami in 2011.

column2: A video of a Chinese epidemiologist saying that there are millions of infected.
column8: Same case of this Newtral verification: https://www.newtral.es/bulos-coronavirus-wuhan-casos-videos-teorias-conspiranoicas/20200225/.

column2: A video of a Chinese epidemiologist saying that there are millions of infected.
column8: Same case of this Newtral verification: https://www.newtral.es/bulos-coronavirus-wuhan-casos-videos-teorias-conspiranoicas/20200225/.

column2: China seeks approval from the court to kill over 20 000 coronavirus patients.
column8: There are a few inadequacies detected on the source’s website. Also, zero credible news platforms have published this claim. All these make the claim unsubstantial.

column2: Satellite images showing high levels of sulphur dioxide above China are possible evidence of mass cremations of people who have died from coronavirus.
column8: This is a forecast based on historical data. Full Fact analysis was mentioned in our article.

column2: Partially China orders citizens to abandon/kill their pets as they can transmit coronavirus.
column8: There is no proof that Chinese authorities have ordererd the killing of pets; however, there is proof that some Chinese authorities have apporved killings of stray dogs and cats in order to stop the spreading of the virus. The WHO says that right now there is no evidence that the virus can be transmitted through pets.

column2: Weed kills coronavirus.
column8: The news clip was created through a meme generator while the WHO has stated that there are no proved cures for the virus yet.

column2: Video of Wuhan market where the new coronavirus started to spread.
column8: Video is from a market in Indonesia.

column2: Vitamin C and warm water with lemon are effective ways of preventing COVID-19.
column8: Vitamin C has no know effect on the novel coronavirus, and neither does warm water with lemon.

column2: Chinese people convert to islam because of cov.
column8: It s an old video, not related to CoV.

column2: Photo of Money Wasted by Italians in the Middle of the Corona Pandemic.
column8: The photo was taken in Venezuela in March 2019 where there was a bank that was looted, then the perpetrators spread the old Venezuelan money, Bolivar Fuerte, on the streets and burn it.

column2: Italians throw money on the streets.
column8: The photo has nothing to do with Italy. The photos were taken in Venezuela and published on March 11, 2019. Hooded men robbed the oldest Bank in Merida and scattered bolivars (the currency of Venezuela), which had lost value as a result of hyperinflation, through the streets.

column2: Lockdown in India extended till May 8th.
column8: The screenshot shared to make the claim is edited. Government has confirmed that the news is fake.

column2: Davao City Mayor Sara Duterte said that local government units (LGUs) should be blamed for why the P200-billion cash assistance has not reached constituents.
column8: The statement did not come from Sara Duterte nor did it reflect her views about federalism and the national government's response to the coronavirus crisis.

column2: People under querantione singing a Kurdish song at their balconies in Diyarbakır.
column8: The video is from İtaly, Sicilia. The Kurdish song was added to the original video.

column2: Man is spitting on police officer to spread COVID-19 in India.
column8: An older video of an under trial spitting on a cop as he was denied home cooked food was falsely shared as being related to COVID-19.

column2: Indian State of Gujarat’s government constructed hospital for COVID-19 patients with 2200 beds in just 6 days.
column8: Gujarat government has set up 2200 beds in 4 different hospitals in 4 cities as opposed to claim. The Gujarat state government has not constructed one hospital with capacity of 2200 beds in 6 days.

column2: MOSTLY Says a “5G LAW PASSED while everyone was distracted” with the coronavirus pandemic and lists 20 symptoms associated with 5G exposure.
column8: President Donald Trump signed a law March 23 that tasks the federal government with securing 5G data networks. It does not explicitly provide for the installation of more cell towers. Misinformation about the health effects of 5G can be traced to a 2019 propaganda campaign promoted by Russian state television.

column2: The government of Paraíba, a state in Brazil, received 11.6 million brazilian reais from the federal government to spend on healthcare during the COVID-19 crisis. Instead, this money is being spent on artistic performances.
column8: While Paraíba did receive the 11.6 million Brazilian reais, most the money has been transfered to municipal authorities for COVID-19 prevention measures. The rest, around 2% of the money, is being used by the state health department to fund its own COVID-19 related expenses. Meanwhile, two state funded cultural agencies started a project to support live artistic performances online during the lockdown. 160 thousand Brazilian reais will be spent with that. The government transfer and the cultural actions are not related.

column2: MOSTLY Says for otherwise healthy people “experiencing mild to moderate respiratory symptoms with or without a COVID-19 diagnosis … only high temperatures kill a virus, so let your fever run high,” but not over 103 or 104 degrees.
column8: A fever makes it harder for some viruses to survive, but it’s not yet known whether that’s true for the novel coronavirus.

column2: Pictures and reports of “empty hospitals” prove COVID-19 spread is “fake crisis for real government planned agendas.”
column8: There are hospitals with significant numbers of empty beds — but not because of a conspiracy that exaggerates the coronavirus outbreak.

column2: Photo of Money Wasted by Italians in the Middle of the Corona Pandemic.
column8: The photo was taken in Venezuela in March 2019 where there was a bank that was looted, then the perpetrators spread the old Venezuelan money, Bolivar Fuerte, on the streets and burn it.

column2: “This lady here applied sanitizer to her hands/forearms & went to the kitchen to cook. The moment she turned on the gas stove, her hands caught fire due to the alcohol contained in the sanitizer.”
column8: This Facebook post has the ingredients of a hoax. We could not find the original photo through reverse image searching, and we found no news reports about it. Hand sanitizer is flammable because of its alcohol content. But the fire risks are low when the product is applied properly and given time to dry.

column2: Says Nancy Pelosi’s “daughter is on the board of the Kennedy Center so that’s why it was so important to send them all that money.”
column8: None of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s children is on the Kennedy Center’s board. Pelosi is an ex-officio board member. So are several top Republican lawmakers.

column2: A picture of Tiago Leifert, host of Big Brother Brazil, with a group of Globo employees in a restaurant. The caption states that while Globo advocates for lockdown, its employees are hanging out in fancy restaurants during the COVID-19 epidemic.
column8: The picture was published by Leifert on his Instagram account in 2019. There's a banner on the background that says BBB 19 (Big Brother Brazil 19).

column2: MOSTLY “There was no effort” to get American experts into China after it announced the coronavirus, and “we had one person in-country (and Trump) pulled him out of the country.”
column8: Top Health and Human Services officials offered to send American experts to China within a week after China revealed a new virus was on the loose. China resisted American and World Health Organization teams, but eventually allowed a WHO team —that included some Americans — to enter the country.

column2: Says the U.S. is developing an “antivirus” that includes a chip to track your movement.
column8: This is a hoax. There is no “antivirus” or vaccine being developed that includes a chip to track movements.

column2: Corona Virus Form Successfully Photographed by Indian Scientists.
column8: The photo is an illustration of a virus and bacteria attached to the hand. The photo was posted on the Shutterstock website on June 15, 2015, long before the coronavirus first appeared in Wuhan, China, in December 2019.

column2: Lockdown in India extended till May 8th.
column8: The screenshot shared to make the claim is edited. Government has confirmed that the news is fake.

column2: “We were slow with the testing, but very quick with the travel ban. And that’s been much more critical in saving lives.”
column8: Travel restrictions can buy a government some time in stopping viral spread. But with that time, research shows, authorities need to put a dent in local transmission – by testing robustly, and then quarantining people who are positive.

column2: There are plenty of mortuary bags in Lenox Hills Hospital in NY.
column8: There are three parts in the video. Two were indeed filmed near/in Lenox Hill Hospital in Manhattan. But the main one, with dozens of mortuary bags, comes from Ecuador (Guayaquil).

column2: “Joe Exotic tests positive for coronavirus in prison. It’s been confirmed.”
column8: Joe Maldonado-Passage, aka Joe Exotic, is on quarantine after transferring from a prison where other inmates tested positive for COVID-19. There has been no official confirmation that he has the disease.

column2: In Bolivia, a street-selling child was expelled of his selling spot (in the street) by municipal guards. They threat him to take his products away, during the quarantine times.
column8: This happened in La Paz, Bolivia, the story was covered by the newspaper Pagina Siete on February 6th 2019.

column2: MOSTLY Says a “5G LAW PASSED while everyone was distracted” with the coronavirus pandemic and lists 20 symptoms associated with 5G exposure.
column8: President Donald Trump signed a law March 23 that tasks the federal government with securing 5G data networks. It does not explicitly provide for the installation of more cell towers. Misinformation about the health effects of 5G can be traced to a 2019 propaganda campaign promoted by Russian state television.

column2: A Facebook user uploaded a video showing a man inside a police van spitting on a cop. The post claimed that this video is a proof that Tablighi community is spreading coronavirus in India.
column8: The video viral on social media in the backdrop of the Nizamuddin Markaz incident is misleading. The video has no connection with the ongoing novel coronavirus Pandemic.A 26-year-old undertrial allegedly attacked a few policemen for not allowing him to have home-cooked food brought by his family.

column2: MOSTLY “There was no effort” to get American experts into China after it announced the coronavirus, and “we had one person in-country (and Trump) pulled him out of the country.”
column8: Top Health and Human Services officials offered to send American experts to China within a week after China revealed a new virus was on the loose. China resisted American and World Health Organization teams, but eventually allowed a WHO team —that included some Americans — to enter the country.

column2: The government of Paraíba, a state in Brazil, received 11.6 million brazilian reais from the federal government to spend on healthcare during the COVID-19 crisis. Instead, this money is being spent on artistic performances.
column8: While Paraíba did receive the 11.6 million Brazilian reais, most the money has been transfered to municipal authorities for COVID-19 prevention measures. The rest, around 2% of the money, is being used by the state health department to fund its own COVID-19 related expenses. Meanwhile, two state funded cultural agencies started a project to support live artistic performances online during the lockdown. 160 thousand Brazilian reais will be spent with that. The government transfer and the cultural actions are not related.

column2: “This lady here applied sanitizer to her hands/forearms & went to the kitchen to cook. The moment she turned on the gas stove, her hands caught fire due to the alcohol contained in the sanitizer.”
column8: This Facebook post has the ingredients of a hoax. We could not find the original photo through reverse image searching, and we found no news reports about it. Hand sanitizer is flammable because of its alcohol content. But the fire risks are low when the product is applied properly and given time to dry.

column2: Pictures and reports of “empty hospitals” prove COVID-19 spread is “fake crisis for real government planned agendas.”
column8: There are hospitals with significant numbers of empty beds — but not because of a conspiracy that exaggerates the coronavirus outbreak.

column2: Says Nancy Pelosi’s “daughter is on the board of the Kennedy Center so that’s why it was so important to send them all that money.”
column8: None of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s children is on the Kennedy Center’s board. Pelosi is an ex-officio board member. So are several top Republican lawmakers.

column2: “We were slow with the testing, but very quick with the travel ban. And that’s been much more critical in saving lives.”
column8: Travel restrictions can buy a government some time in stopping viral spread. But with that time, research shows, authorities need to put a dent in local transmission – by testing robustly, and then quarantining people who are positive.

column2: “In Chicago, Covid-19 actually LOWERED the death rate.”
column8: Deaths in Chicago increased in March 2020 compared to previous years, despite a decline in murders.

column2: A picture of Tiago Leifert, host of Big Brother Brazil, with a group of Globo employees in a restaurant. The caption states that while Globo advocates for lockdown, its employees are hanging out in fancy restaurants during the COVID-19 epidemic.
column8: The picture was published by Leifert on his Instagram account in 2019. There's a banner on the background that says BBB 19 (Big Brother Brazil 19).

column2: MOSTLY Says for otherwise healthy people “experiencing mild to moderate respiratory symptoms with or without a COVID-19 diagnosis … only high temperatures kill a virus, so let your fever run high,” but not over 103 or 104 degrees.
column8: A fever makes it harder for some viruses to survive, but it’s not yet known whether that’s true for the novel coronavirus.

column2: This voice record circulating in Turkey is based on Johns Hopkings University research.
column8: Johns Hopkings University denies the research and there is no such a paper in the database. The multiple allegations in the voice record are generally not based on scientific evidence nor the methodology.

column2: An orangutan in US started to wash his hands imitating his keeper.
column8: The video dates back to November, 2019 before the outbreak. Primats can imitate humans.

column2: Video shows demolished 5G stations in Hong Kong, protestors held the 5G responsible for COVID-19.
column8: The video dates back to summer 2019, the protests in Hong Kong. The protestors were demolishing face recognition cameras, not 5G stations.

column2: The pandemic was foreseen in Madonna’s 2019 album cover.
column8: Corona is an classic typewriter brand and the version can be seen on the cover has been produced more than a century in the US. Nothing to do with the outbreak.

column2: The viral post claims that Aajtak news channel shows lockdown is withdrawn at few places while India Today news channel shows it is extended till May 4.
column8: The lockdown is neither extended nor withdrawn at any location. News channel logos are used to create fake photos.

column2: The government raided The Medical City and other private hospitals, taking away their personal protective equipment (PPE).
column8: The Medical City, Pasig City police, and the Office of Civil Defense all denied the claim.

column2: mostly Pope Francis kissed the feet of “black people” and asked forgiveness during novel coronavirus scare.
column8: The viral video is one-year-old and has no relation to novel coronavirus.

column2: News channel graphic stating that the Indian lockdown is to be extended to May 4.
column8: The news bulletin was photoshopped.

column2: A video of an orangutan washing its hands has been viewed millions of times in Facebook, Twitter and YouTube posts which claim the animal was imitating its zookeepers during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; the video of the orangutan has circulated in reports since at least November 2019, weeks before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan in December 2019.

column2: Video shows demolished 5G stations in Hong Kong, protestors held the 5G responsible for COVID-19.
column8: The video dates back to summer 2019, the protests in Hong Kong. The protestors were demolishing face recognition cameras, not 5G stations.

column2: New York hospitals treating coronavirus patients with vitamin C.
column8: There is no evidence that assuming doses of vitamin C cures COVID-19.

column2: A man in Serbia broke the curfew by putting on a tree costume.
column8: The video dates back to 2016, Portland, US. The man in the video was an artist and arrested for interruğting the traffic.

column2: Indian actor Shah Rukh Khan donated money to Pakistan to fight Coronavirus and did not help India at all.
column8: Old video of Indian news channel India Today debunking claims that about Shah Rukh Khan donating funds to Pakistan in 2017 shared with a false narrative.

column2: mostly Disaster management act has been implemented, no citizen is allowed to post any update on coronavirus.
column8: The message is misleading and the viral video two years old.

column2: Ansa news has reported that former ECB Governor Mario Draghi will lead the Italian task-force against Covid-19.
column8: The Italian police has said that it's not the original version of the certificate, but a manipulated version of it.

column2: This voice record circulating in Turkey is based on Johns Hopkings University research.
column8: Johns Hopkings University denies the research and there is no such a paper in the database. The multiple allegations in the voice record are generally not based on scientific evidence nor the methodology.

column2: This pictures shows two people that have been seen going around pretending to give protective masks to people in need. Be careful, they’re thieves and not healthcare personnel.
column8: These two individuals have nothing to do with Italy or COVID-19. The pictures come from the police of Dusseldorf (Germany), and they've been taken on December 2019.

column2: An orangutan in US started to wash his hands imitating his keeper.
column8: The video dates back to November, 2019 before the outbreak. Primats can imitate humans.

column2: Malaysians are eating soap as a way to cure covid-19.
column8: Studies indicate eating soap could lead to digestive problems as it causes inflammation and pain in the gums,also Benjamin Chapman, professor and food safety specialist at North Carolina University claims that soap has been known for toxicity for 60 years.

column2: An Indian social activist was arrested when she tried to buy liquor during the lockdown period.
column8: An older video of the said social activist was shared with a false narrative.

column2: mostly Pope Francis kissed the feet of “black people” and asked forgiveness during novel coronavirus scare.
column8: The viral video is one-year-old and has no relation to novel coronavirus.

column2: News channel graphic stating that the Indian lockdown is to be extended to May 4.
column8: The news bulletin was photoshopped.

column2: People from Riberalta, Bolivia were punished for demanding food.
column8: The photo is from Cordova, Colombia. The President, Iván Duque announced a measure that will punish people who break the quarantine

column2: New York hospitals treating coronavirus patients with vitamin C.
column8: There is no evidence that assuming doses of vitamin C cures COVID-19.

column2: A man in Serbia broke the curfew by putting on a tree costume.
column8: The video dates back to 2016, Portland, US. The man in the video was an artist and arrested for interruğting the traffic.

column8: The claim is false; the video of the orangutan has circulated in reports since at least November 2019, weeks before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan in December 2019.

column8: The video dates back to November, 2019 before the outbreak. Primats can imitate humans.

column2: This pictures shows two people that have been seen going around pretending to give protective masks to people in need. Be careful, they’re thieves and not healthcare personnel.
column8: These two individuals have nothing to do with Italy or COVID-19. The pictures come from the police of Dusseldorf (Germany), and they've been taken on December 2019.

column2: This voice record circulating in Turkey is based on Johns Hopkings University research.
column8: Johns Hopkings University denies the research and there is no such a paper in the database. The multiple allegations in the voice record are generally not based on scientific evidence nor the methodology.

column2: Ansa news has reported that former ECB Governor Mario Draghi will lead the Italian task-force against Covid-19.
column8: The Italian police has said that it's not the original version of the certificate, but a manipulated version of it.

column2: Portuguese authorities decided that each citizen who goes to work has to have an offcial authorization to leave home.
column8: That´s not true. Portuguese government didn´t implement that measure.

column2: Hit-run deaths are counted as Covid-19 deaths in São Paulo, Brazil.
column8: The accident mentioned in the posts actually occurred on March 1 on a road in Mogi Guaçu, a Brazilian city that has not yet registered cases of the new coronavirus. In addition, the death certificate displayed in the checked posts shows the surname "de Carvalho", when the victim was named "de Cruz".

column2: If Russian people do not obey mandatory isolation they are imprisoned for 5 years.
column8: It is true that Vladimir Putin implemented this measure, but the prison sentence can be up to seven years.

column2: Because there was no school for weeks due to COVID-19, french summer hollidays will be shorter this year.
column8: This is an april fools joke. The dates haven't been changed.

column2: Muslims are licking their plates to spread coronavirus and infect more people by the virus.
column8: The video is from three years ago depicting a Dawoodi Bohri practice of licking the plate clean so as to prevent any food from being wasted before washing and is not linked to the coronavirus outbreak.

column2: Video shows EU flag was lowered in France to protests outbreak policies.
column8: The video dates back to May, 2019 before the outbreak. The politician who lower the flag had already a far-right anti-EU thoughts.

column2: mostly People sneezing purposefully to spread coronavirus at Hazrat Nizamuddin mosque in Delhi.
column8: The video has been available on the internet since long. It has no connection to coronavirus.

column2: Missouri students will have to repeat the school year because of COVID-19 school closings.
column8: The posts use a fabricated letter with a state logo to claim all students much repeat a grade because of school closings. State officials have publicly debunked the claim.

column2: You can cure coronavirus with lemon, garlic and avocado because of its pH level.
column8: There are several mistakes in the pH scale of the ingredients and there is no known cure.

column2: Prince Charles recovery from COVID-19 is suspicious, it is the proof that a vaccine already exists.
column8: If there was a vaccine, Prince Charles wouldn't have been sick in the first place.

column2: Soaking in the Sea Can Treat Corona Covid-19 Virus Infection.
column8: As with the nature of other viruses, the novel coronavirus attacks cells in the body, not the surface of the body like the skin, so it cannot be cured simply by soaking in the sea. Until now, according to WHO, there is no drug or vaccine to cure or prevent COVID-19.

column2: 59 Church Congregation in Africa Killed After Drinking Dettol to Prevent Corona.
column8: A priest in South Africa, Rufus Phala, had indeed told his followers to drink Dettol as a cure. However, the incident occurred in 2016, long before the emergence of the Corona COVID-19 virus in December 2019. Photos used to disseminate the narrative have also been circulating since 2016. In addition, no credible sources were found containing information on the existence of 59 church members in Africa Selatan who died from drinking Dettol because recently asked by Rufus.

column2: Videos show Chinese people spreading the coronavirus in other countries.
column8: In the recordings, people appear spitting and rubbing contaminated fluids on benches, walls and elevators. Of the five recordings, Aos Fatos identified that three have nothing to do with the current pandemic. The other two sections did not have their origin or context identified.

column2: By e-mail sent to major newsrooms, Portuguese government announces cancellation of great projects of airports, due to the finantial restrictions caused by the impact of coronavirus.
column8: I's a fraudulent email that was not issued by the Portuguese government.

column2: Italians threw away their currency on the streets due to COVID-19 deaths.
column8: The images are from Venezuela where vandals robbed a bank and threw the demonetised money on the streets.

column2: Coronavirus causes male infertility.
column8: The publications refer to the report published on March 12 on the official website of the Hubei government and the study posted on the platform MedRxiv.org. The published report was not clinically investigated. A few hours later, it was removed from the government's website. Resource MedRxiv.org publishes articles that have not yet been accepted and/or approved by the scientific and / or medical community, may contain errors or incomplete information. To claim that the COVID-19 virus leads to male infertility, based on research not confirmed by the international medical community, is premature and erroneous.

column2: Trump got a Moroccan shiekh (muslim priest) to put a spell on him that prevent COVID19.
column8: The original video is from President Trump meeting with religious leaders on National Day of Prayer in 1 september 2017.

column2: President Giammattei gave instructions that were contradictory to the published law regarding COVID-19 mesures.
column8: The President´s instructions were contradictory to the published law, but the written law prevails, as experts explained us.

column2: Mostly Coronavirus does not cause a runny nose; is killed by temperatures above 26 degrees; causes lung fibrosis within days of infection; can be diagnosed by holding your breath for 10 seconds; and can be cured in the early stages by drinking plenty of water.
column8: Numerous claims circulating on social media tout untested diagnostic methods, preventions, treatments, and cures for COVID-19. While many of these are not harmful by themselves, they could potentially induce a false sense of security that causes individuals to ignore basic, tested precautionary measures such as frequent handwashing, disinfecting surfaces, avoiding touching the face, social distancing, and self-isolation when sick, which have all proven effective in slowing the spread of the pandemic.

column2: UK, USA have asked Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to lead a task force to tackle Coronavirus.
column8: There is no such task force that the Indian prime Minister is heading. The Indian prime minister has been a part of the G20 and SAARC summits for their discussions on coronavirus. The WION's reporting was misinterpreted.

column2: mostly People sneezing purposefully to spread coronavirus at Hazrat Nizamuddin mosque in Delhi.
column8: The video has been available on the internet since long. It has no connection to coronavirus.

column2: Bill Gates wrote a letter where he says coronavirus has a “spiritual purpose” and is “a great corrector”.
column8: The viral letter is a hoax and has been falsely attributed to Bill Gates.

column2: Facebook posts shared thousands of times feature a video of US officials talking to reporters, with captions claiming they are announcing the arrest of a Chinese sci
column8: However, the footage has nothing to do with COVID-19 and scientists have refuted allegations the virus was deliberately created.

column2: Image with the narration to claim that a huge number of Muslims were roaming in Beruwala City in Sri Lanka during curfew risking the lives of many amidst COVID19
column8: The image was from a large Muslim procession held in March 2019.

column2: A list of ten tips to combat coronavirus from the board member of Stanford hospital: COVID-19 patients don’t have a runny nose; drinking hot water can prevent infection with COVID-19.
column8: Stanford Health Care denied its board of directors had published this list. All the tips are typical misinformation around COVID-19 which was already debunked by fact-checkers.

column2: Information about a complete quarantine in Guatemala.
column8: Those were mesures taken by the president of Bolivia, not the president of Guatemala.

column2: Guatemalan Ministry of Health is hiding a COVID-19 case in a hospital in the city of Amatitlán.
column8: There wasn´t any hidden cases in Amatitlán.

column2: This Harvard Professor Arrested Because He Created The Corona Virus.
column8: The three were arrested in three different cases and were not related to the coronavirus. Lieber was charged with lying about his participation in a program from the Chinese government and his affiliation with Wuhan University of Technology (WUT). Lieber is not a virus expert, nor does WUT focus on viruses.

column2: Used Clothing in This Video Comes from Corona Patients in China Who Have Died.
column8: Photos of clothes in plastic bags have been circulating since January 30, 2013, long before the outbreak of the Corona COVID-19 virus since December 2019.

column2: Queen Elizabeth II is infected with the new coronavirus.
column8: Buckingham Palace has only confirmed that Prince Charles is infected with COVID-19. There has never been an official announcement about the Queen.

column2: False and deeply Ginger, onion and garlic help with coronavirus.
column8: WHO has long debunked popular rumors about coronavirus — including about ginger. It doesn't help against the virus. In General, no food product can protect you from the virus (!). and for some people, ginger is simply harmful. The mailing list about onions was translated using an automatic translator, apparently from Chinese. In fact, the onion does not have such properties.

column2: Lidl supermarkets are offering 250 euros worth of food due to the new coronavirus pandemic.
column8: It's fake. This is a phishing scam designed to steal users personnal data.

column2: Mostly UV rays and sunlight can kill coronavirus.
column8: A concentrated form of UVC might kill COVID-19 but it is extremely harmful for human skin. Sunlight cannot kill COVID-19.

column2: Lidl supermarkets are offering 250 euros worth of food due to the new coronavirus pandemic.
column8: It's fake. This is a phishing scam designed to steal users personnal data.

column2: Lemon juice and bicarbonate mixture prevents and cures COVID-19 in Israel.
column8: Lemon juice and bicarbonate tea has not been proven to affect COVID-19, and the virus has killed more than 30 in Israel.

column2: Italians are throwing their money on the streets as it is useless to them now in the time of Coronavirus scare.
column8: These are old pictures from Venezuela and have nothing to do with the COVID-19 pandemic

column2: Mostly UV rays and sunlight can kill coronavirus.
column8: A concentrated form of UVC might kill COVID-19 but it is extremely harmful for human skin. Sunlight cannot kill COVID-19.

Lieber was charged with lying about his participation in a program from the Chinese government and his affiliation with Wuhan University of Technology (WUT). Lieber is not a virus expert, nor does WUT focus on viruses.

column2: A WhatsApp chain that claims that during the Alert State, the government will begin to record all calls and track social media publications of citizens.
column8: A WhatsApp chain ensures that all communications will be recorded. This chain says that there will be a record and monitoring of calls and content distributed through social networks. It is a false string. It has been moving since 2017 in Mexico.

column2: Azan (islamic prayer call) is said from an old mosque in Granada for the first time after 500 years because of COVID19.
column8: The mosque in the video is in Balakan in Azerbaijan not Granada and the voice on the video belongs to the Iranian Mahdy Yarahi.

column2: People in italy are dropping their money on the streets because of COVID19 crisis.
column8: The original photo belongs to an old non valuable currency that has been replaced with a new one in Venezuela. the money on the street is from robbers of a bank after they realized that what they have stolen is useless currency.

column2: French summer hollidays have been rescheduled to the end of July.
column8: The original dates haven't been changed.

column2: Breathing steam from boiling citrus peels prevents and cures coronavirus.
column8: There is no way to increase your body temperature to kill the coronavirus, according to the WHO. Nigerian medical experts agreed that there was no evidence for the video's claims.

column2: Video of the Funeral of Corona Patients in Italy who Died.
column8: The video is an excerpt from a scene in the television series titled "Pandemic" which aired in 2007.

column2: Filmmaker Sudhir Mishra getting beaten up by police during the lockdown for stepping out of home.
column8: The man getting beaten up by police is not filmmaker Sudhir Mishra.

column2: Here’s the new certificate that the Ministry of the Interior is now requesting to citizens in order to leave their house.
column8: The Italian police has said that it's not the original version of the certificate, but a manipulated version of it.

column2: Mostly Air India is operating evacuation flights to bring back stranded Indians from London.
column8: The Indian High Commission in London has denied the claim. There is no such immediate plan of evacuation.

column2: Amid the coronavirus crisis, Italy’s streets are now filled with discarded printed cash as seen in photos circulating on social media.
column8: The photos were taken in Venezuela, not Italy. The discarded banknotes were Bolivar Fuerte, Venezuela’s old currency.

column2: Here’s the new certificate that the Ministry of the Interior is now requesting to citizens in order to leave their house.
column8: The Italian police has said that it's not the original version of the certificate, but a manipulated version of it.

column2: Azan (islamic prayer call) is said from an old mosque in Granada for the first time after 500 years because of COVID19.
column8: The mosque in the video is in Balakan in Azerbaijan not Granada and the voice on the video belongs to the Iranian Mahdy Yarahi.

column2: Donald Trump announced comercialization of a vaccine.
column8: The text refers to a press conference where Trump did not say that. There is no vaccine yet.

column2: A viral text based image post claiming that 5000 from Italy were infected due to mobile phone cover quoting the findings were from a research without specifying any details or name of the research. The post advises to abandon phone cover and use phone without phone cover
column8: There has been no research that proved that  5000 people from Italy are infected due to phone cover.

column2: Image of bakery items with the WHO logo and a message which given the impression that WHO had advised the public not to consume bakery products amidst COVID19 concerns.
column8: WHO has not issued any statement against consumption of bakery products and FDA confirms that there is no evidence of food or food packaging being associated with transmission of COVID-19.

column2: A post claiming that Yangon region in Myanmar will be locked down within 48 hours saying that announcement will come out officially.
column8: Yangon region minister for immigration and social welfare Daw Moe Moe Suu Kyi confirms that the news is false, and no plan to lockdown within 48 hours.

column2: A video from Italian TV predicted the virus in 2015.
column8: The video does not refer to the actual virus and is not talking about that.

column2: Pope Francis asked believers to put a white handkerchief on their doorstep for the plague to go away.
column8: There is no reference to the Pope's alleged request in any of the Vatican's official news services.

column2: The king of Spain can supposedly dissolve the congress and appoint an emergency government during the state of alarm
column8: During the state of alarm, the Congress of Deputies cannot be dissolved. In addition, the acts of the king will always have to be approved and signed by the President of the Government or the Congress of Deputies and the dissolution of the Cortes can only occur in 3 specific cases, which do not contemplate the current situation.

column2: Multiple posts shared hundreds of times on Facebook and Twitter in March 2020 claim a new vaccine and a new drug have been developed to prevent and treat the novel coronavirus. The posts claim the developments were made by scientists in Japan and the Philippines respectively.
column8: The claims are misleading; the Japanese government announced in late March 2020 that Japanese scientists were testing a new drug, not a vaccine, to treat COVID-19; the Philippine Food and Drug Administration warned the other drug cited in the misleading posts was "unregistered" and not safe.

column2: “The Kaaba opened again” or “the Hajj was not stopped”.
column8: As such, the Kaaba did not close. On February 27, the official website of the Ministry of health of Saudi Arabia in connection with the spread of the coronavirus in the list of measures taken provides for a temporary suspension of the small pilgrimage. In addition, the Minister of Pilgrimage and Umrah of Saudi Arabia, Mohamed Saleh Benten, officially announced on his Twitter page that the small Hajj has been temporarily suspended. However, residents of the city can get into the mosque.

column2: Official news: in Naples people have used Tocilizumab, a drug that will cure Covid-19.
column8: The Italian Healthcare Ministry have authorized experiment to understand whether this drug can be effective against COVID-19 pneumonia. However, this research has not proved anything yet.

column2: A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple Facebook, Instagram and YouTube posts which claim it shows people in China toppling a 5G tower because of fears that they cause the novel coronavirus
column8: The claim is false; the video shows pro-democracy protesters toppling a smart lamppost in Hong Kong in August 2019, several months before the novel coronavirus outbreak.

column2: Mostly WHO advisory asks people not to consume bakery items as they get contaminated by coronavirus easily.
column8: WHO has not issued any such advisory. Till now, there is no evidence that bakery items get easily contaminated by coronavirus.

column2: Several photos of coffins, allegedly, with victims of the coronavirus for which the police are being investigated
column8: Four photos with a large number of coffins are disseminated with messages such as "the photo by which dozens of police and health officials are being investigated" or "images of the Spain that Pedro Sánchez is leaving us". It is a hoax: the photos correspond to a shipwreck in front of the island of Lampedusa (Italy) in October 2013.

column2: Inhalation of hot steam can kill Novel Coronavirus.
column8: Inhalation of steam from hot water does not kill COVID-19.

column2: A video of an alleged seer who predicted the coronavirus in December 2019
column8: There is no evidence that the video published by the seer, called Nube de María, a few days ago was recorded and broadcast in December, as they claim.

column8: During the state of alarm, the Congress of Deputies cannot be dissolved. In addition, the acts of the king will always have to be approved and signed by the President of the Government or the Congress of Deputies and the dissolution of the Cortes can only occur in 3 specific cases, which do not contemplate the current situation.

column2: A video post related to corona virus is circulating in social media saying China distributing Quran
column8: We found this video is related with Chinese Christians when Bible is seen for the first time and the video was originally shared in 2015.

column2: A video from Italian TV predicted the virus in 2015.
column8: The video does not refer to the actual virus and is not talking about that.

column2: The french doctor Jean-Roger Hospital sent an e-mail which claim that you can protect yourself against COVID-19 by drinking water very 15 minutes.
column8: M. Hospital says he has been hacked. It is also false to claim that you can be protected by drinking water.

column8: The claim is false; the video shows pro-democracy protesters toppling a smart lamppost in Hong Kong in August 2019, several months before the novel coronavirus outbreak.

column2: When you complete a registration for a 5000 Baht support fund, it will show you a green sign, not a blue sign.
column8: The correct one is a blue one.

column2: partly Website offers a rapid test for COVID19 to check yourself in seconds.
column8: The website depend mainly on fever to diagnose COVID-19 even you said you have all other symptoms including dry cough, dyspnea and fatigue. the algorism will still say you are ok and only having the common flu. the good part in the website is that it guide you when you have fever to go to hospital for treatment.

column2: Mostly WHO advisory asks people not to consume bakery items as they get contaminated by coronavirus easily.
column8: WHO has not issued any such advisory. Till now, there is no evidence that bakery items get easily contaminated by coronavirus.

column8: The Italian Healthcare Ministry have authorized experiment to understand whether this drug can be effective against COVID-19 pneumonia. However, this research has not proved anything yet.

column2: mostly Inhaling the steam of sea salt and orange peelings can prevent coronavirus infection.
column8: There is no scientific proof of the claim; WHO does not mention this remedy.

column2: The current Coronavirus outbreak is due to the movement towards 5G.
column8: The 5G connection has no scientific evidence to the outbreak of coronavirus

column2: Boiled sumac cures COVID-19.
column8: The person makes the claim is a cleric, not a scientist. There is no evidence shows sumac cures the disease.

column2: Pakistan’s Dr. Usama Riaz, who contracted coronavirus while treating patients had left a before he died.
column8: he various social media platforms claiming that the person in the video is Dr.Usama Riaz is misleading. He is Mubhasir Ahmed, who has been living in the United Kingdom.

column2: The viral text message claims that the chemical substances (methylxanthines) required to cure COVID-19 can be found in tea. Dr. Li Wenliang had found this cure while researching about coronavirus before his death.
column8: A veteran microbiologist of India Dr. Sharad Kale, dismissed such reports saying - though methylxanthines are found in tea, there is no scientific evidence it cures coronavirus. He termed it Hoax. WHO also states that no evidence that current medicine can prevent or cure the disease.

column2: Huawei stopped donating masks to Europe.
column8: Huawei denied that it has stopped sending masks to support Europe, and has not issued an official statement.

column2: A comparison of the evolution of the coronavirus in Argentina and Chile.
column8: Specialists indicated that the data in the post is not enough to compare objectively the evolution of the pandemic in each country.

column2: Audio clips from a doctor that works for Argentina´s most important lab testing for coronavirus.
column8: The lab denied the alleged doctor work there. Many of the advises given in the audio clip were denied by specialist.

column2: The co-founder of the Union, Progress and Democracy (UPyD) party, Rosa Díe allegedly tweeted that she says “it is time for the Army to take over …” to handle the emergency.
column8: There are no archive that show that this tweet ever existed.

column2: A viral video post claiming that Myanmar people have resistance to coronavirus as they eat fishpaste and vegetables. The video narration he says that Myanmar people eat rice, fishpaste and vegetables- thus we don’t need to worry about coronavirus infections as our immune system is stronger than people from the west.
column8: There is no evidence or recommendation from WHO for possible COVID-19 prevention by taking a certain food. An article in ABC news quoted two experts saying no single food is supercharger for immune system. Mohs has confirmed three COVID-19 confirmed cases two days after the viral video had such a claim.

column2: CDC recommends people to shave their facial hair to prevent coronavirus.
column8: No such recommendations have been made by CDC so far.

column2: COVID-19 affects mainly people with type A blood (group II).
column8: The articles refer to the Medrxiv website, which can not serve as a reliable source of scientific knowledge, and the figures in the study itself are very controversial and it is impossible to draw a final conclusion from them.

column2: mostly Inhaling the steam of sea salt and orange peelings can prevent coronavirus infection.
column8: There is no scientific proof of the claim; WHO does not mention this remedy.

column2: “These are the coffins of people that have died from Covid-19. Would you now stay at home you idiots?”
column8: This picture is from 2013 and shows the coffins of migrants that died crossing the Mediterranean sea.

column2: Official statement of the Serbian Governement claiming that experts recommended to ban pet walks.
column8: Experts involved in Crisis Headquoter Fighting against COVID-19 denied Government's claim.

column2: The coronavirus stays for 8 hours spreading in the air.
column8: COVID-19 seems to spread mainly through respiratory droplets and close contact. The droplets are too large to be transported by air for long periods of time

column2: “These are the coffins of people that have died from Covid-19. Would you now stay at home you idiots?”

column2: The Argentinian vicepresident flew to her home state and violeted the quarantine.
column8: She was not on the flight indicated by the viral post. She is also exempt from the quarantine, as all high ranking government officials.

column2: A recipe involving a full lemon and ground cloves has cured a woman’s COVID19 symptoms. She isn’t sure she and her maid actually had COVID19, but she still encourage people who think they have it to take this recipe.
column8: There is no evidence that full lemon and ground cloves can cure COVID-19.

column2: 59 people from Kenya die after drinking Detol when Prophet Rufus Phala of AK Spiritual Christian Church told them to do so to prevent COVID19 infection.
column8: The incident is correct but not related to COVID-19 as it happened in 2016. the priest defended himself that the Detol will transfer to water or juice with god's permission while they are drinking it.

column2: According to an university by the University of Turin: taking more vitamin D to reduce the risk of infection by the coronavirus.
column8: There is not a study from the University of Turin. University professors have written advice for patients with vitamin D deficiency. Professors don't say it reduces risk of infection.

column2: A post has been shared repeatedly in multiple posts on Facebook which claim that Singapore has started enforcing spot fines for people who flout certain social distancing regulations during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; the Singaporean government agency overseeing the enforcement of the social distancing order refuted the claim; there is no mention of spot fines for offenders in the recently announced government regulations.

column2: An article shared hundreds of times on Facebook claims that the Ethiopian government has approved a traditional medicine treatment for COVID-19 after successful clinical trials on animals and humans.
column8: However, the Ministry of Health denied the claims and Capital Ethiopia, which published the story, has corrected its Facebook post.

column2: Posts on social media claim that a “Spanish biological researcher” called on international soccer stars Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi to find a cure for COVID-19 since they earn much more money than scientists.
column8: However, the accompanying photo shows a Spanish politician speaking in April 2018, well before the novel coronavirus outbreak

column2: Italian President Mattarella: “Italy will declare a life-long quarantine”
column8: President Mattarella never said that, and never could. In addition, errors made in the distributed passage indicate that the text is likely to be the product of poor-quality automatic translation. This is the first sign that the authenticity of the message is in doubt, and it needs to be verified in detail.

column2: Drinking mix of baking soda and lemon as a hot tea cures Covid-19. Claims this “cure” has meant that there have been cases of Covid-19 in Israel, where the drink is popular.
column8: No scientific evidence for claim, confirmed by WHO and experts. Israel had nearly 5,000 cases of COVID-19 at time of publication.

column2: Photo of Kenyan crowds waiting for coronavirus curfew to start.
column8: Old photo from 2011; of crowds of Kenyans in Nairobi looking at collapsed building.

column2: mostly Indian Telecom company Jio announced a free recharge worth Rs 498 for all Indian citizens during Coronavirus lockdown
column8: Telecom company Jio officially denied the claim on their official Twitter handle.

column2: Video clip shows people keep leaving Phuket.
column8: It's not in Phuket. It's actually a news from Thailand-Myanmar border in the north. And they are Myanmar labour who wanted to go to their home country.
