column8: There is not a study from the University of Turin. University professors have written advice for patients with vitamin D deficiency. Professors don't say it reduces risk of infection.

column2: An article shared hundreds of times on Facebook claims that the Ethiopian government has approved a traditional medicine treatment for COVID-19 after successful clinical trials on animals and humans.
column8: However, the Ministry of Health denied the claims and Capital Ethiopia, which published the story, has corrected its Facebook post.

column2: Posts on social media claim that a “Spanish biological researcher” called on international soccer stars Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi to find a cure for COVID-19 since they earn much more money than scientists.
column8: However, the accompanying photo shows a Spanish politician speaking in April 2018, well before the novel coronavirus outbreak

column2: Video shows Italian people do a islamic prayer in streets, asking God to alleviate COVID19 epidemic.
column8: The video is from San Martin, Peru on the 7 december 2019. It's tied to a political crisis not to the COVID-19 epidemic.

column2: Newborn Babies Call Boiled Eggs Can Treat Corona.
column8: The video used to complete the narration is an edited video. In addition, until now, there has been no vaccine or drug to prevent or treat COVID-19, including eggs. Eggs are recommended for consumption so that the immune system increases.

column2: Photo of Kenyan crowds waiting for coronavirus curfew to start.
column8: Old photo from 2011; of crowds of Kenyans in Nairobi looking at collapsed building.

column2: A post has been shared repeatedly in multiple posts on Facebook which claim that Singapore has started enforcing spot fines for people who flout certain social distancing regulations during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; the Singaporean government agency overseeing the enforcement of the social distancing order refuted the claim; there is no mention of spot fines for offenders in the recently announced government regulations.

column2: Drinking mix of baking soda and lemon as a hot tea cures Covid-19. Claims this “cure” has meant that there have been cases of Covid-19 in Israel, where the drink is popular.
column8: No scientific evidence for claim, confirmed by WHO and experts. Israel had nearly 5,000 cases of COVID-19 at time of publication.

column2: mostly Indian Telecom company Jio announced a free recharge worth Rs 498 for all Indian citizens during Coronavirus lockdown
column8: Telecom company Jio officially denied the claim on their official Twitter handle.

column2: Mostly Dr. Usman Riyaz from Delhi died of Coronavirus.
column8: Viral picture is of Dr. Riyaz Usman from UAE and he is alive.

column2: Video clip shows people keep leaving Phuket.
column8: It's not in Phuket. It's actually a news from Thailand-Myanmar border in the north. And they are Myanmar labour who wanted to go to their home country.

column2: Indian Government Has Issued A Guideline To Monitor Citizens Activity, their call and social media handles will be under surveillance.
column8: A Twitter user has shared the same claim on November 24, 2017. The viral forward is ‘Fake’ and the Indian government has not issued any guidelines to monitor the activities of its citizens on various social media and messaging platforms.

column2: Prince Charles tested positive for COVID-19 after meeting Bollywood singer Kanika Kapoor.
column8: The viral picture is old and was taken in 2015, during a charity event by UK royalty Prince Charles and Camilla; hence it is proved that the viral claim is ‘Misleading.’

column2: A councilor for Podemos in the Canary Islands tweeted that there are “useless elderly dead” that “are left over on the street”.
column8: That person is not a member of the political party and the Political party in the Canary Islands denied on its twitter account.

column2: Puerta de Hierro hospital in Madrid uses a whole floor for the president’s family.
column8: The hospital denied it.

column2: Prince Charles tested positive for COVID-19 after meeting Bollywood singer Kanika Kapoor.
column8: The viral picture is old and was taken in 2015, during a charity event by UK royalty Prince Charles and Camilla; hence it is proved that the viral claim is ‘Misleading.’

column2: There is no space in the hospitals in Italy because of which people are crowding outside.
column8: The claim with the pictures is false. While these photos are both real and recent, they are actually from Croatia’s capital Zagreb, which was rocked by a powerful earthquake on 22 March.

column2: First death from coronavirus in Barranquilla, Columbia.
column8: The death has not been confirmed.

column2: An audio that says that MMS or sodium chlorite cures the coronavirus in 24 hours.
column8: An audio by Isidro Fuentes García, alleged biologist, and a video by Josep Pamiès, fined by the Generalitat of Cataluña for promoting pseudotherapies to cure diseases, is going viral. In it he advises the MMS or sodium chlorite as a solution in 24 hours against the coronavirus. There is no evidence that works against COVID-19.

column2: Video post claiming that inhaling traditional appetizer salt with limestone can cure COVID-19 infection.
column8: Currently there is no medicine/Vaccine to cure or prevent COVID-19 as per WHO, also Dr. Myo Thant-deputy director general of Yangon region’ public confirms the mentioned claims on COVID-19 cure to be false.

column2: Viral WhatsApp audio message claims President Buhari and his Chief of Staff flew out of the country for coronavirus treatment.
column8: Credible sources from the presidency clarify that Abba Kyari who tested positive for COVID-19 is in Lagos for treatment. As regarding the President, no credible reports suggest he is infected with the novel coronavirus.

column2: An Indian politician claimed that the strain of coronavirus in India is less virulent mutation.
column8: Experts and doctors have denied this claim and said that there is no such study which corroborates the information provided by the politician in his tweet.

column2: A vaccine for coronavirus has been found.
column8: Is not a vaccine, is a test of antibodies.

column2: An image poster stating Indian religious leader Mata Amritanandamayi has hidden foreigners in her hermitage and not allowed them to be tested.
column8: FactCrescendo contacted the relevent officials who have dismissed the allegations calling it a motivated campaign against the Hermitage.

column2: Italian President said that Italy has surrendered to the Coronavirus.
column8: Neither the Italian Prime Minister nor President have stated that Italy has surrendered to the virus. We even crosschecked with Italian fact checkers.

column2: Image of mother unable to feed her suckling as she battles COVID-19.
column8: The image is of a 35 year old woman comforting her daughter at the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Center in Seattle, Washington.

column2: Images of the medical facility shared with the claim that the Indian Army set up a 1000-bed hospital in Rajasthan amidst Coronavirus Pandemic.
column8: Upon investigation, we found out that all the images were old and two of them were not even from India. One is from the US and another is from Germany. Even the Indian Army clarified on Twitter that such claims are baseless.

column2: Image of COVID19 infected Indonesian doctor Hadio Ali watching his daughters from a distance as he bids them final goodbye, the image is said to be posted by his wife.
column8: The Image posted is of a Malaysian doctor posted by one of his relatives, and the doctor is alive and healthy.

column2: An audio clip is circulating on Whatsapp claiming that Nagpur (Second Capital of Indian state Maharashtra) has tested 59 positive coronavirus cases including 3 doctors.
column8: We found that there are only 4 positive coronavirus cases in Nagpur. The district administration and Nagpur Municipal Corporation have denied such rumors. Divisional Commissioner of Nagpur said the administration would take stern action against such rumor mongers. We also spoke with Deputy Commissioner who informed the same.

column2: Are Decathlon’s snorkeling masks used in hospitals to help patients breathing?
column8: The idea came from Italy where a doctor contacted a 3D printer and the sports brand to adapt masks to the respirators. The company shared the 3D plans of her masks, but remains very cautious about the outcome of such an innovation.

column2: Why you should not take seriously this card on the efficacy of chloroquine.
column8: Datas of the card are not accurate. Some are obsolete for days and some for years.

column2: No, these photos of patients and medical beds on the street do not show the situation of Italian hospitals.
column8: These viral photos of medical beds and patients on the streets do not show Italy suffering from coronavirus, but Croatia, after the earthquake on March 22.

column2: No, Vladimir Putin did not drop lions in the streets to force the Russians to stay at home.
column8: A picture of a lion in the street went vira, but the animal has nothing to do with coronavirus or Russia.

column2: Photo posts claiming a person committing suicide by jumping from a building in Italy, Doctor couple in a Italian hospital few hours before their death and chaos in an Italian hospital amid COVID19
column8: The first image is from Spain where a woman commited suicide in December 2019, The second image is of a couple at the Barcelona airport and the third image is from recent earthquake in Croatia.

column2: Reliance Jio, one of the biggest telecom networks in India is providing Internet for free during COVID-19
column8: A spokesperson from the company denied any such schemes and the link in the messages were linked to scamming websites.

column2: A picture claiming that an Italian man committed suicide after his whole family succumbed to COVID-19
column8: The image is of a woman committing suicide in Spain in December 2019. BOOM could not establish what drove the woman to take such a step.

column2: A message from the CHU in Mans (hospital in France) presenting alarmist arguments to encourage French people to stay home.
column8: CHU Le Mans denied having written such a message. Arguments in the message are false or unfounded.

column2: An image with human body figurines in a bowl that claims China is serving human baby soup in its restaurants.
column8: The image is of an art installation to raise awareness about the rampant killing of sharks.

column2: Videos showing police detaining COVID-19 patients in India
column8: These were mock drills that were conducted by the UP Police to determine the preparedness of the public with regards to COVID-19.

column2: Pictures of people stranded on hospital beds claimed to be Italy not coping with the pressure of COVID-19 cases and that India should learn from Italy’s mistakes and not step out of the house in the 21 days lockdown
column8: The images were from the earthquake that hit Croatia on March 22, 2020 and were falsely shared as Italy.

column2: A post with a photo claiming that an Italian mother, suffering from COVID-19, hugs her baby
column8: The viral image is an old image, The mother is suffering from cancer and was clicked post her radiotherapy when she could not hug her child.

column2: A councilor for Podemos in the Canary Islands tweeted that there are “useless elderly dead” that “are left over on the street”.
column8: That person is not a member of the political party and the Political party in the Canary Islands denied on its twitter account.

column2: The WHO has decreed the “suspension of any and all medical activities”
column8: It is a false headline, accompanied by a text explaining that it is the Portuguese Government that has taken this measure in relation to dentistry and stomatology.

column2: A herd of deer shared as them flocking out in Tamil Nadu, India due to the lockdown of the Coronavirus
column8: The image is originally from Japan and was taken in 2014. It shows the Nara deers that are considered to be auspicious flanking the streets of Nara.

column2: The outbreak was discussed in the German Bundestag back to 2012.
column8: The report discussed in the Bundestag was about a possible outbreak and how Germany can be prepared. The possible coronavirus outbreak was also foreseen by scientists.

column2: Portuguese government has spent much more than the acceptable price for ventilators.
column8: It´s false that the Portuguese government has spent much more than would be acceptable buying the ventilators. The prices are aligned with market prices.

column2: Putin sent lions into streets to discourage people from going out.
column8: The photo dates back to 2016 and taken in Johannesburg during a movie shooting.

column2: This chart shows the current cases in Turkey.
column8: The chart shows the quarantined people coming from abroad.

column2: Augusto Heleno, Brazilian general, was cured from COVID-19 infection using chloroquine.
column8: Augusto Heleno denied he had taken chloroquine for his COVID-19. He tested positive last week, but returned to work only seven days later.

column2: Dead bodies of coronavirus patients are being discarded now in mass graves in Italy, according to a 23-second video clip that has gone viral on social media.
column8: The video clip was from the US miniseries Pandemic released in 2007.

column2: PARTLY The coronavirus did not reach the Chinese cities of Beijing and Shanghai, as well as Russia and North Korea.
column8: The virus spread to Beijing and Shanghai in January, Russia had its first cases in February, while North Korea's claim of being coronavirus-free is largely contested.

column2: Supposed quote from the Argentinian president alerting that goverment aid was going to be removed from those who violeted the quarantine.
column8: The quote is fake and the disinformation was created by a joke generator website.

column2: An image has been shared hundreds of times in multiple posts on Facebook alongside a claim it shows a poster issued by activist group Extinction Rebellion that states “Corona is the cure, humans are the disease”.
column8: The claim is false; Extinction Rebellion said that the image was published by an unaffiliated Twitter account and that the poster’s message in “no way” represents the global environmental movement’s “principles and values”.

column2: Video shows bodies on the streets saying that this is the current situation in Italy.
column8: The scenes in the video is from the 2007 movie Pandemic, which talks about the spread of birdflu in Los Angeles.

column2: Putin enter a meeting with his ministries wearing the full yellow suit used by quarantine doctors to protect themselves against catching COVID19.
column8: The original photo is from Putin's visit to a quarantined hospital where COVID-19 patient are treated not from a meeting with his ministries.

column2: A 48 year-old man, unemployed due to the COVID-19 crisis, attempted suicide in São Paulo.
column8: São Paulo state officers reported that no such case occured. Photo was from 2017.

column2: In Sri Lanka, Sathosa Supermarket trucks bearing the image of former PM Mahinda Rajapaksa being used to distribute food during current COVID-19 curfew. And text condemning the act by mentioning how ethical is it to carry out such acts during this difficult times and gain political advantange.
column8: 2014 Images of Sathosa Lorries with PM Mahinda Rajapaksha portrayed as recent vehicles used to distribute food during curfew. Newspaper which carried original image published a disclaimer.

column2: France has canceled fees for electricity, gas, water and rent.
column8: The person even doesn't mention the source. Just says that France will cancel all these fees, whih is not true. It will be implemented only for certain categories of businesses.

column2: PARTLY The coronavirus did not reach the Chinese cities of Beijing and Shanghai, as well as Russia and North Korea.
column8: The virus spread to Beijing and Shanghai in January, Russia had its first cases in February, while North Korea's claim of being coronavirus-free is largely contested.

column2: Putin enter a meeting with his ministries wearing the full yellow suit used by quarantine doctors to protect themselves against catching COVID19.
column8: The original photo is from Putin's visit to a quarantined hospital where COVID-19 patient are treated not from a meeting with his ministries.

column2: Prince Charles infected with coronavirus after meeting Indian singer Kanika Kapoor.
column8: Viral pictures of Kanika Kapoor meeting Prince Charles are old.

column2: There are 59 positive Coronavirus cases in Nagpur along with 3 doctors one of whom is on ventilator.
column8: There are 5 coronavirus cases in Nagpur as of March 26. None of them is a doctor.

column2: Numerous conspiracy theories shared on and off social media claim that 5G mobile networks are the cause of the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: This is false; experts told AFP that 5G is based on radio frequency and that this does not create viruses.

column2: No The Ministry for Economic Development has summoned Italians to avoid sharing videos on Whatsapp, due to overcharging issues given by working from home during Covid-19 emergency.
column8: There is no evidence of such a statement from the Italian authorities.

column2: mostly North Korean president has ordered to shoot the first Coronavirus pateint in his country.
column8: There is no credible media report which claims that Notrth korea has ordered to shoot its first coronavirus patient.

column2: mostly The viral video claims mass graves are in Italy.
column8: The viral video is part of a TV series called Pandemic. The viral scene is not from Italy.

column2: Supposed quote from the Argentinian president alerting that goverment aid was going to be removed from those who violeted the quarantine.
column8: The quote is fake and the disinformation was created by a joke generator website.

column2: First death from coronavirus in Barranquilla, Columbia.
column8: The death has not been confirmed.

column2: Puerta de Hierro hospital in Madrid uses a whole floor for the president’s family.
column8: The hospital denied it.

column8: It is a false headline, accompanied by a text explaining that it is the Portuguese Government that has taken this measure in relation to dentistry and stomatology.

column2: There is no space in the hospitals in Italy because of which people are crowding outside.
column8: The claim with the pictures is false. While these photos are both real and recent, they are actually from Croatia’s capital Zagreb, which was rocked by a powerful earthquake on 22 March.

column8: Is not a vaccine, is a test of antibodies.

column2: A herd of deer shared as them flocking out in Tamil Nadu, India due to the lockdown of the Coronavirus
column8: The image is originally from Japan and was taken in 2014. It shows the Nara deers that are considered to be auspicious flanking the streets of Nara.

column2: A treatment for COVID-19 to be manufactured in Uganda.
column8: The treatment is actually conventional sanitizer, and will be produced by a company already producing hand and surface sanitizer.

column2: Did an American die because he self-administered chloroquine ?
column8: In Arizona a man died after ingesting chloroquine phosphate on self-medication. He had the idea after listening to a speech by Donald Trump about chloroquine efficiency against COVID-19.

column2: A publication claiming the city of San José in Costa Rica has created mass graves for COVID-19 victims.
column8: Authorities denied such a construction work.

column2: You can get coronavirus from makeup and creams.
column8: No proofs about it in the new WHO Q&A.

column2: Coronavirus remains on the asphalt for 9 days.
column8: There is no scientific evidence to show that the coronavirus remains on the floor for 9 days.

column2: Nairobi Governor Mike Sonko has donated 58 million shillings for COVID-19 response.
column8: The governor has not made any such donation, and the County Government has also stated that the claim is false.

column2: MOSTLY Countries that use nivaquine (chloroquine) against malaria are not affected by coronavirus.
column8: Nivaquine is prescribed in other countries, including France where there is coronavirus, and COVID-19 affects many more states than those indicated on the maps.

column2: A publication on Facebook assures that it is confirmed that “the [Spanish] President and the 3 Vice Presidents are ill with COVID-19 and assures that the King must close the Parliament, dissolve the Cortes and take political and military control of the country.
column8: The only Spanish vice president who has tested positive for COVID-19 is Nadia Calviño and the Constitution does not grant the King the power to dissolve the Spanish government in the face of this catastrophe.

column2: Cigarette smoke spreads coronavirus.
column8: There is no scientific evidence that proves the cigarette smoke can spread coronavirus.

column2: Mosquitoes can spread the coronavirus?
column8: The World Health Organization (WHO) and the French Ministry of Health have been very clear : no, the mosquito does not transmit the coronavirus.

column2: The internet can crash because of a lockdown.
column8: Experts and internet companies assure that the network can handle an increasing traffic. However, extending the lockdown as well as closing the borders could make it more difficult to maintain and to repair the network.

column2: In France, the state pays 46 billions a year for its army, but only 1 billion for its inhabitants’ health.
column8: It's the opposite : the state spends much more on health than on its army.

column2: A video circulating on WhatsApp on a COVID-19 patient escaping from an hospital in Costa Rica.
column8: The patient didn't have COVID-19 and didn't escape.

column2: A message in an image claims that drinking coffee can help to prevent the new coronavirus.
column8: There is no scientific evidence to support this theory. Health authorities have never made this connection an it.

column2: WhatsApp chain from workers of Argentina´s most important lab that is testing for coronavirus. They advised not to leave the house because the next 2 weeks were the infection peak.
column8: The lab workers denied the message came from them. Many of the claims included in the chain were denied by specialists.

column2: MOSTLY Countries that use nivaquine (chloroquine) against malaria are not affected by coronavirus.
column8: Nivaquine is prescribed in other countries, including France where there is coronavirus, and COVID-19 affects many more states than those indicated on the maps.

column8: No proofs about it in the new WHO Q&A.

column8: Authorities denied such a construction work.

column2: A video circulating on WhatsApp on a COVID-19 patient escaping from an hospital in Costa Rica.
column8: The patient didn't have COVID-19 and didn't escape.

column2: Did an American die because he self-administered chloroquine ?
column8: In Arizona a man died after ingesting chloroquine phosphate on self-medication. He had the idea after listening to a speech by Donald Trump about chloroquine efficiency against COVID-19.

column2: A Pakistani doctor, Dr Osama Riaz’s last message for you (while taking his last breath).
column8: The video is not of the Pakistani doctor who died but of another doctor from the UK who tested positive and is going to be discharged soon.

column2: Indian Army has built 1000 Bed quarantine facility for COVID-19
column8: The Indian army called out this claim to be false and BOOM also found that all the three images were unrelated to each other.

column2: Streaming apps Netflix and Amazon Prime give free subscriptions during COVID-19 outbreak in India
column8: The websites were phising and spamming websites while the streaming apps have not declared any such free plans. A parody account portraying to be Indian news wire agency, ANI shared the sites stating free plans till April 31 while April has only 30 days.

column2: Indian Government snooping messages over social media and all social media platforms wll be monitored for COVID-19 messages
column8: The message mentions a fake ministry of internal regulation that does not exist in the country.

column2: After dealing with 134 patients, an Italien doctor couple took off their masks and stared at each other from the bottom of their hearts. Both of them died later.
column8: The photo is a couple kissing at Barcelona airport on March 12.

column2: The application of menthol ointment in the nostrils helps to prevent the virus
column8: There's no evidence that menthol ointment could prevent the contagion with coronavirus, according the physicians consulted and information spread by WHO and FDA on the prevention of COVID-19.

column2: An image of a couple who are claimed to be doctors and have lost their lives due to Coronavirus
column8: The picture is an AFP picture of a couple at the Barcelona airport after US President Donald Trump informed that USA was banning travel from the EU.

column2: A message sent by WhatsApp states that the Ministry of Defense of China has announced that it has ‘successfully’ developed a vaccine against the new coronavirus, which causes Covid-19 disease. Portugal would receive the first doses in a few days.
column8: It is a fraudulent message that is being sent on behalf of the National Health Service, full of false information, especially regarding vaccines that are due to arrive in Portugal

column2: A video circulating on WhatsApp on a COVID-19 patient escaping from an hospital in Costa Rica.
column8: The patient didn't have COVID-19 and didn't escape.

column2: Says to leave objects in the sun to avoid contracting the coronavirus.
column8: There’s no evidence that sunlight can kill the coronavirus. Experts say ultraviolet light in the sun isn’t strong enough.

column8: The Indian army called out this claim to be false and BOOM also found that all the three images were unrelated to each other.

column8: The picture is an AFP picture of a couple at the Barcelona airport after US President Donald Trump informed that USA was banning travel from the EU.

column2: Several photographs published on Facebook claim to portray coffins with victims of the new coronavirus in Italy.
column8: The pictures were taken in april 2009, after an earthquake in L’Aquila, that killed 308 people.

column8: It is a fraudulent message that is being sent on behalf of the National Health Service, full of false information, especially regarding vaccines that are due to arrive in Portugal

column2: WHO is offering monetary help to buy medicines and food during the emergency.
column8: It's not true that WHO is offering monetary help. It's a technical institution, said representatives contacted for this verification.

column2: Over 200 doctors in Italy die every day due to coronavirus.
column8: The total number of doctors in Italy who died due to the coronavirus is 66 as of Thursday, April 2.

column2: A message in an image claims that drinking coffee can help to prevent the new coronavirus.
column8: There is no scientific evidence to support this theory. Health authorities have never made this connection an it.

column2: Thanks to the halt imposed by the government to travel boats for Covid-19, a crocodile has shown up in Venice’s canals.
column8: The picture has been manipulated. There has never been a crocodile swimming in Venice.

column2: italian people in the streets surerendering and farewelling the world after COVID19.
column8: The original video is from an Italian protest against the far-right on Nov 18 2019.

column2: This news bullettin from 2015 proves that Covid-19 was created in a laboratory of Wuhan.
column8: The news bullettin from 2015 was reporting on an experiment regarding a coronavirus created in a laboratory. However, this virus has nothing to do with COVID-19.

column2: The government has mandated by decree a salary cut for high public officials.
column8: The government has never approved such a measure.

column2: Malaysia Dismiss Residents Outside the Home with Drones that Shoot Fireworks
column8: The events in the video are part of the action carried out by a Brazilian influencer, Lucas Albert. The video was uploaded on Instagram on July 14, 2019, before the Corona COVID-19 virus was first reported in Wuhan, China, in December 2019. Even in the original video, there was no Malay-speaking male voice asking people to disperse.

column2: Photo of Italian PM Giuseppe Conte who cried for regretting the late lockdown
column8: The photo is a photo of Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro who gave a speech during an evangelical service at the Planalto Palace on December 17, 2019.

column2: The UN is providing food aid to South American countries due to the coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The UN office at Colombia has warned that a WhatsApp hoax claiming the UN would be providing food aid is false. A version of the same hoax was debunked by the UN office at Paraguay.

column2: China got prepared to contain the virus and let the whole population got infected.
column8: An audio claimed that China’s strategy was to infect the whole population with COVID-19. However, one of China’s main measures was to keep quarantined almost half of its population, according to New York Times estimates, in order to control and stop the spread of infections. The WHO praised the measure.

column2: The Italians accept Islam en masse.
column8: In fact, the video used in the fake was taken during a protest in Germany, in the center of Hamburg, held on January 11, 2020. The action was aimed at the oppression of the Muslim Uighur minority in China.

column2: The brasilian singer Preta Gile was infected with Covid-19 and performed to more than 320 thousand people.
column8: When the singer performed to 320 thousand people, on March 1, she was not infected with the new coronavirus. She started feeling ill on March 11 and tested positive on March 13. Since then, she has been in quarantine.

column2: Several photographs published on Facebook claim to portray coffins with victims of the new coronavirus in Italy.
column8: The pictures were taken in april 2009, after an earthquake in L’Aquila, that killed 308 people.

column2: A message in an image claims that drinking coffee can help to prevent the new coronavirus.
column8: There is no scientific evidence to support this theory. Health authorities have never made this connection an it.

column2: A post says that a vaccine for the new coronavirus will be available in a few days.
column8: The image that is shown on the post is a South Korean COVID-19 test from the laboratory Sugentech. There is not a vaccine available on the market yet.

column2: Facebook posts featuring a photo of ventilators in the US state of New York claim the devices are “stuck in a warehouse.”
column8: This is misleading; New York is stockpiling supplies because of the novel coronavirus pandemic, but emergency response staff say those in the photo were sent to hospitals within 24 hours of their receipt.

column2: President of the National Assembly of Serbia Maja Gojkovic claimed that according to the Constitution, Parliament cannot session during the State of emergency.
column8: According to the Serbian Constitution, during the state of emergency, the National Assembly shall convene without any special call for assembly and it may not be dismissed.

column2: No, you won’t be charged with a 135 euro fine if you’re driving with several other persons in your car during the lockdown.
column8: Several people are authorized in the same vehicle. It is not prohibited to use your car with passengers to go to the doctor or to the supermarket, for example.

column2: In Costa Rica, dead bodies are not returned to their families.
column8: There are procedures in place, but the bodies are returned.

column2: In Costa Rica, the Red Cross and Walmart are giving out emergency funds for COVID-19.
column8: It's a scam to steal personal data.

column2: Video shows Malaysian police sanction people who violated lockdown stipulation by hitting them on the foot sole.
column8: The video was filmed in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan, not a recent shoot in Malasia. The Malaysian government has released a series measure towards the COVIS-19 on March 18. But hitting violater on the foot sole is not part of it.

column2: Gargling with hot water cures Coronavirus says a doctor from Mumbai’s COVID-19 hospital.
column8: Gargling with water does not cure or prevent coronavirus, and this is not the doctor from the Mumbai hospital but a Tiktok video with a pre-recorded video clip.

column2: A police commissioner from Mumbai has asked essential services to be available at certain hours.
column8: The Mumbai Police did not put out any such notification and all essential services are available in the city.

column2: False that the OMS grants food and medicine vouchers
column8: Neither the World Health Organization (OMS), the United Nations (UN) and the "Government" are giving out vouchers for food or medicine in support of the family economy due to the COVID-19 pandemic, as messages that share on social networks.

column2: Partly Says that under order from Gov. Tony Evers, he and his eight children can’t legally have dinner together anymore.
column8: The key here is what Stroebel’s tweet didn’t say – that five of the children he referenced were adults living on their own. Evers’ order does indeed ban gatherings of immediate family members in different households.

column2: MOSTLY Says Nancy Pelosi’s coronavirus bill includes “tax credits for solar and wind energy … retirement plans for community newspaper employees … $300 million for PBS … climate change studies” and more.
column8: The House version of a coronavirus relief bill does include several requirements for airline companies that take federal assistance from the bill. The House bill also includes provisions related to community newspaper pension plans and a $300 million funding boost for the Corporation for Public Broadcasting.

column2: Gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates the virus [SARS-CoV-2].
column8: There is no evidence to suggest that gargling salt water or vinegar, or partaking in many other home remedies, fight SARS-CoV-2 infection. Upon entering the body, the virus attaches to and enters cells in the airway where it takes over the cells’ machinery, producing more viral particles that spread to other cells. Because the virus hides out in the body’s own cells, it can not be targeted without also killing healthy, uninfected cells. Therefore, fighting viral infections relies on the body’s immune response.

column2: A post says that, on March 22, 793 people died in Italy and including 232 kids.
column8: In that day, 651 people died in Italy due to the new coronavirus and there were no mention to children. None of the deaths were related to child infections.

column2: A post says that a vaccine for the new coronavirus will be available in a few days.
column8: The image that is shown on the post is a South Korean COVID-19 test from the laboratory Sugentech. There is not a vaccine available on the market yet.

column2: Facebook posts featuring a photo of ventilators in the US state of New York claim the devices are “stuck in a warehouse.”
column8: This is misleading; New York is stockpiling supplies because of the novel coronavirus pandemic, but emergency response staff say those in the photo were sent to hospitals within 24 hours of their receipt.

column2: President of the National Assembly of Serbia Maja Gojkovic claimed that according to the Constitution, Parliament cannot session during the State of emergency.
column8: According to the Serbian Constitution, during the state of emergency, the National Assembly shall convene without any special call for assembly and it may not be dismissed.

column2: Photo of people in medical scrubs lying on the floor of an operating theatre shows some of the 200 Italian doctors who died of Covid-19 in one day (23 March 2020).
column8: Photo is a still from an episode of US TV drama, Grey's Anatomy. And there is no evidence to show that 200 Italian doctors died on 23 March 2020.

column2: The vaccine against Covid-19 is finally ready.
column8: There is no vaccine against COVID-19 at this point in time.

column2: Italian police are being brutal on people not following lockdowns, India should follow.
column8: The police apprehended a man who was brandishing a gun in Sao Paolo, Brazil.

column2: “Slices of lemon in a cup of hot water can save your life. The hot lemon can kill the proliferation of” the novel coronavirus.
column8: There is no scientific evidence that lemon can treat or prevent the coronavirus. Health officials have debunked the claim. The video comes from a man who promotes alternative health information on YouTube.

column2: Study suggests Malaria drug can treat coronavirus.
column8: Despite Trump stating that chloroquine had been approved for use to treat COVID-19, the FDA released a statement saying it had not approved the drug for use against COVID-19 and is still studying its effectiveness against the disease.

column2: Footage purportedly showing a looting spree in Mexico prompted by panic over the novel coronavirus was aired on multiple Facebook live streams and viewed by tens of thousands of people during the week of March 23, 2020. Posts sharing the streams claimed that the chaotic scene was happening in real-time.
column8: The claim is false; the streams showed old footage from a 2017 looting incident in Mexico that was being played on a loop.

column2: Photographs shared hundreds of times online purport to show the coffins of Italian victims of the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; the pictures date back to October 2013 when hundreds drowned in a boat tragedy in the Mediterranean.

column2: A vaccine against coronavirus was developed.
column8: In fact, the photo shows a test to detect antibodies to the virus in the body. This test is used along with others to diagnose coronavirus, not to treat it. The vaccine for COVID-19 has not yet been developed and Donald trump has not announced anything like this.

column2: George Soros is one of the people responsible for the new coronavirus, born in a laboratory.
column8: There is no scientific evidence that the new coronavirus was made in a laboratory. A study published in “Nature” says that the virus came from an animal that infected an human being.

column2: italian mimcks muslim prayers because of fear from COVID19.
column8: The original video is from a muslim protest in front of airports and public squares against Trump decisions to ban 7 muslim countries from entering america in 2017.

column2: Photo shows dozens of wooden coffins of people dead from coronavirus in Italy.
column8: Photo is of the coffins of African migrants who drowned off Italian island in 2013.

column2: South African mayor claimed that Interferon alpha-2b is a vaccine for the new coronavirus.
column8: Interferon alpha-2b has been used to treat some earlier strains of coronavirus, but it’s not a vaccine that would prevent people from getting COVID-19.

column2: No You shouldn’t take Ibuprofen because it appears that this drug would enhance and accelerate the effects of Covid-19.
column8: According to EMA (the European Medicine Agency), there is no scientific evidence on this.

column2: “Putin has stated: Russian citizens (have) 2 options: Stay home for 15 days or in jail for 5 years.”
column8: Russian President Vladimir Putin has implemented some policies to cancel large gatherings and keep people at home during the coronavirus pandemic. But we could not find any evidence that he has threatened jail time for people who don’t comply.

column2: The french state gives more benefit to people who were unemployed before the COVID-19 than it does for people who are partially unenmployed due to the coronavirus.
column8: The French state helps more people who are partially unenmployed due to the COVID-19.

column8: In fact, the photo shows a test to detect antibodies to the virus in the body. This test is used along with others to diagnose coronavirus, not to treat it. The vaccine for COVID-19 has not yet been developed and Donald trump has not announced anything like this.

column2: George Soros is one of the people responsible for the new coronavirus, born in a laboratory.
column8: There is no scientific evidence that the new coronavirus was made in a laboratory. A study published in “Nature” says that the virus came from an animal that infected an human being.

column2: italian mimcks muslim prayers because of fear from COVID19.
column8: The original video is from a muslim protest in front of airports and public squares against Trump decisions to ban 7 muslim countries from entering america in 2017.

column2: Photo shows dozens of wooden coffins of people dead from coronavirus in Italy.
column8: Photo is of the coffins of African migrants who drowned off Italian island in 2013.

column2: South African mayor claimed that Interferon alpha-2b is a vaccine for the new coronavirus.
column8: Interferon alpha-2b has been used to treat some earlier strains of coronavirus, but it’s not a vaccine that would prevent people from getting COVID-19.

column2: No You shouldn’t take Ibuprofen because it appears that this drug would enhance and accelerate the effects of Covid-19.
column8: According to EMA (the European Medicine Agency), there is no scientific evidence on this.

column2: Russia has released 500 lions to enforce the quarantine for Covid-19.
column8: There is no evidence that Russia has employed lions to enforce quarantine measures. Also, the picture comes from a South African movie.

column2: A screenshot of a Nigerian television station showing a breakdown of “472 confirmed cases” has been shared on Facebook, Twitter, and WhatsApp alongside claims it shows novel coronavirus cases across the country.
column8: But the image is being shared out of context: It shows figures for Lassa fever, not coronavirus.

column2: A video has been viewed hundreds of thousands of times on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim that it shows a drone launching fireworks at people who breached a curfew in Malaysia during a nationwide coronavirus lockdown.
column8: The claim is false; the video's audio has been manipulated to include a man speaking in Malaysian; the original clip actually shows a prank that was staged by a Brazilian influencer in Brazil in July 2019.

column2: A Twitter user claimed that Russia released 500 tigers to keep people inside during lockdown.
column8: While this particular image shared by the claim-source was generated from a meme maker website, the original image of the lion was taken in Johannesburg, South Africa in 2016, not recently as we have been led to believe by the publisher.

column2: Video made by Dr. Mario Pesaresi in which he recomends water steam to deactivite the coronavirus.
column8: There is no evidence of the impact of water steam in coronavirus. The WHO and CDC indicate there is no conclusive evidence to determine whether heat is impacting the virus.

column2: An image shows a Spanish scientist asking Cristiano Ronaldo and Messi to find the cure to Covid-19.
column8: The woman in the picture is not a scientist, but an ex-member of previouses Spanish governments and it was taken in April 2008. It was never related to the new coronavirus or to the football players.

column2: WHO confirmed COVID-19 as airborne.
column8: WHO insisted that COVID-19 is not spread as airborne in everyday life.

column2: Second-hand clothes and blankets sold cheaply in African markets are infected with coronavirus.
column8: The photo is at least ten years old. China imports mostly new clothes to Africa, but WHO, Harvard Medical School and other experts advise it is safe to receive goods from COVID-19 affected areas.

column2: One photograph of the meeting of the Bolivian health minister, Anibal Cruz with delegates, hints that they are hiding current figures of the infections with COVID-19 to the population
column8: The photo hints that in Bolivia are one thousand people infected with COVID-19. But in Bolivia are registred 61 one cases today (3/27/2020).

column2: President Giammattei said that the country has 10.000 COVID-19 test.
column8: Guatemala had received 1.000 test from WHO-PAHO and now has 622.

column2: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced a 14 hour curfew as the virus lives for 12 hours on surfaces.
column8: Research studies show that The study found the new coronavirus can live in the air for several hours and on some surfaces for as long as 2 -3 days. These studies are not peer reviewed.

column2: Celebrities spreading misinformation about coronavirus and the Janata curfew in India.
column8: The celebrities shared posts that were already debunked about the 12 hour curfew on March 22 in India.

column2: PARTLY Yves Levy, husband of the former french health minister Agnès Buzyn, inaugurated the P4 laboratory of Wuhan in China, where thethe coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 was created.
column8: The virus wasn't created in Wuhan's P4 laboratory.

column2: “Go to 2020census.gov and fill out this census form so you can get your stimulus check.”
column8: Your response to the U.S. Census won’t affect whether you get a federal stimulus check.

column2: A statue of the Virgin Mary from Loreto will be carried by a plane over Italy to ask for the pandemic of Covid-19 to stop.
column8: The picture was taken in January and is related to a specific event that has nothing to do with COVID-19. The Loreto chatedral has denied that such an event will take place.

column2: Denmark passed from 200 new cases of Covid-19 in one day to only 26 cases.
column8: These numbers are not in line with the national authorities, it was never reported 200 or 26 news cases in one day in Denmark. On March 19, there were 75 new cases in the country.

column2: Pets can transmit the new coronavirus.
column8: The is no proof that pets can transmit the new coronavirus, although the droplets with the virus can stay on pets and, then, get into the human organism.

column2: Fill out 2020 US Census form to receive a economic stimulus payment.
column8: U.S. government relief payments for coronavirus relief will be determined by tax returns, not census information.

column2: Worshipers were beaten by policemen because they gathered in a church.
column8: We found the same video published on Twitter on November 2019, so before the outbreak of coronavirus. The caption was : "Zimbabwe riot police attacked opposition party MDC Alliance supporters today who had gathered to hear leader, Nelson Chamisa, give his Hope of the Nation Address." Other pictures on Twitter and within AFP archives allow us to match the video with this anti riot police operation.

column2: A Chinese woman in Mombasa was attacked and killed after showing flu-like symptoms and refusing to go to hospital.
column8: The article uses an image from the 2013 Westgate terror attack in Kenya, and police in the area also had not received any information about the attack.

column2: Partly 22 travellers in Uganda for the EU-Uganda Business Summit scheduled for early March had refused to go into quarantine.
column8: The 22 travellers had refused to go into quarantine and opted to travel back to their home countries, but they were not in Uganda for the conference as claimed.

column2: It is recommanded to disinfect everything you buy with bleach to prevent you from being infected with the coronavirus.
column8: It is not really recommanded. Experts say it is better to focus on washing your hands and to follow the official recommandations.

column2: Chroloquine could cure coronavirus
column8: There are not enough conclusive evidence to point out chloroquine as a cure treatment

column2: Stocks of “medical masks” made in Woippy, in Moselle, by a company are being blocked for lack of “agreement of the government”, inspite of a shortage of masks in France.
column8: Facebook users did not answer to AFP. Their publications mention a place that does not exist. Woippy's mayor told AFP he does not know about a company that is making masks in his city.

column2: “19 Tigers fans got infected with COVID-19 in NY”
column8: Although it is true that members of the group “Libres y Lokos”, a bar of a Monterrey soccer team, made a trip to New York, in the United States, to witness the game of Tigres vs New York City FC, it is false that even the March 20, 2020, it has been confirmed that 19 people from the blue-blue bar have contracted the new coronavirus as indicated by an audio circulating on WhatsApp.

column2: People with type O blood are more resistant to COVID-19.
column8: "It circulates on social networks and in various media portals, a note that ensures that a study establishes that certain blood groups are more resistant (or even immune) to the COVID-19 virus. This information is DECEPTIVE. Although this clinical trial was carried out, this is a preliminary study published on the medRxiv portal, a free online archive and distribution server for complete (unpublished) manuscripts from the medical, clinical and health-related sciences."

column2: A purported warning from Australian hospitals has been shared thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook that using petrol pumps can enable the spread of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: The claim is false; Australia’s Department of Health said it did not issue the purported advisory; scientists say the virus is unlikely to survive on petrol pumps outside as sunlight and lack of moisture generally kill it; motorists are advised to regularly wash their hands to avoid infection.

column2: Denmark passed from 200 new cases of Covid-19 in one day to only 26 cases.

column2: Fill out 2020 US Census form to receive a economic stimulus payment.
column8: U.S. government relief payments for coronavirus relief will be determined by tax returns, not census information.

column2: Rinsing throat and nose with warm and salt water will save from getting the new coronavirus.
column8: Rinsing the throat and washing the nose with salty water may slightly alleviate the cold. However, it does not help with respiratory diseases, including COVID-19. The effectiveness of such treatment or prevention of the new coronavirus is not proven.

column2: A photo circulating on Facebook in Nigeria appears to show President Muhammadu Buhari shaking hands with the nation’s Code of Conduct Bureau Chairman Mohammed Isa while both men are wearing face masks — a seeming flouting of precautions during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The image was doctored using an old photo, taken long before the pandemic.

column8: There was an article about American drugmakers working on a new vaccine to counter the rapidly spreading respiratory virus publishing on the American daily newspaper, USA Today, on January 24. But the feature didn't mention a death toll of 200 in August 2019.

column2: Korean drama predicted the occurence of COVID19 in 2018..
column8: The korean series didn't talk about COVID-19 but used SARS as a reference in creating a highly lethal coronavirus that have very different death rates, symptoms and incubation period .

column2: An image of coffins showing the victims of COVID-19 in Italy.
column8: A Facebook post with an image claiming to show the victims of COVID-19 in Italy uses a photo of the coffins of African immigrants who drowned off the coast near Lampedusa in 2013.

column2: An image of coffins in Italy.
column8: The image was taken in 2013.

column2: President Rodrigo Duterte said COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus, is only transmitted through contact with other people.
column8: The novel coronavirus is known to spread mainly from person to person, but it can also spread through infected surfaces or objects.

column2: PARTLY US President Donald Trump said in a White House briefing on Friday, March 20, that chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, which are often used to treat malaria, have been approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for treatment of COVID-19.
column8: Chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine is FDA-approved for treating malaria, lupus, and rheumatoid arthritis, but not COVID-19. There is no official cure for the disease as of March 25.

column2: Mostly Says truck drivers are being turned away from fast-food restaurants during the COVID-19 pandemic.
column8: Truck drivers are having issues getting meals at some fast-food chains with shuttered dining rooms. Their rigs can’t fit in drive-thru lanes and they aren’t allowed to walk up and order at the window.

column2: This picture show dozens of coffins in Italy because of the coronavirus.
column8: This pictures has been taken in 2013, it has no links with the current pandemia.

column2: It is forbidden to be more than one in a car in France during the confinement.
column8: You have to follow some rules, but it is not always forbidden.

column2: 1720, 1919, 2020… Every hundred years, a pandemia “cleans” the Earth.
column8: Multiples pandemia occured outside of this timeframe.

column2: The French Education Minister has postponed the summer holidays because of the coronavirus oubreak.
column8: The minister said the measure was not considered for the moment.

column2: MOSTLY “Wisconsin is the only state where all Republicans voted against protecting its citizens.”
column8: Wisconsin is indeed the only one of the 50 states where all Republicans voted no. But it’s a bit of an exaggeration to describe that vote as “against protecting its citizens.”

column2: “Fish tank additive may treat coronavirus.”
column8: Fish-tank cleaners containing chloroquine cannot be substituted for prescription drugs used to treat malaria. The FDA says you should not take chloroquine unless it has been prescribed by a doctor and obtained from a legitimate source.

column2: Partially Romania is introducing new law that will penalize breaking the quarantine with 15 years of imprisonment.
column8: 15 years of imprisonment is maximum length of punishment for those who knowingly spread the contagious disease and their action resulted in death of others. Breaking the quarantine will be punishable up to 3 years of imprisonment or fine.

column2: Italian doctor saying no one has died from coronavirus.
column8: The interviewed mentioned as a source is from late February when the coronavirus outbreak in Italy wasn't that significant. At the moment, this doctor has changed his position on coronavirus and casualties.

column2: A post claims that there are no cases of the new coronavirus in Russia.
column8: In the day that the post was published there were already 147 people infected with COVID-19, according to the national authorities.

column2: Persons with blood type A are more prone to coronavirus.
column8: There is no scientific evidence to show that people with blood type A are more likely to get ‘Covid-19’.

column2: This picture show dozens of coffins in Italy because of the coronavirus.
column8: This pictures has been taken in 2013, it has no links with the current pandemia.

column2: It is forbidden to be more than one in a car in France during the confinement.
column8: You have to follow some rules, but it is not always forbidden.

column2: 1720, 1919, 2020… Every hundred years, a pandemia “cleans” the Earth.
column8: Multiples pandemia occured outside of this timeframe.

column2: The French Education Minister has postponed the summer holidays because of the coronavirus oubreak.
column8: The minister said the measure was not considered for the moment.

column2: MOSTLY “Wisconsin is the only state where all Republicans voted against protecting its citizens.”
column8: Wisconsin is indeed the only one of the 50 states where all Republicans voted no. But it’s a bit of an exaggeration to describe that vote as “against protecting its citizens.”

column2: “Fish tank additive may treat coronavirus.”
column8: Fish-tank cleaners containing chloroquine cannot be substituted for prescription drugs used to treat malaria. The FDA says you should not take chloroquine unless it has been prescribed by a doctor and obtained from a legitimate source.

column2: Partially Romania is introducing new law that will penalize breaking the quarantine with 15 years of imprisonment.
column8: 15 years of imprisonment is maximum length of punishment for those who knowingly spread the contagious disease and their action resulted in death of others. Breaking the quarantine will be punishable up to 3 years of imprisonment or fine.

column2: Italian doctor saying no one has died from coronavirus.
column8: The interviewed mentioned as a source is from late February when the coronavirus outbreak in Italy wasn't that significant. At the moment, this doctor has changed his position on coronavirus and casualties.

column2: A post claims that there are no cases of the new coronavirus in Russia.
column8: In the day that the post was published there were already 147 people infected with COVID-19, according to the national authorities.

column2: Using hot air from a hair dryer against sinuses can prevent and treat COVID19
column8: No evidence supports this theory. Directing hot air to sinuses will make it dry which cause tiny tears that may increase the risk of getting COVID-19.

column2: Persons with blood type A are more prone to coronavirus.
column8: There is no scientific evidence to show that people with blood type A are more likely to get ‘Covid-19’.

column2: An image of coffins in Italy.
column8: The image was taken in 2013.

column2: President Rodrigo Duterte said COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus, is only transmitted through contact with other people.
column8: The novel coronavirus is known to spread mainly from person to person, but it can also spread through infected surfaces or objects.

column2: PARTLY US President Donald Trump said in a White House briefing on Friday, March 20, that chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, which are often used to treat malaria, have been approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for treatment of COVID-19.
column8: Chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine is FDA-approved for treating malaria, lupus, and rheumatoid arthritis, but not COVID-19. There is no official cure for the disease as of March 25.

column2: A runny nose is not a COVID-19’s symptom.
column8: Even the fever and dry cough are the most symptom for COVID-19, runny nose also one of its. In Thailand, 25% of patients has runny nose.

column2: The World Health Organization is offering free internet for the public to access information about COVID-19.
column8: A link circulating on WhatsApp claiming that the World Health Organization is offering free internet to help people access information on COVID-19 is a hoax.

column2: The federal government is “preparing to mobilize the national guard,” “dispatch them across the US with military” and “announce a nationwide 1 week quarantine for all citizens.”
column8: There is no evidence that the federal government is set to announce a lockdown. White House officials have repeatedly said it’s not something they’re considering at this time.

column2: MOSTLY For coronavirus cases “in the U.S. 38% of those hospitalized are under 35.”
column8: The CDC reported that between mid-February and mid-March, 20% of the hospitalizations for coronavirus were for patients age 20-44 and 18% were age 45-54.

column2: “Huge! Results From Breaking Chloroquine Study Show 100% Cure Rate For Patients Infected With The Coronavirus.”
column8: A French study of 20 COVID-19 patients indicates the drug might help treat the coronavirus. But it is no “100% cure.”

column2: Prime Minister Conte has foregone 20% of his salary due to Covid-19.
column8: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte decided to cut his salary on October 2018, months before the outbreak of COVID-19 in Italy.

column2: People who replied to a government text with texts saying they won’t respect confinement measures are now facing justice.
column8: The Nanterre Court denied having received any instruction to prosecute senders of these messages, and the messages present many inconsistencies.

column2: Crocodiles were spotted swimming in the canals of Venice without the bustle of tourists.
column8: The photo is a composite image making up of two photographs.

column2: The canals in Venice have become cleaner after the shutdown, attracting schools of fish and dolphins.
column8: The video was filmed in Cagliari, Italy, a harbor city 743 kilometers away from Venice.

column2: Four men were tested positive to COVID-19 in Cameroon and ran away from the hospital.
column8: These four men published many videos on Facebook to debunk this claim. They also told AFP they lived in Italy. Cameroon's Health ministry also told AFP those four men don't belong to the group of people who are in quarantine in Cameroon.

column2: Tanzanian club spokesman Haji S. Manara was infected with COVID-19 during his tour of The Netherlands.
column8: Tanzania's Simba Sports Club spokesman Haji S. Manara does not have COVID-19 as claimed, and he was tested after leaving Spain and when he entered the Netherlands.

column2: The World Health Organization is offering free internet for the public to access information about COVID-19.
column8: A link circulating on WhatsApp claiming that the World Health Organization is offering free internet to help people access information on COVID-19 is a hoax.

column2: Fake quote of Senator of the Philippines Francis “Kiko” Pangilinan saying he wants children to be exempted from the lockdown.
column8: Pangilinan did not say the quote attributed to him. News5 also said the graphic did not come from any of their official social media accounts.

column2: Agnès Buzyn, former french minister of Health, took chloroquine out of a list of drugs that could be sold over the counter when the coronavirus started to spread.
column8: The decision was taken before the COVID-19 crisis began.

column2: The federal government is “preparing to mobilize the national guard,” “dispatch them across the US with military” and “announce a nationwide 1 week quarantine for all citizens.”
column8: There is no evidence that the federal government is set to announce a lockdown. White House officials have repeatedly said it’s not something they’re considering at this time.

column8: A French study of 20 COVID-19 patients indicates the drug might help treat the coronavirus. But it is no “100% cure.”

column2: IN Biden claims that Trump eliminated the White House pandemic office.
column8: One can see the dueling narratives here, neither entirely incorrect. The office — as set up by Obama — was folded into another office. Thus, one could claim the office was eliminated. But the staff slots did not disappear and at least initially the key mission of team remained a priority. So one can also claim nothing changed and thus Biden’s criticism is overstated.

column2: WHO offering free data for coronavirus info.
column8: Links in post lead to external website, potentially with harmful malware. Post is false, clickbait.

column2: Prime Minister Conte has foregone 20% of his salary due to Covid-19.
column8: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte decided to cut his salary on October 2018, months before the outbreak of COVID-19 in Italy.

column2: The coronavirus was created in a biological laboratory in Wuhan.
column8: There is no evidence that 'the coronavirus comes from a biological laboratory in Wuhan,' as claimed by Mexican youtuber Alexander Backman.

column2: Posts circulating on social media claim that Ugandan and Kenyan authorities have instructed landlords to stop collecting rent due to the novel coronavirus.
column8: The claim is false; the countries have issued public guidance amid the pandemic, but there has been no official communication on rent payments and government officials dismissed the reports.

column2: Gargling salt water can protect against against COVID-19 by washing down the virus into the gut.
column8: Gargling salt water is not a recommended protective measure against COVID-19, and has been debunked by the World Health Organization.

column2: According to Art. 116, a “state of emergency” will be implemented in Mexico that will limit the free movement of people to combat the #COVID-19 epidemic.
column8: This is FALSE, the mentioned article is in the Spanish Constitution, not in the Mexican. Article 116 of the Spanish Constitution speaks of the state of alarm. And to avoid leaving you in doubt, constitutional 116 (the one in Mexico) talks about the division of powers, not "states of emergency."

column2: IN Biden claims that Trump eliminated the White House pandemic office.

But the staff slots did not disappear and at least initially the key mission of team remained a priority. So one can also claim nothing changed and thus Biden’s criticism is overstated.

column2: China recognizes Palestinian doctor as discoverer of Corona COVID-19 virus vaccine
column8: Not a single report was discovered about the discovery of the Corona vaccine by Palestinian doctors. Even the doctor who claimed to be the inventor of the vaccine, Manar Saadi Al-Sheenawi, was not found in the Google search engine. In addition, until now, the WHO has not announced the discovery of any vaccine that can treat COVID-19.

column2: Drinking water every 15 minutes helps to avoid the contagion of cononavirus.
column8: It is false that drinking water every 15 minutes helps to avoid Covid-19 by "cleaning" your throat.

column2: An audio message shared by Whatsapp users affirms that COVID-19 dies at 27° Celsius.
column8: It is still unknown whether weather and temperature will affect the spread of COVID-19. According to the United States Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), it is currently unknown whether the spread of COVID-19 is reduced in hot seasons.

column2: An audio broadcast on Whatsapp indicates that garlic helps to overcome diseases such as the coronavirus.
column8: According to the World Health Organization (WHO), garlic is a healthy food that may have some antimicrobial properties. However, no evidence has been obtained that eating it protects against COVID-19.

column2: An audio message shared by Whatsapp users affirms that COVID-19 dies at 27° Celsius.
column8: It is still unknown whether weather and temperature will affect the spread of COVID-19. According to the United States Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), it is currently unknown whether the spread of COVID-19 is reduced in hot seasons.

column2: Beverages like ‘akpeteshie’, a local brewed spirit made from sugarcane or palm wine, can be used as a substitute for hand sanitizers.
column8: Herbal and local gin bitters often do not meet the required alcohol content for an effective hand rub. Thus, they may not be good substitutes for hand sanitizers against the COVID-19.

column2: Allegations, that garlic and cold shower helps to avoid COVID19.
column8: Doctors say garlic, coal and cold shower don't prevent COVID-19.

column2: Martial law is imminent in United States.
column8: U.S. governments are not planning to implement martial law; National Guard is providing aid and support for communities.

column2: A video of US President Donald Trump and a top US pharmaceutical executive speaking at a press conference has been viewed thousands of times in multiple Facebook, Twitter and YouTube posts alongside a claim that it shows them announcing a vaccine for the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, was “ready” to be administered.
column8: The claim is false; neither Trump nor the pharmaceutical executive make any reference to a vaccine being "ready" for distribution; as of March 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) states there is not yet a vaccine for COVID-19.

column2: A screenshot of a purported internal email disclosing that a bank in the Pakistani city of Rawalpindi was closed after an employee tested positive for the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, has been shared on Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp.
column8: The claim is false; the bank said in a statement that “no employee at any” branch had tested positive for COVID-19, and that all branches remained “open and fully operative.”

column2: Partially Homemade recipes for alcohol gel.
column8: Making alcohol gel at home is not recommended by medical authorities; it can be ineffective and dangerous.

column2: Netflix is offering free access for those in quarantine.
column8: Netflix has not announced free access; message on WhatsApp is a phishing scam.

column8: The CDC reported that between mid-February and mid-March, 20% of the hospitalizations for coronavirus were for patients age 20-44 and 18% were age 45-54.

column2: “Huge! Results From Breaking Chloroquine Study Show 100% Cure Rate For Patients Infected With The Coronavirus.”
column8: A French study of 20 COVID-19 patients indicates the drug might help treat the coronavirus. But it is no “100% cure.”

column2: According to Art. 116, a “state of emergency” will be implemented in Mexico that will limit the free movement of people to combat the #COVID-19 epidemic.
column8: This is FALSE, the mentioned article is in the Spanish Constitution, not in the Mexican. Article 116 of the Spanish Constitution speaks of the state of alarm. And to avoid leaving you in doubt, constitutional 116 (the one in Mexico) talks about the division of powers, not "states of emergency."

column2: IN Biden claims that Trump eliminated the White House pandemic office.
column8: One can see the dueling narratives here, neither entirely incorrect. The office — as set up by Obama — was folded into another office. Thus, one could claim the office was eliminated. But the staff slots did not disappear and at least initially the key mission of team remained a priority. So one can also claim nothing changed and thus Biden’s criticism is overstated.

column2: WHO offering free data for coronavirus info.
column8: Links in post lead to external website, potentially with harmful malware. Post is false, clickbait.

column2: Prime Minister Conte has foregone 20% of his salary due to Covid-19.
column8: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte decided to cut his salary on October 2018, months before the outbreak of COVID-19 in Italy.

column2: The Italian National Guard has declared that it will apply a stricter sect of rules, called BLS-4, if Covid-19 has not been contained by April the 15th.
column8: The authorities have officially denied this fact.

column2: The UNHCR said ‘migrants and illegals’ in malaysia were resisting COVID-19 testing.
column8: The claim is false; UNHCR officials in Malaysia said the alleged statement is fake and condemned the erroneous claim for stoking “unnecessary fear and distrust”.

column2: A message shared on WhatsApp and Facebook claims that 15 coronavirus cases were linked to Burnaby’s Metrotown mall, in the western Canadian province of British Columbia.
column8: This is false; provincial health officials and the mall administrator told AFP that no cases are connected to the mall to date.

column2: This video shows a brawl this week which took place in a supermarket in Aubervilliers, in France, because of coronavirus.
column8: This scene actually took place in May 2019, according to a police source.

column2: This photo shows French nurses holding a sign to denounce police violence.
column8: It's a photomontage.

column2: Facebook post claiming that French animal shelters “are overwhelmed by the abandonment of dogs and cats due to the coronavirus”.
column8: SPA president told AFP the claim was false. However, he fears a saturation of shelters, closed to the public because of containment measures.

column2: Claim that the coronavirus was created and patented in a French institute (Institut Pasteur).
column8: The video author refers to a patent filed in 2004 but this patent concerns another type of coronavirus. Moreover, filing a patent for a virus does not mean that it was created.

column2: Rodrigo Maia, president of the lower house of the Congress in Brazil, voted a law that forbids the president to close borders.
column8: The law doesn't turn difficult to close borders, because it is about migrants rights. And Maia didn't vote "yes" for it.

column2: “coronavirus victims are buried in the morning this Wednesday in Italy. Rest in peace”.
column8: The image was taken in 2013 by Tullio M. Puglia, for Getty Images. The coffins were used for the bodies of african refugees that died on a shipwreck near Lampedusa, south Italy.

column2: Goats in Ajmer, Rajasthan were found to be COVID-19 positive.
column8: The video is old and unrelated to COVID-19.

column2: Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar asked for meat shops to be banned in lieu of COVID-19.
column8: Claim was falsely attributed to the cricketer.

column2: COVID-19 passengers being disembarked at Senegal airport.
column8: Video was of a mock drill for dealing with hostage like situations.

column2: The COVID-19 has been invented by a big French public medical institute (Institut Pasteur).
column8: Big confusion between the 2003 coronavirus and the COVID-19.

column2: Helicopters of the Argentine Air Force will spray disinfectant against the coronavirus.
column8:
The alleged measure was denied by the Argentine Ministry of Defense.
The same message circulates, and was denied, in different countries.

column2: Christine Lagarde said: “The elderly live too long and that is a risk to the global economy”.
column8:
There are no written or audiovisual records of the former IMF director saying the statements attributed to her.
In addition, the European Central Bank -inquired by Maldita- assured that Lagarde had not said that phrase.
Part of the phrase attributed to the president of the European Central Bank (ECB) comes from a 2012 report by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) in whose presentation Lagarde was not present.

column2: Cali in Colombia is going to be quarantined, that is to say that for 14 days all commerce, supermarkets, shopping malls will be closed, no one can enter or leave by land or by plane.
column8: At the time of this publication, there had been no quarantine or trade closure in the Valle del Cauca capital, as a viral audio claimed.

column2: Mostly A photo shows coffins of people who died because of coronavirus in Italy – it shows that the virus is dangerous and you should stay inside.
column8: The photo is old and shows coffins of migrants who drowned at a boat accident at Lampedusa in 2013. But the appeal to stay inside to avoid infection with coronavirus is correct.

column2: Mostly Jobcenters (for unemployed people) close from today on in Germany.
column8: The jobcenters are not completely closed, they offer personal contact in emergency cases.

column2: Stopping breathing for 10 seconds will help you detect the coronavirus.
column8: It won't help you in detecting coronavirus.

column2: In Ecuador, Maritza Frías, former director of the Teófilo Dávila Hospital in Machala, and Mauro Calle, former manager of this health center, concealed official figures of those infected.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: Coronavirus phase 4 involves war code.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: People with A-blood type are more prone to get coronavirus.
column8: Study is not peer-reviewed and should not be published as established information

column2: Egyptian doctor has invented a fluid to treat coronavirus.
column8: WHO hasn´t informed about any cure or treatment specific to COVID-19.

column2: Maracaibo in Venezuela is the safest city to avoid coronavirus because it´s too hot, said Unicef.
column8: Unicef communicates it hasn´t publish that kind of information.

column2: COVID-19 is no worse than other outbreaks that have occurred in “every election year,” suggesting that the new coronavirus is being “hyped” to hurt President Donald Trump.
column8: Most of the dates cited to defend those conclusions about previous outbreaks are misleading or incorrect.

column2: Australian researchers have found that bananas can help prevent infection of COVID-19.
column8: We found the post to be False. There is no proof that banana can boost one’s immune system and prevent the disease caused by coronavirus. At present there are no medicines to cure COVID-19.

column2: Kitchen foods plus morning sunshine can prevent and cure coronavirus.
column8: At present there is no evidence to prove that eating kitchen foods like onion, garlic and lemondoes prevent or cure COVID-19 and the same is not recommended by WHO.

column2: Man contracts COVID-19 by eating mutton.
column8: It's a fake news card and the news channel has denied publishing any such news.

column2: A video shows Chinese police crackdown on suspected COVID-19 patients.
column8: We found the video to be False because this is an old video A from Hong Kong showing riot police storm a metro station to crack down on political protesters in the city.

column2: Image of coffins from Italy showing carnage due to recent COVID-19 outbreak.
column8: The image is 7 years old and is of the dead bodies of African immigrants who died while entering Italy.

column2: Clean your throat with salt water or vinegar to cure coronavirus.
column8: Experts confirmed this is a false claim.

column2: Spanish minister of agriculture called out football players for earning too much and showing lack of solidarity.
column8: The minister never made the statement attributed to her.

column2: A train carrying vaccines with the inscription COVID-19.
column8: Content seems to be digitally edited, and there is no inscription on that location on such trains.

column2: Evidence Shows The WHO Director-General Overstated COVID-19 Fatality Rate
column8: All evidence says the WHO director-general was on point. This is a ultra-conservative false spin on what the director-general said, getting many facts and medical numbers wrong.

column2: Trump Is Promising To Send Americans Checks – Only After Checking People’s Social Media History.
column8: This is a false tweet, though there have been real suggestions to have a stimulus package.

column2: Tom Hanks was arrested, with others, for pedophilia.
column8: Claim was called out by several outlets as a conspiracy theory, though Hanks and his wife did test positive for coronavirus.

column2: 5G Technology Believed To Have Caused coronavirus
column8: The claim is false, not backed by scientific research, and many dates given to back up the theory are wrong or misleading.

column2: “Ministry of Health ITALY released a small video, HOW the virus spreads!!!… BEST VIDEO. Please see ..how innocently it spread. SOAP is the remedy CLEAN/ WASH ur Hands always”
column8: The viral video is not released by the health ministry of Italy in the wake of coronavirus but it is long-existing on YouTube, we reached the conclusion that the viral claim is ‘Misleading’.

column2: The viral video claims to show the visuals of china police personnel trying to control the patients allegedly suffering from the pandemic.
column8: The viral video has nothing to do with the coronavirus outbreak and is related to police storming the metro in the wake of Hong Kong protests.

column2: Coronavirus can be cured by sniffing clove and camphor and by drinking water, the virus will go to the stomach and the acid in the stomach will kill the virus.
column8: Dr. Mohammad Imran, an Ayurveda doctor, said, “It is merely a rumor which has gone viral on social media .There is no scientific evidence which backs the claim that sniffing clove and camphor can cure coronavirus.
