However, natural camphor and clove does have certain health benefits as it can cure fungus and bacteria”.

column2: As coronavirus outbreak surges, PM Narendra Modi has decided to facilitate fellow countrymen with free masks under the ‘Swacch Bharat’ scheme.
column8: The government has not announced any such scheme under which it is aimed to provide free masks. The viral webpage may be a part of the decade-old phishing technique or it may be an attempt to collect the data. However, the intent behind creating this webpage is not yet clear but it is crystal clear that the webpage doesn’t belong to Indian govt and might be a venture of some fraudulent organization.

column2: Chinese intelligence officer terms the Novel coronavirus as a biological weapon invented by China.
column8: The viral post also claims that the damage caused by the pandemic is being normalized by the Chinese officials. The website which has published the alleged testimony of the said Chinese intelligence officer has published the report with the headline, “CORONA UNMASKED: Chinese Intelligence Officer Reveals True Magnitude of China’s Fake “Coronavirus” Crisis – 包含中文字符版本”. The story published by the Reddit community No Sleep is just a horror story and does not have anything to do with reality. the community itself terms it as a storytelling platform and not a true story publisher.

column2: Helicopters are going to spread ‘medicines’ againts the coronavirus.
column8: Defense ministry denied it.

column2: France has suspended payment of rent and taxes for citizens due to coronavirus crisis.
column8: The measures announced by President Emmanuel Macron are for SMEs in difficulty and include both payment deferrals and cancellations.

column2: La Paz, Gregorio Marañon or 12 de octubre hospitals are closing because the are over capacity.
column8: Madrid government denied it.

column2: The exams to access university in Valencia region will be delayed to August 10, 11 and 12.
column8: The Valencian Government debunks the hoax on its official social medio accounts.

column2: The Army is requisitioning coronavirus protection material in Catalonia.
column8: The Defense ministry denies the claim.

column2: La Paz, Gregorio Marañon or 12 de octubre hospitals are closing because the are over capacity.
column8: Madrid government denied it.

column2: France will pay rent, light and gas during quarantine for its citizens.
column8: France is only paying for small company's that are not earning enough.

column2: Helicopters are going to spread ‘medicines’ againts the coronavirus.
column8: Defense ministry denied it.

column2: Peru has just nationalized hospitals and clinics.
column8: Peruvian government gave a temporary order for centralizing all the medical resources under the Ministry of Health authority during the emergency, but it's does not include the property of clinics and private services.

column2: There is a Russian medicine that could be use against Sars-Cov-2.
column8: It is not the case.

column2: This picture showing lots of coffins was taken in Bergamo in 2020.
column8: The picture has been taken in Lampedusa in 2013.

column2: New coronavirus is being spread via Coca-Cola.
column8: No evidence shows the virus transmission via food. Coca-Cola products are inspected.

column2: New coronavirus can survive 9 days on the road; you should keep your shoes out, a doctor from Milan says.
column8: No Milanese doctor says that. No evidence shows the exact survival time of the virus on the road.

column2: Worst affected countries by coronavirus are along the same latitude.
column8:
1. The fact that large countries cannot be represented by a single latitude is conveniently ignored.
2. Further, all of the aforementioned cities and countries are not situated along Latitude 40 degrees.

column2: Clorox Already Knew About coronavirus And coronavirus Isn’t New Virus.
column8: The post claiming that the new coronavirus was known beforehand as Clorox label shows that it kills human coronavirus’ is misleading.

column2: Indonesian President Joko Widodo locked down 10 cities
column8: the Indonesian President Joko Widodo has not yet chosen the option to quarantine or lockdwon as a way to deal with the Corona COVID-19 virus pandemic.

column2: The People In This Video Are Falling Because Of Infection With Corona Virus
column8: The people in the three videos fainted due to other causes, such as epilepsy and fatigue. Two of the four videos also did not occur in Jakarta, but in Bali and Singapore.

column2: Novel The Eye of Darkness Predicts Corona as Biological Weapon from China
column8: There is only one similarity about the virus in this novel with the Corona COVID-19 virus, namely the name Wuhan, where the Corona COVID-19 virus was first reported in Wuhan, China. The rest, regarding the incubation period, death rates, and so on, is very different from the pandemic that is happening now.

column2: If we want to protect ourselves from the coronavirus, we must back away from all the climate change efforts we’ve been making.
column8: Some preliminary scientific publications report that SARS-CoV-2 may be less prevalent or less contagious in warm and humid climates. However global warming does not occur at a pace or magnitude that would prevent further SARS-CoV-2 propagation. In addition, scientists emphasize that virus propagation primarily depends on other factors such as existing immunity and there is currently no way to reliably predict the spread of COVID-19 on a warmer Earth.

column2: China has successfully tested an anti-coronavirus serum made in Egypt and presented in Beijing by the Egyptian Minister of Health.
column8: It's false. Neither Egypt has delivered a COVID-19 serum to China, nor has any treatment been released against those infected with the virus in either country.

column2: The spread of COVID-19 can be prevented with a “home-made vaccine” based on fruits and other ingredients.
column8: This is a hoax for citizens to open a potentially dangerous attachment.

column2: A hospital in Murcia in Spain has made a citizen appeal to make surgical masks.
column8: That has not happened.

column2: A video of a fire erupting inside a vehicle has been viewed hundreds of times on Facebook, Twitter and on messaging app Line in March 2020 alongside a claim it shows an explosion that was sparked by an alcohol-based disinfectant used during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; the video has circulated in media reports about a car explosion in Saudi Arabia since at least 2015, almost five years before the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan in December 2019.

column2: A claim that all fruit and vegetable markets in the Indian city of Chennai and across the state of Tamil Nadu have been ordered to close in an effort to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus has been shared in multiple posts on Facebook, WhatsApp and Twitter.
column8: The claim is false; Chennai’s municipal authority called the social media posts “fake”, and Tamil Nadu’s chief minister said that stores selling “essential items” such as groceries are allowed to operate as normal despite a nationwide lockdown.

column2: Claim that an American soldier was intentionally spreading the novel coronavirus in Wuhan during the seventh CISM Military World Games in October 2019 with a video clip of a man purportedly smearing saliva on the handrail on a train.
column8: The video is authentic but it was taken in Brussels, Belgium, on March 10, 2020. The man is not an American. According to media reports, the man was arrested by the police on the same day.

column2: As the US government moved to approve a $2 trillion stimulus package to address the impact of the novel coronavirus outbreak, a short block of text outlining Canada’s alleged response to the outbreak flourished on social media.
column8: The claims about school closings and economic support are misleading; no province has officially closed schools through the end of the year, only individuals directly impacted by COVID-19 are eligible for financial aid, and mortgage relief is granted by banks on a case by case basis.

column2: The Social Security System (SSS) in the Philippines “approved financial aid worth P20,000 for every member,” to assist those affected by the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The SSS has not announced such financial aid for every member. On its official Facebook page, the SSS denied the claim, saying it was "fake news."

column2: “China is to blame because the culture where people eat bats and snakes and dogs and things like that, these viruses are transmitted from the animal to the people and that’s why China has been the source of a lot of these viruses like SARS, like MERS, the Swine Flu and now the coronavirus.”
column8: Experts said Cornyn's assertion that Chinese culture is at fault is inaccurate, as the threat of viral transmission from animal to human is not unique to China, and the risk of this kind of spillover is growing globally as humans come into closer contact with animals.

column2: Five Helicopters will spray disinfectants into the air to eradicate the coronaviruses.
column8: Similar rumors have circulated in multiple languages in many countries, including South Africa, India, USA. The version circulating in Taiwan connected to America. New York City Emergency Management Department has tweeted that the rumor is false.

column2: MOSTLY 2019 coronavirus can live for “up to 3 hours in the air, up to 4 hours on copper, up to 24 hours on cardboard up to 3 days on plastic and stainless steel.”
column8: Preliminary research indicates that COVID-19 can live for up to three hours in the air, four hours on copper, 24 hours on cardboard and three days on plastic and stainless steel.

column2: Chennai municipal corporation has asked all vegetable and fruit markets to shut down.
column8: No such order was issued. All vegetable and fruit markets are open in Chennai.

column2: This poem describes people applying social distancing during a plauge outbreak from the 19th century.
column8: The poem has been written by an American woman on her blog on the 16th of March.

column2: false and This text critically observes the behavior of the religious communities in Macedonia towards the Government’s recommendations to reduce the risk of spreading the coronavirus by limiting contacts and movement.
column8: The religious communities do not respect Goverment's recomendations. Last Friday, both the Islamic Religious Community and the Macedonian Orthodox Church did not take any steps to close the doors of religious buildings for the mass gathering of their believers.

column2: false and A sensationalist headline, mislieading readers: “Disturbing video: A proof that only today there are 349 dead in Italy, stay at home.”
column8: This text operates with outdated data.The figures published in the text are from 14 March. The article was published on 16 March at 11.12 pm, which means that at the time of publication on the Internet, the data from 15 March were available, i.e. 1,809 dead and 24,747 infected in total.

column2: A man is touching a push-cart with his tongue to spread the virus outside Lidl in Lithuania.
column8: The video is most likely shot in Lebanon and definately not in Lithuania.

column2: A train marked “COVID-19” spotted in the US.
column8: The photo was doctored.

column2: A graphic has been shared in multiple posts on Facebook alongside a claim it contains a quote from Philippine Vice President Leni Robredo that bats are the “enemy” in the novel coronavirus pandemic. The graphic is attributed to Inquirer.net, a Philippine media outlet.
column8: The claim is false; the graphic has been doctored from an earlier Inquirer.net post in which Robredo was quoted about confusion surrounding the government’s response to the coronavirus outbreak.

column2: The indian government distributing free face masks.
column8: However, the claim is false; the Indian government said there is no such scheme in place and the linked website is not an official government site.

column2: The Australian Prime minister is about to announce a national lockdown.
column8: The claim is misleading; the Australian Prime Minister’s Office refuted the details of the post; Australia's government told its citizens on March 18 not to travel abroad and warned those already overseas to come home but did not order a "lockdown"; AFP found the wording of the misleading posts was identical to Malaysia’s announcement of a nationwide lockdown.

column2: This photo shows a Sri Lankan airline pilot who tested positive for the novel coronavirus.
column8: The claim is false; the local health authority told AFP the pilot is not pictured in the photo; the man wrongly identified in the posts denied the claim.

column2: Claim that Russian supermarkets are imposing pre-filled trolleys with basic food in the midst of the coronavirus crisis.
column8: Auchan Russia told AFP photos had been taken during a special event earlier in the week and that there is no pre-filled trolleys for customers because of coronavirus.

column2: Claim that 35 people infected by coronavirus being treated in Ivory Coast within a military station, quoting a document from the French investigation website Mediapart.
column8: French embassy in Ivory Coast and the Ivory Coast government denied this claim to AFP. Mediapart told AFP it has "no information" about this.

column2: Photo showing the bad accommodations conditions for people recently arrived in the country and quarantined because of the novel coronavirus.
column8: The photo was first published in February 2017 on TripAdvisor to denounce the bad accommodations of an hostel in South Africa.

column2: Water boiled with garlic cures coronavirus.
column8: There's no scientific evidence of that.

column2: Israel has already developed a vaccine against COVID-19
column8: Migal Galilee Research Institute, in Israel, is currently one of many labs trying to develop a vaccine agaisnt COVID-19. They claim their vaccine might be ready for tests in 8-10 weeks.

column2: Avoid drinking cold water during the pandemic; be exposed to sunlight.
column8: Neither is proven to have any effect on the disease.

column2: Universal Church of the Kingdom of God is selling 500 brazilian reals “blessed” hand-sanitizer bottles.
column8: The image was digitally altered to include fake information and the Universal church logo.

column2: Brazilian singer Preta Gil was singing in a carnival “bloco” while infected with coronavirus.
column8: She very likely caught the coronavirus seven days after her last public concert, while singing at a wedding that has become a major hub of COVID-19 dissemination. On March 1st, date of her last public concert, there were still only two cases confirmed in the country.

column2: A mixture of vinegar and fabric softener is a better desinfectant than alcohol.
column8: Even when vinegar and quaternary ammonium included in some fabric softeners do have some antibacterial properties, its mixture is not more effective than alcohol in innactivating viruses and killing bacteria. This mixture is not included in the official reccomendations to fight COVID-19.

column2: Staff of two Mumbai hotels have COVID positive cases.
column8: Both the hotels denied having any such cases.

column2: Donald Trump announced a vaccine by Roche Diagnostics.
column8: Roche Diagnostics received FDA approval for testing kits, not a vaccine.

column2: Narendra Modi is giving free masks in India.
column8: A fake phishing website was set up in the name of Narendra Modi.

column2: Coronavirus patients were being arrested in Punjab, India.
column8: The video is of a mock drill which is being passed off as real.

column2: The military is coming to Paris because of the virus.
column8: Normal military movements ; nothing to do with the covid.

column2: Another rumor claims the military is coming to Paris because of the virus.
column8: Normal military movements ; nothing to do with the covid.

column2: Ibuprofen enhances the coronavirus.
column8:
The World Health Organization assured that there is no proven evidence that the use of ibuprofen can aggravate the health of patients with this virus.
Initially, he recommended the use of acetaminophen (paracetamol) to treat symptoms, but later clarified that he was "not aware of reports of any negative effects" of ibuprofen.

column2: This viral image of people lying on the street is related to coronavirus.
column8: The image was taken in Germany during an event commemorating the victims of the Nazi concentration camp in Katzbach.

column2: Gargling with warm water and salt removes the coronavirus.
column8: The World Health Organization says there is no evidence that rinsing your mouth with saline "provides protection against this disease."

column2: Cuba discovered a serum that cures COVID-19.
column8: This supposed discovery was denied by an Egyptian official, whose last name is the same as that attributed to the Cuban Minister of Health in the disinformation, who is actually called Portal Miranda.

column2: Partially There is a study that establishes the relationship between ibuprofen and the severity of the virus infection. . . apparently what Ibuprofen does is facilitate the reproduction of the virus.
column8: There is no solid scientific evidence to indicate that Ibuprofen worsens the coronavirus.

column2: “17 at 6:00 am, the state of emergency begins throughout the national territory” in accordance with “article 116 of the Constitution”, in Colombia.
column8: WhatsApp chain that alerts state of emergency by COVID-19 is from Spain.

column2: Partially Although Germany closes its borders refugees and migrants may still come in and they will not be medically checked for coronavirus.
column8: Asylum seekers may under certain circumstances still come to Germany, but they are not the only persons allowed to cross the border. And there will be medical checks if they are infected.

column2: Medical University in Vienna has published a study regarding ibuprofen and coronavirus.
column8: There was no such study, Medical University of Vienna denied it and rated is as fake news. Relation between ibuprofen treatment and worsening conditions of patients with COVID-19 is still researched but unproven at the moment.

column2: An image shows “Spanish biologist” who claimed that footballers which earn millions of euros should research the cure for coronavirus.
column8: This is not the Spanish Biologist. Her name is Isabel García Tejerina and she is former Spanish Minister of Agriculture.

column2: Three thousand Ecuadorians are infected with coronavirus.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: Coronavirus will not be covered by private health insurance in Ecuador.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: Helicopters are going to spread chemicals against the coronavirus.
column8: False information circulating in many Spanish-speaking countries, from Spain to Honduras.

column2: Coronavirus patients develop lung fibrosis but you can diagnose holding your breath.
column8: Fibrosis has many other symptons and it is harder to diagnose than holding your breath for 10 seconds.

column2: WHO approves anti-Malarial drug Chloroquine for COVID-19.
column8: Fact Crescendo found the details mentioned in the news published by Economic Times to be False. WHO has not declared, approved or recommended anti-malarial drug Chloroquine as a treatment medicine for COVID-19.

column2: Thailand CDC announces green chiretta can cure coronavirus.
column8: No such evidence for curing COVID-19 with green chiretta is recommended by WHO or Thailand CDC.

column2: Traditional Cures And Self-Checks For coronavirus.
column8: Our fact check reveals that there is no scientific evidence to prove that drinking water washes down COVID-19 and gargling with warm water & salt or vinegar eliminates the coronavirus. Similarly the self-check breath test for coronavirus is absolutely baseless.

column2: Video of Police in China taking into control suspected COVID-19 patients in the country.
column8: The video shows Police in Hong Kong taking into control demonstrators who were protesting against the introduction of a controversial bill that would have allowed extraditions to mainland China.

column2: After husband tested positive for coronavirus, wife fled from Bangalore to Agra in India.
column8: The woman went to her parents place in Agra on 9 March, while her husband was confirmed positive for coronavirus on 12 March. Also, she didn’t enter Bangalore city. Karnataka government has also clarified that the woman didn’t flee to her parents’ place.

column2: 5000 million Rupees fund allocated by Telangana CM KCR for coronavirus prevention is entirely funded by Central Government.
column8: No, the entire fund is not given by the Central Government.

column2: Video of American President Donald Trump announcing that Roche Medical Company will launch the vaccine for COVID-19 next Sunday.
column8: In the video, American President Donald Trump hasn’t said that Roche Medical Company will launch the vaccine for COVID-19. He announced FDA’s approval of a coronavirus ‘test’ developed by a company ‘Roche’ to increase and accelerate the country’s capacity to test for the virus.

column2: 2000 people died of COVID-19 in one day (on March 15) in France.
column8: As per WHO, 36 people died of COVID-19 in France on March 15, not 2000 people.

column2: Oman is releasing special chemical into the sky to eradicate coronavirus with military helicopters.
column8: The Oman health minister said that they had never conducted such operations with military helicopters. When the same message went viral in India, the Press Information Bureau has said that it is a fake message.

column2: With self-checkup you can find out if you are infected with coronavirus.
column8: Neither the World Health Organization (WHO) nor the government of India has stated anywhere that the coronavirus infection can be evaluated by the breath test as mentioned in the post. Some doctors have also mentioned that breath test cannot help in finding out if the person is infected with coronavirus.

column2: Gargling with lukewarm water mixed with salt/vinegar will remove coronavirus.
column8: Press Information Bureau (India) has clarified that coronavirus cannot be treated by gargling with warm water mixed with salt and vinegar.

column2: Tips for the new coronavirus: holding breath and drinking water.
column8: There is no scientific evidence to indicate that holding breath and drinking water every 15 minutes kills coronavirus.

column2: China finds a vaccine for the new coronavirus.
column8: Chine didn't find a vaccine for coronavirus..

column2: A dog vaccine can be used against coronavirus in people.
column8: There is still no approved vaccine for coronavirus.

column2: 15 minutes in a sauna will kill the coronavirus.
column8: Infectious disease epidemiologist debunked this

column2: Eating bananas prevents coronavirus.
column8: The video splices together clips to make incorrect and misleading information.

column2: Italy has mandated no treatment of all elderly patients for coronavirus.
column8: The guidelines to ration care to those with higher survivability are only suggestions at this point.

column2: All U.S. Citizens Are Entitled To $700 Per Week To Stay At Home To Avoid Spread Of coronavirus
column8: U.S. citizens may get some economic relief from Congress at some point, but that could still be a few weeks away.

column2: List comparing diseases with coronavirus.
column8: The comparison of the outbreaks is extremely misleading as it doesn't take into account the rate of infections, timeframes of the outbreaks and the rapid rise in the number of COVID-19 cases.

column2: COVID-19 is A Scripted Narrative To Justify Closed Borders Or Force Residents To Remain Home
column8: Debunked as a conspiracy theory.

column2: Football player Cristiano Ronaldo turned all his hotels into hospitals to help coronavirus patients and is paying doctors and the staff.
column8: A spokesperson for the hotel denied the claim stating "We are a hotel. We are not going to be a hospital. It is a day like everyone else, we are and will remain a hotel." The news was also denied by HRT, Gol, Haber, Pogled, Flash and Hayat, while the Sport and Magazine plus portals deleted their articles.

column2: Madrid enables 915038030 to request prescription drugs.
column8: The government denied it.

column2: Niño Jesús hospital has been left without COVID-19 to care for children and young people in Madrid.
column8: The hospital denied it to newtral.es.

column2: Here are the measures that Mercadona will implement due to the coronavirus crisis.
column8: Mercadona's Communication department explains that nearly all the points of the message are false.

column2: Police have “free entry into houses and buildings” in Malaga to identify possible coronavirus infected people.
column8: Police denied it on its Twitter account.

column2: Spanish politician Ortega Smith said “I prefer to get the COVID-19 than being gay”.
column8: It was posted by a satirical website, but it viralized as real.

column2: Spanish politician Ortega Smith said “I prefer to get the covid-19 than being gay”.
column8: It was posted by a satirical website, but it viralized as real.

column2: Police have “free entry into houses and buildings” in Malaga to identify possible coronavirus infected people.
column8: Police denied it on its Twitter account.

column2: Niño Jesús hospital has been left without COVID-19 to care for children and young people in Madrid.
column8: The hospital denied it to newtral.es.

column2: Madrid enables 915038030 to request prescription drugs.
column8: The government denied it.

column2: They discovered that a whole floor of the main Peruvian hospital is infected with COVID-19 and the decided to close the place.
column8: It is false that Peruvian government decided to close a floor at the main national hospital due a general contagion of COVID-19

column2: Partially Italy official Giulio Gallera: China lies to us. The date China provided is false. Italy has become Wuhan and the medical system has a breakdown.
column8: The Health and Welfare Regional Minister in Lombardy, Giulio Gallera, didn't give such statements in the interview.

column2: Partially The photo shows the aid crew from Cuba to Italy.
column8: Cuba has sent aid to Italy but the photo is not new. Taken in 2015.

column2: Cristiano Ronaldo donated his hotel to be turned into an hospital.
column8: Ronaldo did not announce this and his partners denied.

column2: Coronil drops can help cure coronavirus.
column8: Leading homeopaths say that very little is known about the composition of this medicine and it will be careless to recommend this medicine for coronavirus

column2: Police asked shops selling alcohol to restrict opening hours on St Patrick’s Day to lower the risk of house parties where coronavirus could be spread.
column8: Police make an annual request of shops not to sell alcohol before 4pm on St Patrick's Day - but it has nothing to do with coronavirus

column2: China finds a vaccine for the new coronavirus.
column8: Chine didn't find a vaccine for coronavirus..

column2: Cristiano Ronaldo Turns Hotel into Hospital for Corona
column8: The manager of the hotel owned by Ronaldo has denied the rumors and stated that the hotel was and will remain a hotel.

column2: Video shows Chinese police crackdown on coronavirus patients.
column8: The video actually dates back to August 2019 when anti-government protests were happening in Hong Kong. The visuals pertain to an incident of police crackdown at Prince Edward station in Kowloon where the police personnel and riot police arrived after reports of a tussle between pro-government and anti-government protesters.

column2: It is advisable to leave outside the shoes used on the street to prevent coronavirus.
column8: It is an unnecessary preventive measure because it is excessive.

column2: There are sanitary technicians who are going to inspect houses and seize cash.
column8: It is false that technicians and police agents have "free entry" in the homes

column2: A graphic has been shared in multiple posts on Facebook alongside a claim it contains a quote from Philippine Vice President Leni Robredo that bats are the “enemy” in the novel coronavirus pandemic. The graphic is attributed to Inquirer.net, a Philippine media outlet.
column8: The claim is false; the graphic has been doctored from an earlier Inquirer.net post in which Robredo was quoted about confusion surrounding the government’s response to the coronavirus outbreak.

column2: A flyer said to offer official advice about the novel coronavirus from a Veterans Affairs (VA) healthcare system in the US state of Oregon is being shared on Facebook.
column8: The flyer is fake, it was not issued by the Roseburg VA and health experts told AFP the advice it contains is misleading.

column2: A photo of a room lined with coffins has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts that claim it shows Italian nationals killed during the novel coronavirus pandemic in 2020.
column8: The claim is false; the photo actually shows coffins for a group of dead migrants at an Italian airport in October 2013 after their boat sank off the coast of Italy.

column2: A “Spanish biological researcher” saying “You give the footballer €1 million euros a month & a biological researcher €1,800 per month, and you are now looking for a Coronavirus treatment. Go to Cristiano Ronaldo or Messi & they will get you a cure.” A quote published with a photo of this so-called “spanish biological researcher”.
column8: The woman on the photograph is not a Spanish biologist researcher, but Isabel Garcia Tejerina, an ex Spanish minister. The photo was taken during an interview, in 2018, long before the outbreak of coronavirus. There is no clue of this Spanish biologist researcher, whose name is never given in the publications.

column2: Jeanine Áñez, actual president of Bolivia, have COVID-19.
column8: The team of Bolivia Verifica, checked the image and verified that was not real. Also, in a communication with the Coordination Director of the Ministry of the Presidency, Marco Julio, he ensured that the president’s health condition is good.

column2: 14 University of Nairobi students have tested positive for COVID-19.
column8: An article by Times Live claiming that 14 students from the University of Nairobi are infected with coronavirus cites a non-existent news story by KTN News.

column2: A fake quote of Senator of the Philippines Risa Hontiveros saying that she is “ready to get coughed on,” and that “the police and military are more frightening than dying from the virus,” according to a graphic that circulated on Facebook.
column8: The senator did not say what was attributed to her in the graphic. She dismissed the graphic as "fake news" on her social media accounts.

column2: A fake quote of Philippines’ Vice President Leni Robredo saying that “bats, not the virus, are our enemy.”
column8: The Vice President did not say what was attributed to her. Robredo’s camp said it is a fake quote, and the Facebook accounts that posted the fake quote the earliest on Facebook failed to give Rappler their source.

column2: A photo showing coffins and describing them as coffins of people who died because of coronavirus.
column8: We found this picture within our AFP archives. Those coffins are those of dead migrants in the Mediterranean sea in 2013.

column2: The WHO coronavirus test “was a bad test.”
column8: A review found the World Health Organization’s test did not give false positives when similar viruses were present. The White House provided no evidence that the WHO test fell short.

column2: Sweden has stopped fighting against the new coronavirus.
column8: Manipulative headline that Sweden has stopped fighting against the new coronavirus.

column2: “All US citizens are entitled to $700 USD per week to stay at home to avoid the spread of COVID-19 novel coronavirus, starting from March 17.”
column8: Americans could receive a check for $1,000 or more as part of an economic stimulus package amid the coronavirus. A Facebook post about weekly $700 checks is a hoax.

column2: “People are going door to door in Colorado Springs stating they are COVID testing so they can rob people!!!!”
column8: Colorado Springs police said they’ve received no reports of robbers pretending to offer coronavirus testing.

column2: MOSTLY “U.S. deaths since 1/22 (2020): COVID-19: 27, flu, 4,700; abortion: 118,000.”
column8: The post’s numbers are inaccurate, but abortions do far outnumber deaths from COVID-19 and flu. The COVID-19 number is likely too low, and the flu number is too high. The number of abortions is roughly accurate.

column2: MOSTLY Says it was “unquestionably” not within his “legal authority” to postpone Illinois’ primary election by changing the date or shifting to vote-by-mail.
column8: It’s difficult to know for sure that Pritzker could not have done anything to delay the March 17 election. But experts told us the governor spoke correctly in describing the limits of his powers under existing law.

column2: Mostly Novel coronavirus can be eliminated by drinking lots of water and gargling with warm water mixed with salt or vinegar.
column8: At present, there is no study or evidence to support the claim.

column2: Trump use of data for deaths from swine flu and seasonal flu.
column8: Trump is comparing apples and oranges. The figures he cites for the swine flu and seasonal influenza are after-the-fact estimates that try to account for all excess deaths that could be, in some way, attributed to a flu infection. Studies indicate that the official lab counts may be missing as many as 9 in 10 deaths.

column2: Having a beard increase your chances of getting coronavirus.
column8: The CDC never told anyone to shave their beards, a 2017 graphic circulating the web from the CDC was put out to show the effectiveness of masks with facial hair. The work-place graphic is unrelated to the current coronavirus.

column2: Sweden refused to fight the coronavirus.
column8: Sweden has not abandoned the fight against coronavirus, although it has taken less stringent measures than other countries. Some of the statements in the checked article are completely made up.

column2: Taking a hot bath, breathing in hot steam or using a hand dryer to blow hot air up the nose are effective ways to prevent Covid-19, according to a lecturer in health sciences faculty at Ghanaian university.
column8: No evidence for claims, which go counter to WHO recommendations.

column2: An image shows a train transporting the Covid-19 virus.
column8: The dark wagons on the image are the ones used to transport oil and they have to obey the 4 letters and 6 digits rules. That’s not what happens with the word “COVID-19” that appears in the image. Also, the name of the virus is Sars-Cov-2 and not COVID-19 (that’s the name of the disease). If the train was transporting the virus it would mention “Sars-Cov-2” and not “COVID-19”.

column2: The word “coronavirus” used on various sanitary products suggest that the outbreak of COVID-19 is a planned operation.
column8: Term coronavirus describes a group of viruses known to man for decades.

column2: Gargling warm water with salt and-or vinegar kills SARS-CoV-2.
column8: No proof that salt and/or vinegar can kill the coronavirus.

column2: Clinics in the Philippines are turning away people with COVID-19 symptoms, because of a advisory from the department of health.
column8: The claim is false; the Philippine Department of Health denied issuing the advisory.

column2: Red soap and white handkerchiefs are good against the coronavirus.
column8: But the recommended practices are misleading; health experts told AFP there is no scientific basis for many of the claims, which include using red-coloured soap and white handkerchiefs, as well as obtaining specific light bulbs.

column2: Israel allegedly developed a COVID-19 vaccine
column8: The claim is misleading; the image used to illustrate a vial of the new drug is originally a stock picture while the MIGAL Research Institute in Israel, despite having a head start, continues to work on a vaccine for COVID-19.

column2: A video viewed tens of thousands of times on Facebook and YouTube purports to show billionaire businessman Jack Ma praising China’s response to the outbreak of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: But the video has been doctored; the original video shows Jack Ma at a meeting of former Alibaba employees in 2018, at least one year before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan; the voiceover in the clip has been taken from another clip which shows a different man speaking.

column2: A photo showing two military vehicles transported by a truck on the highway, near Paris, to be used for the French population’s confinement.
column8: The vehicle transporter and the army told AFP that it was a routine trip, unrelated to the COVID-19.

column2: On March 16th, Macron has already announced quarantine for every cities in France and will announce later during the day the passage to “stage 4” of the epidemic.
column8: Stage 4 means back to normal and Emmanuel Macron has not made announces yet about quarantine. The website appears to be a clickbait website.

column2: A legal decree in France, published on March 15th, sets the ground for the use of the army in the fight against the novel coronavirus.
column8: If using the army in the fight against the novel coronavirus is possible, it has nothing to do with the legal decree published on March 15th, according to the Ministry of the Armed Forces. This legal decree only simplifies the management of soldiers deployed to work for other organizations, according to the Ministry.

column2: Claim that coronavirus stays in the throat 4 days before reaching the lungs and that gargling lukewarm water with vinegar and salt can kill it.
column8: Neither water temperature, salt, nor vinegar has any impact on the coronavirus, according to experts interviewed by the AFP and recommendations from WHO and health authorities in several countries.

column2: You can self-diagnose COVID-19 by holding your breath for ten seconds, avoid COVID-19 by drinking water constantly. Also, COVID-19 causes fibrosis in the lungs.
column8: None of this is true. COVID-19 does not cause lung fibrosis, which renders the "hold your breath" argument senseless. Also, drinking water constantly does not help you to avoid it.

column2: Drinking water and gargling with salt or vinegar eliminate the novel coronavirus
column8: According to the brazilian Ministry of Health and experts consulted by Aos Fatos, this information is untrue and may even worsen the patient's condition. Publications circulating on social media with misleading content also omit that there is still no drug or treatment to cure COVID-19.

column2: Israel has found a cure and a vaccine for coronavirus.
column8: The video report shared with these posts actually shows the process of developing a vaccine that, according to the scientists in charge, may be available in May. At no time does the video claim that the drug already exists or that a cure for the infection with the new coronavirus has been found.

column2: Indian industrialist tweets that a specific mask can kill viruses.
column8: The mask is an anti-pollution mask and its effect on COVID-19 is not scientifically explained.

column2: Cristiano Ronaldo’s hotels to be turned into quarantine centres in Portugal.
column8: Footballer's hotel chains denied any such claims.

column2: Chinese Police crackdown on suspected coronavirus patients.
column8: Video is originally from the Hong Kong protests.

column2: A video supposedly shows Italians or French people singing Madonna, Katy Perry, Britney Spears or Aya Nakamura on their balcony because of the lockdown measure in France and Italy.
column8: The video was shot in Torino (Italy) and people are singing and dancing La Macarana.

column2: The ice skating rink in Mulhouse has been requisitioned for to be used as a morgue.
column8: The rink is not used to stock dead bodies.

column2: An official decree taken by the government says the military will have to help in the hospitals.
column8: The text is just a transposition of an old law into a decree - and has nothing to do with the coronavirus.

column2: Nostradamus predicted COVID-19.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: Italian doctors recommend taking off shoes when you get home.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: Christine Lagarde says the elderly are living too long.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: Ecuadorean President Lenin Moreno and family quarantined in luxury Galapagos home.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: Ibuprofen worsen coronavirus infection.
column8: Ibuprofen could worsen some conditions but there are not proof it could include COVID-19. Spanish health authorities has communicated that ibuprofen is not contraindicated to treat first or mild cases.

column2: President Donald Trump in the next 48 to 72 hours will impose a nationwide “mandatory quarantine.”
column8: The White House’s National Security Council addressed the claim in a statement on Twitter, saying: “Text message rumors of a national #quarantine are FAKE. There is no national lockdown.”

column2: Gargling water with salt or vinegar “eliminates” the coronavirus.
column8: There is no known treatment for the new coronavirus,according to WHO.

column2: Coronavirus pneumonia is similar to a dry cough & Hot Weather, Garlic And Hot Water Are Remedies for COVID-19.
column8: There is no scientific proof that hot and humid weather conditions or drinking warm water and consumption of garlic, onions and other spices can prevent the spread of novel coronavirus infection.

column2: Partially Claims Of Cures For COVID-19 From Multiple Countries.
column8: While some drugs have provided symptomatic improvement, there is no confirmation that any of the medication currently being tested across different parts of the world is a definitive cure for COVID-19. WHO officially confirms there has not been any definitive vaccine or antiviral drug developed to prevent or treat COVID-19 to date, hence all above claims are misleading.

column2: Photo of Meat (mutton) affected by coronavirus.
column8: It is a photoshopped image. No proof so far that coronavirus is present in mutton.

column2: Office Memorandum of the Indian Ministry of Health & Family Welfare declaring holidays to the states of Maharashtra, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh and Sikkim in the wake of COVID-19.
column8: No, the Ministry of Health & Family Welfare hasn’t declared holidays to the states of Maharashtra, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh and Sikkim. The Office Memorandum with such information is ‘fake’.

column2: 35 Italians tourists don’t want to leave Ethiopia and go back in Italy because of the coronavirus.
column8: Testimonies seems to be invented and the characters quoted does not exist. The website is well known for clickbait content and false stories.

column2: 30 cases of new coranvirus in the city of Barranquilla, in Colombia.
column8: At the time of this publicaction, the Health ministry hadn´t confirmed any cases of coronavirus in Barranquilla.

column2: Saline water kills the new coronavirus.
column8: There is no solid scientific evidence to indicate that mouthwash and saline water kills coronavirus.

column2: All baby formula providers are shipping formula for free during coronavirus outbreak.
column8: Enfamil and Gerber issued statements clarifying this is a hoax.

column2: Dallas student celebrating spring break collapses from coronavirus.
column8: Came from fake news generator website.

column2: Coronavirus is the least deadly virus.
column8: The chart, published by Business Insider, issued a correction on the chart exaggerating its figures. But the false info still spreads.

column2: Cristiano Ronaldo turning his hotels into hospitals to fight coronavirus.
column8: Ronaldo's management company denied the claim.

column2: WalMart reducing hours of operation.
column8: WalMart website confirms

column2: Tanker train marked with ‘COVID-9’ on its side.
column8: Photo was digitally manipulated

column2: CDC warning people that morel mushroom increases coronavirus risk by 200%.
column8: User who published made clear this was a hoax.

column2: Police has not issued any “domiciliation order” in Madrid to stay at home under a fine of 1000€.
column8: The National Police has denied on its Twitter account this document that forces the citizens of Madrid to remain at home from 9 p.m. to 9 a.m

column2: EFE news agency published that a tweet announcing that the Government will impose fines of 300,000 euros on people who travel to other regions.
column8: EFE news agency denies it published that tuit. Also, Newtral could not find any proof that the agency published the tweet.

column2: “A looting” in a supermarket due to the coronavirus.
column8: The images were recorded three years ago in an establishment of the supermarket chain HiperDino.

column2: Irene Montero is caughing on someone during the 8M women protest.
column8: The subtitles are manipulated. irene Montero and the concerned person deny the false claim.

column2: Egypt Health Minister has given to China the vaccine against coronavirus.
column8: World Health Organization (WHO) states that to date, there is no vaccine or drug to prevent or treat COVID-19.

column2: Insurance companies stop covering traffic accidents because the coronavirus.
column8: The UNESPA Business Insurance Association deneid it.

column2: Insurance companies stop covering traffic accidents because the coronavirus.
column8: The UNESPA Business Insurance Association deneid it.

column2: Cristiano Ronaldo decided to turn his hotels into free hospitals.
column8: Cristiano Ronaldo has never decide to turn his hotels in to free hospitals.

column2: Italy from the space during a flash mob in March 2020.
column8: The picture has been taken 2014.

column2: Turkish Ministry of Health issued a document shows radical measures against COVID-19.
column8: The document is fake and the signature in the document belongs to famous boxer Vitali Klitschko.

column2: Women’s inhouse gatherings are banned due to the outbreak.
column8: The ministry of family did not issue an order bans women's gatherings.

column2: New virus stays at the throat level for four days.
column8: The virus attaches human cells and does not wait to replicate itself. It is not possible to push the virus into stomach by drinking water.

column2: Turmeric And Lemon Help Fight Against coronavirus.
column8: There is no evidence to prove that turmeric and lemon help fight against coronavirus. The viral post is fake.

column2: Coronavirus patient arrested in Punjab
column8: Mock drill video of Mansa, Punjab viral with false claim

column2: Corona Virus Detection Can Be Done by Holding Your Breath 10 Seconds
column8: Whether someone is positive or not is infected with the coronavirus can only be known through laboratory tests. In addition, no health organization, such as the US CDC and WHO, and also the Ministry of Health have included fibrosis as a symptom of COVID-19.

column2: Drinking Alcohol Can Kill Corona COVID-19 Virus
column8: According to WHO, when the virus has entered a person's body, spraying alcohol or even drinking it will not be able to kill the virus.

column2: Viral WhatsApp message suggested Uber services in Ghana were suspended consequent on the pandemic.
column8: Uber Services are still available in Accra and other parts of the country.

column2: Says a military Humvee labeled “COVID-19 quarantine team” was on Interstate 696 in Michigan.
column8: The same image has been shared and described as a vehicle spotted in Ohio and London in the Unied Kingdom.

column2: EFE has published that those who move from one Spanish region to another under the state of alarm will be fined up to 300,000 euros.
column8: It is false both the application of that measure and that EFE has published it.

column2: Insurance companies will stop covering auto accident policies under the alarm state.
column8: Auto insurance coverage to third parties and to all risks will continue to be assumed by insurers as before the declaration of the state of alarm.

column2: Helicopters will spray Spanish cities to disinfect them from coronaviruses.
column8: It's a hoax. The Spanish Government has no plans of spraying cities.

column2: Partially President Giammattei said that the economic activity would be limited but didn´t mention call centers and maquilas.
column8: Maquilas and call centers continue operating and there are many complains of COVID-19 risks from their workers.

column2: Donald Trump is “announcing tomorrow that the US is going into quarantine for the next 14 days.”
column8: There was no evidence by March 16 that the federal government was set to announce a nationwide lockdown. President Trump said he was not considering it. Trump said the government is thinking about additional measures to prevent the spread of COVID-19 in some hotspots around the country.

column2: President Donald Trump “will evoke (sic) what is called the Stafford act” and “order a two week mandatory quarantine for the nation.”
column8: There is no evidence that the federal government is set to announce a nationwide lockdown. President Trump said March 16 that he was not considering it. The Stafford Act authorizes aid to state and local governments and is commonly used during hurricanes. It does not mandate a nationwide lockdown.

column2: MOSTLY “Now, as it stands, our health care system has adequate ventilators, ICU beds, medical professionals.”
column8: Experts said all evidence points to the U.S. being short on hospital beds, ICUs and ventilators, assuming COVID-19 continues to spread. The U.S. could take any number of actions to increase the number of hospital beds, supplies and medical staff available.

column2: Says Anthony Fauci’s statement that the coronavirus death rate is 10 times that of the seasonal flu is “a claim without any scientific basis.”
column8: It’s not yet known what the death rate from the current coronavirus, COVID-19, will be. But early data indicate it is more than 10 times higher than the death rate for the flu.

column2: “Sunlight actually can kill the [novel coronavirus].”
column8: This is a common theory because sunlight contains ultraviolet rays, which can kill bacteria. However, experts say the sun's UV light isn't intense enough to rely on as a disinfectant.

column2: Mostly Video shows problems faced by Chinese police while catching coronavirus-infected people.
column8: The video has nothing to do with the coronavirus pandemic. It was shot last year in September during Hong Kong's ongoing pro-democracy protest.

column2: Flu vaccine increases coronavirus risk 36%, says military study.
column8: More research is needed to provide a conclusive answer to the question of whether the flu shot increases the risk of non-influenza viral respiratory infections. It is important to keep in mind that while the flu vaccine cannot prevent COVID-19, it still provides several indirect benefits. For example, it reduces cases of flu and flu complications that require hospitalization, in turn reducing the burden on the healthcare system, which has become strained during the COVID-19 pandemic.

column2: Claim that football star Cristiano Ronaldo has converted his hotel chain into coronavirus hospitals.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: The novel coronavirus is not new.
column8: This is false; coronaviruses affecting cattle or canines differ from the new virus strain affecting humans, for which no vaccine exists.

column2: Ugandan president announces the postponement of elections.
column8: The claim is false; an electoral commission official issued a flat denial, labelling the claim “nonsensical”.

column2: This is a video purporting to show how the coronavirus is transmitted betwen people
column8: The claim is false; the video was produced by a regional hospital trust within the UK’s public healthcare system, the National Health Service (NHS), in May 2010 about how infections spread in hospitals.

column2: In France, a picture showing policemen spraying tear gas on nurses and a text criticizing Macron’s treatment towards health employees.
column8: The picture is said to have been taken "yesterday", ie during the massive demonstrations in favor of the public health services, that took place in France, from March 2019. The picture was taken in 2010, before Macron was even president.

column2: Cristiano Ronaldo will convert his hotels into coronavirus hospitals.
column8: A spokesperson for the hotels said the claim was “inaccurate”; Ronaldo has also not mentioned any such plan on his social media platforms.

column2: In Spain dozens of people faced beatings and shoves with the police because they prevented them from going to a mass to pray against COVID-19.
column8: The video has nothing to do with the coronavirus, nor with the state of alert decreed in Spain. In fact, when the video was originally released on October 14 last year, there were still no reports of COVID-19 existing in the world.

column2: European and South American flights cause chaos at Mexico Airport, due to coronavirus.
column8: The video was recorded in December and is not related to COVID-19.

column2: China benefited financially from new coronavirus
column8: Contrary to what the piece of misinformation suggests, the country's stock exchanges have suffered from the pandemic: two of its most important indices - the CSI 300, which brings together the largest companies in the Shanghai and Shenzhen stock exchanges, and the compound Shanghai - have fallen 8% and 0.94% since the beginning of the year. In addition, the coronavirus outbreak caused a reduction in economic activity in China, with a sharp drop in industrial production and retail sales and an increase in the unemployment rate in the first two months of 2020.

column2: Chinese Intelligence Officer Reveals coronavirus is a Bioweapon.
column8: The story originated from a reddit thread which discusses horror stories inspired by true events.

column2: Indian Daily Reports That Wife Of A Positive Patient Ran Away, did not comply with the authorities and tested positive.
column8: The Indian daily misreported as the woman had not yet tested positive and she did not flee so as to not be tested.

column2: Audio claiming India would be put under a complete lockdown.
column8: The government rubbished claims of there being such a lockdown.

column2: Nostradamus predicted the coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The text used as proof is not found on Nostradamus' writings.

column2: Cristiano Ronaldo transformed his hotels into hospitals for COVID-19 patients.
column8: Cristiano Ronaldo did not say this and is not planning to do this.

column2: A ship from China is anchored in Santa Marta, in Colombia.
column8: The Yuan Shun Hai ship is not anchored in Santa Marta is anchored and does not come from China.

column2: Holding your breath for 10 seconds will tell you if you have COVID-19.
column8: This is not an approved method for testing.

column2: There are 30 cases of COVID-19 in Barranquilla, but the government is hiding them.
column8: At the time of publishing there were no confirmed cases.

column2: State of emergency begins on Tuesday, the 17th, according to article 116 of the Constitution
column8: The text is from Spain.

column2: Gargles with hot water and salt can prevent COVID-19.
column8: There is no scientific basis for this claim.

column2: China has successfully developes a vaccine ready to combat coronavirus.
column8: China announed the vaccine began clinical trial, not that it was developed successfully.

column2: A video shows an Italian doctor who says that nobody died only from coronavirus in Italy, that it’s not more dangerous than a flu.
column8: The video is from February when there were only 11 deaths by coronavirus in Italy. It is not possible to say whether people with prior diseases die only because of the virus. But studies show that also healthy people died so far.

column2: Cristiano Ronaldo will turn his hotels into hospitals.
column8: Information was published without verification and was denied afterwards.

column2: Lombardia, Italy, ask to Cuba, China and Venezuela to send doctors.
column8: Gallera really said that but the next day he explained venezuelan doctors weren´t related to Maduro but to Piccola Venezia, a local Italian-venezuela NGO. China send doctors with no relations with him and was Cuba, and not him, which offers to help a week before his speech.

column2: COVID-19 arrived in the US by train.
column8: The photo has been manipulated.

column2: Cristiano Ronaldo turned his hotels into hospitals.
column8: The claim is false.

column2: Left-wing Spanish politicians Irene Montero and Pablo Iglesias have private sanitarian services waiting in front of their homes.
column8: Madrid's Health Department, the emergency medical service and PODEMOS say it is false.

column2: A message chain claim that a message from Stanford hospital gives advice to frink water every 15 mintes in order to prevent COVID-19.
column8: A statement from the Stanford hospital distanced themselves from the fake message.

column2: Cristiano Ronaldo decided to turn his hotels into free hospital.
column8: Cristiano Ronaldo has never decide to turn his hotels in to free hospitals.

column2: Four young people have been hospitalised with coronavirus which has been exacerbated by the use of ibuprofen.
column8: The message, which was widely shared, had no basis in fact. It did not match the description of any patients in the hospital in question, and it misrepresented the dangers of ibuprofen

column2: Mostly “Bill Gates told us about the coronavirus in 2015.”
column8: In the 2015 TED talk featured in the video, he never actually uses the word coronavirus, nor does he mention COVID-19. But his comments do sound prescient. He talks about an epidemic and we’re now in the midst of a pandemic. People could be infected with COVID-19 and not show symptoms for days, if at all. And it’s mainly spread between people in close contact through respiratory droplets when someone coughs or sneezes.

column2: COVID-19 is large in size, where the cell diameter is 400-500 micrometers. For this reason, any mask can prevent its entry.
column8: The cell diameter is around 120 nanometers. The surgical mask can protect the wearer from sprays and large-particle droplets, but not against infection with coronavirus. People are recommended to wear a mask if taking care of a person with suspected COVID-19 infection.

column2: A video showing a man infected with coronavirus and touching pieces of bread in a supermarket in Europe.
column8: It's a set up video, published by a humouristic American Facebook page, called "The Philly offensive". The author of this page explained having filmed this scene, explaining he hates when people touch bread in supermarkets, but without mentioning coronavirus.

column2: Helicopter of the armed forces disinfects the streets at night.
column8: There is not such mesure of disinfectation.

column2: Graphics with information about COVID-19 containing Unicef branding and inaccurate information.
column8: A series of infographics with Unicef branding making claims about COVID-19 are not from the UN agency.

column2: A situation update allegedly from Kenya’s Citizen TV stating the number of COVID-19 cases.
column8: A post is with an update about COVID-19 in Kenya containing a screenshot of a Facebook post by Citizen TV is fake.

column2: A meme shared on Facebook and Twitter claims to show an image of fully stocked shelves of toilet paper, purportedly during the 2009 H1N1 outbreak, above another of barren shelves during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.
column8: The post is misleading; the image of the stocked shelves is a screenshot from US news footage shot this year, not in 2009.

column2: A video viewed more than 2.4 million times on Facebook urges people to inhale steam to “kill” the novel coronavirus.
column8: But experts say that doing so will not treat or cure the viral infection, and could in fact be harmful.

column2: A video has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube which claim it shows Chinese police arresting people infected with the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: The claim is false; the video shows police arresting pro-democracy protesters at a subway station in Hong Kong in August 2019.

column2: Research made by scientists from the University of Queensland in Australia has proven that bananas improve your immune system and help prevent COVID-19.
column8: The University of Queensland dismissed the claim as false. In an email to Rappler, the university’s communication team said: “The video is fake and we would strongly discourage people from sharing this information. We would suggest you share your concerns with the social media platforms.”

column2: Cristiano Ronaldo transformed some of his hotels into hospitals to fight COVID-19.
column8: Cristiano Ronaldo refuted those claims.

column2: A large crowd in Paris protested against the lockdown.
column8: It was an anti-Government demonstration conducted by yellow-vest activities. As the protest took place on March 14, the French government had not implemented the national lockdown.

column2: The spread of the new coronavirus was planned by the Rockefellers years ago.
column8: Scenarios are widely used as analytical methods in simulations. Scenario, which elaborates on the pandemic threat, has nothing to do with the global conspiracy. It is about futurology and possible crisis response management.

column2: MOSTLY The World Health Organization offered the testing kits that they have available and to give it to us now. We refused them. We did not want to buy them.”
column8: The WHO never offered to sell test kits to the United States. The CDC opted to develop its own coronavirus test and did not use the WHO’s protocol for the test.

column2: MOSTLY Says Donald Trump “cut funding to the CDC,” “fired the Pandemic Response Team,” “refused WHO tests” and “wasted two weeks calling this outbreak a ‘Democrat hoax.’”
column8: Trump did attempt to cut the CDC’s funding, but Congress prevented it from happening. While officials in charge of the U.S. response to pandemics did leave in 2018, it’s unclear if they were “fired.” The U.S. was not on a list of countries receiving COVID-19 tests from the WHO. But the U.S. doesn’t usually rely on the agency for diagnostic tests, and the testing delay was due mainly to an error with the CDC’s protocol. While Trump has called the Democratic response to the coronavirus a “hoax,” he has not used the term to describe the virus itself.

column2: The claim that there is a cure from the new coronavirus. The name of the drug is decametoxine.
column8: There is no proof that the drug in question can be used in the treatment of coronavirus-infected.

column2: Pandemics happen every 100 years.
column8: Global pandemics do not occur every 100 years as God's or nature's scourge. The authors of this fake have selected only those pandemics, which fit into their explanation.

column2: The quarantine will last until the end of May in Ukraine.
column8: The official sources on the day when the news appeared have not published such information. The authors of the article confused the end date of the tax holidays and the end day of the quarantine.

column2: MOSTLY “COVID-19 started because we eat animals.”
column8: Scientists think COVID-19 originated in bats and then jumped to another animal host, possibly pangolins, before spreading to humans. As of now, there is no evidence that eating meat is the source of the coronavirus outbreak.

column2: “George Soros owns the WuXi PHARMA LAB located in Wuhan, China where COVID-19 was developed and conveniently Broke Out.”
column8: George Soros has invested in WuXi in the past, but he does not own it. Research shows the genetic makeup of COVID-19 precludes it from being man-made.

column2: Study from Queensland Australia says that banana a day prevents COVID19 because of vitB6.
column8: The university mentioned in the claim refuted this claim. there is no scientific research till now says that banana or vitB6 prevent COVID-19 infection.

column2: MOSTLY President Vucic claimed that according to the EU decisions, Serbia cannot import medicial equipment from the EU countries.
column8: Exports of medical equipment outside of the EU are subject to an export authorisation by Member States. Serbia can import such equimpment but it requires an authorization.

column2: You can test a quality of reusable mask blowing a lighter as you wear it.
column8: Blowing lighter is not a way to test mask quality. Blowing power are vary. Beware buring your mask.

column2: Footballer Ronaldo is turning his hotels into Covid-19 hospitals.
column8: No evidence Ronaldo's luxury hotels in Portugal are being turned into hospitals.

column2: No coronavirus in Nigeria yet, according to pastor.
column8: The Nigeria Centre for Disease Control reported the country’s first case of coronavirus on 27 February – more than two weeks before pastor's video was posted on YouTube. A second case was confirmed on 9 March.

column2: Cristiano Ronaldo is going to transform his hotels into hospitals.
column8: It’s not true that the Portuguese football player is doing this. Observador spoke with sources close to the Hotels and the player and found out that it was false.

column2: Having a patent on a virus means we have created the virus.
column8: Other fact-checkers before us showed that this and that patent were not related to this coronavirus, but we realized that much of the claims are coming from a misunderstanding of what the word "patent" means in 2020, and especially in life sciences.

column2: This video shows Italian People greetings and clapping for China during the Covid-19 emergency.
column8: The video has been edited by adding the Chinese National anthem and a voice saying "Thank you China". However, the video is not related at all to China. On the contrary, people clapping in the video are supporting Italian healthcare personel during an organized flash mob.

column2: Partially A photo claimed that military vehicles are combating COVID-19 in Palermo, Italy.
column8: Sicilian media wrote that military was indeed driving through Palermo, but vehicles were comng back from a military exercise and had nothing to do with the virus as at the time there were a handful of confirmed COVID-19 cases in Sicily.

column2: A graphic has been shared thousands of times on Facebook which claims that gargling warm water with salt or vinegar can eliminate the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: The claim is false; international health authorities and experts do not list gargling as an effective remedy or prevention method for COVID-19.

column2: Report that Cristiano Ronaldo will convert his hotels into coronavirus hospitals.
column8: A spokesperson for the hotels said the claim was “inaccurate”; Ronaldo has also not mentioned any such plan on his social media platforms.

column2: Mostly 37.000 US soldiers are entering the EU while everybody is busy with the coronavirus, the soldiers are immune.
column8: The Nato exercise Defender Europe 20 is no secret exercise, there are only 29.000 US soldiers and media reported about it for months. Further, it was stopped because of the coronavirus outbreak - soldiers are not immune.

column2: The University hospital in Vienna found out that Ibuprofen speeds up the spreading of the coronavirus.
column8: The voice message tells an untrue story and it is not clear whether Ibuprofen can have a negative effect. There is no proof so far that if affects COVID-19 patients

column2: A Facebook post suggests that drinking lots of water and gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates the coronavirus.
column8: The claim has not been corroborated by any health institution. The WHO says there is currently no specific treatment, drug or vaccine for the COVID-19, although some home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms.

column2: Quotes by Finnish national health authorities between 20th of January and 3rd of March taken out of context.
column8: Currently, an image with the title "THL and coronavirus in the news" is being circulated in social media, gathering comments from the National Institute for Health and Welfare on coronavirus from January to March. The statements quoted by THL experts are quoted but appear to be largely inaccurate when removed from context. The list as a whole is deliberately misleading. Its purpose is to undermine the credibility of the responsible authority, THL, without providing it with verified information.

column2: Corporations invented the coronavirus.
column8: there is no evidence to support this claim.

column2: Curfew Issued For Bossier City Due To coronavirus.
column8: The article itself says it's a joke and a prank.

column2: CEO Resignations Are Linked To Global Conspiracy.
column8: Some CEOs have stepped down since coronavirus outbreak, but there's not evidence to suggest it's all linked to a global power issue.

column2: Coronavirus found in crab legs.
column8: Image did not actually come out of real broadcast with typos, and came from an app that let people make their own stories.

column2: Military on streets of Philadelphia preparing to invoke martial law and bring citizens to FEMA camps.
column8: Lt. Col. Keith Hickox, the state public affairs officer said the information was false.

column2: Article overstates threat of coronavirus.
column8: The claims in the article are backed by science.

column2: Drinking lots of water and gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates the novel coronavirus. Spread the information as you can save someone with this information.
column8: According to GMA news report, saline gargles or gargling with water and salt will provide no protection against or cure for the 2019 novel coronavirus acute respiratory disease (2019-nCoV ARD). The report also carried a statement by the Dr. Eric Domingo “I think this is a home remedy that has been followed for many, many generations and I don’t think there’s going to be any harm in doing it. Saline gargle has always been advocated to improve mostly symptoms of sore throat...I don’t think there is any evidence that it will kill a virus,” Domingo said.

column2: Eating salt on the onion will eliminate the coronavirus.
column8: According to the World Health Organization , eating onions increases the immune system . But it has nothing to do with the treatment of coronovirus. In the investigation we found that no cure for this virus has yet been discovered.

column2: Partially Viral image with differences between a cold, the flu and COVID-19.
column8: The symptoms are not accurate.

column2: Catalonia universities give all course credits to its students after clases being suspended.
column8: Education ministry in Catalonia denied it.

column2: Spanish home office has not issued a statement announcing the complete closure of Madrid, the Basque Country and La Rioja.
column8: Home office denied the autentity of the document.

column2: Felipe Gonzalez, ex-Prime minister of Spain, says that the Spanish coalition government cannot face the covid crisis.
column8: The Twitter account is a parody.

column2: The current coronavirus has been “manufactured” in Wuhan.
column8: There is no scientifice reason to belive that.The international scientific community condemns conspiracy theories and recalls that the current coronavirus originated in wildlife.

column2: There are one hundred children infected with COVID-19 in the main hospital in Lima.
column8: Authorities denied the information of one hundred children infectec with the virus in that hospital, the main public facility for the treatment of children in Lima.

column2: An American soldier has been paid to spread Sars-Cov-2 in Europe.
column8: The man is the sheriff's deputy Rick Grimes, the main caracter of The Walking Dead and the picture is a tumbnail of the 1st episode of The Walking Dead.

column2: Turkish President Erdoğan said that curfew is to declare due to COVID-19.
column8: The clipping of the Hurriyet newspaper is manipulated. President Erdoğan's speech did not cover such a measure.

column2: Two COVID-19 patients were executed in North Korea.
column8: Content belongs to a parody account. There is no declared COVID-19 case in North Korea.

column2: Italian airforce’s airshow to motivate the public under quarantine.
column8: The video is shared in 2019, september, before the outbreak. The plains do not belong to Italian army.

column2: Ireland is going to go into a full lockdown.
column8: Despite two messages which were widely shared on WhatsApp, the country did not go into a full military lockdown with the army patrolling the streets. Shops have not been restricted in their opening hours and public transport has not been cancelled.

column2: A Facebook post shared tens of thousands of times purportedly shows a rail freight tanker with “COVID-19” stamped on one side.
column8: The image has circulated globally but it is false, the tanker operating company said. And Railinc, a corporation that manages an industry-wide database, said there is no such mark as “COVID.”

column2: A graphic has been shared thousands of times on Facebook which claims that gargling warm water with salt or vinegar can eliminate the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: The claim is false; international health authorities and experts do not list gargling as an effective remedy or prevention method for COVID-19.

column2: Gargling salt with water “eliminates” the 2019 novel coronavirus.
column8: Local and international health authorities have said there is not enough study that proves gargling water with salt eliminates the novel coronavirus. To date, there is still no known cure for it.

column2: Former senator Antonio Trillanes IV allegedly posted a tweet saying that President Rodrigo Duterte is to blame for the calamities the country has been facing, including the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The tweet came from an account posing as Trillanes. Using his official Twitter account, the former senator explained how the username of the account is different from the one he’s using.

column2: Astrologers had predicted the appearance of a coronavirus in 2020.
column8: Horoscopes and astro forecasts have no scientific basis.

column2: MOSTLY “Italy has decided not to treat their elderly for this virus.”
column8: Italy, second only to China in the number of COVID-19 cases, hasn’t decided to stop treating elderly COVID-19 patients. But the elderly are a lower priority because they are less likely to survive, and hospitals are overwhelmed with coronavirus cases.

column2: Drink water a lot and gargling with warm water & salt or vinegar to eliminate the virus.
column8: Whenever the virus get into your body, it infects to a cell, not just fall on a throat. Water can't clean the virus from an infected cell, and normally can't get to a respitory system where the virus stay.

column2: A Cuban vaccine cured 1.500 people infected with the new coronavirus.
column8: There is still no vaccine available in the market, according to Health Authorities. Experts estimate that it will take about 18 months to develop and test a vaccine that can be used with safety in human beings.

column2: A post says that if warm water with salt prevent the new coronavirus infection, killing it in the throat.
column8: There is no scientific evidence to support this theory. Several experts had already explained that there’s no connection between the act of drinking water and the virus.

column2: The Simpsons had already predicted the coronavirus pandemic.
column8: It’s not true, because the images that are shown to illustrate this were manipulated and are not in accordance with the original images of the series.

column2: A photo claimed that a Lithuanian town of Mazeikiai is being cut off from the rest of the country due to outbreak of COVID-19.
column8: An original photo shows a sign that informs of a road maintanance project. Whereas the fake one claimed that a city is being cut off.

column2: A facebook post claimed that a message from Stanford hospital gives advice to drink water every 15 minutes in order to prevent COVID-19
column8: A statement from the Stanford hospital distanced themselves from the fake message.

column2: An image on Facebook claimed that hundreds of infected people are hidden in Lithuanian hospitals, and were taken to crematoriums.
column8: The original message was published by a prank generating Facebook account and repackaged to look as if it was real.

column2: Partially Claim that notes from an “uncle” who “graduated with a master’s degree” and worked at Shenzhen Hospital is advice on COVID-19 symptoms and treatment.
column8: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the post to contain a mixture of true and false claims. A runny nose, sputum, dry cough and pneumonia can be symptoms of COVID-19 however not everyone infected with the disease will have them. Disease expert Prof Collingnon says temperatures around 26 to 27 degrees C won’t kill the virus however UV light from the sun can be effective in drying out the virus. Understanding of how long COVID-19 survives on surfaces is limited, with the WHO referring to previous studies of other viruses to estimate a range of a few hours to a few days. Drinking warm water, avoiding iced drinks and gargling warm salt water are not treatments or preventions, according to Prof Cunningham, however staying hydrated is important and gargling may relieve sore throats. The timeline for progression of COVID-19 symptoms is partly accurate but not everyone will experience all of these symptoms or in that order. Prof Cunningham also said it was not accurate to say infection will happen first in the throat, as the delicate tissues behind the nose are more likely starting points.

column2: Ancient herbal drink is an efffective remedy for the novel coronavirus.
column8: Experts advise against using herbal remedies to treat coronavirus

column2: False COVID-19 hotline number shared in Canada.
column8: 811 is not an official public health hotline in Ontario, and the provincial ministry of health is not organizing home visits, a spokeswoman told AFP.

column2: Israel has no cases of the coronavirus because it developed a cure.
column8: Official World Health Organization (WHO) data and Israeli media reports state at least 298 people have been confirmed to have contracted the disease as of March 16; Israel has implemented travel restrictions and closed businesses in response to the spread of COVID-19. Various countries have been working develop a vaccine for COVID-19 and WHO guidance currently states there is no "cure" for the virus to date.

column2: Claim that COVID-19 has been around for a long time, with a photo of an animal vaccine labeled “coronavirus”.
column8: The coronavirus affecting these animals is different from the virus that appeared a few months ago in China, for which there is no vaccine.

column2: A photo showing full vegan supermarkets’ shelves, next to empty ones, with a caption saying “even at a time of coronavirus, no one wants to eat vegan”.
