column8: The photo had been circulating on the Internet for two years and a half.

column2: After the closure of schools in France, president Emmanuel Macron announced classes next summer to catch up.
column8: Emmanuel Macron has not made such announces. It was published from a fake account.

column2: Cuba developed a coronavirus vaccine.
column8: Cuban medication has been used for treating COVID-19 in China, but it is not a vaccine and the substance has been discovered elsewhere.

column2: Holding your breath without coughing will tell you if you have COVID-19
column8: False, having difficulty breathing is a feature of any respiratory illness and not a sign of coronavirus.

column2: Books Predicted The coronavirus Before it happened.
column8: One book does have a close enough accurate representation, the second is a work of fiction.

column2: India Announced Holidays for 4 States.
column8: No such letter was issued by the government.

column2: Israel and USA have come up with a vaccine.
column8: Israel has found a vaccine with properties similar to COVID-19, San Diego had developed an algorithm.

column2: Viral video suggests the two cases of coronavirus in Ghana tested negative.
column8: The video is not new. It was part of a news item published by Citi TV on February 6, 2020, when two suspected cases tested negative.

column2: Viral post suggests Dettol sanitizer can kill coronavirus.
column8: Dettol has been tested on, and found to kill coronaviruses such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS). However, the manufacturer of Dettol, Reckitt Benckiser Group plc(RB), says it has not yet tested its products on the novel coronavirus and could not confirm whether Dettol is effective against the new coronavirus strain.

column2: A misleading chart being spread on Facebook, erroneously dubbing the new coronavirus the “least deadly virus.”
column8: The chart cites old data about coronavirus cases and deaths, and it contains an error that makes COVID-19 look less fatal than the 2009 H1N1 “swine flu” outbreak.

column2: Indian Ministry of Health and Family Welfare as issued an office memorandum declaring compulsory holiday in four Indian states.
column8: Ministry of Health India has denied any such notification.

column2: The claim that a scientific paper published in Nature in 2015, shows that the new virus was developed in labs.
column8: On the contrary, the authors state that viruses similar to SARS have been detected in populations of bats.

column2: image showing italian doctors exhausted and sleeping.
column8: Images that were used belong to a campaign in Mexico for healtworkers rights.

column2: Propolis cures COVID-19.
column8: There is no evidence to support this claim.

column2: A secret invasion of 40 thousand american troops immune to COVID-19 is ongoing in Europe.
column8: A secret invasion of 40 thousand American troops on Europe is not happening.

column2: COVID-19 is a human made, and an American biological weapon
column8: Scientific reseach shows that the virus is not human made.

column2: Croatian president tells people to buy in bulk for at least 2 weeks.
column8: The president did not say you should buy food to sustain you for two weeks.

column2: People panicking about a COVID-19 case at the Dakar Airport.
column8: this footage has nothing to do with the coronavirus pandemic and was taken out of context from a Senegalese TV footage showing an exercise.

column2: Saddam Hussein explaining what is coronavirus about.
column8: Sound has been edited. It's a video from 2003 where Saddam Hussein is talking about the USA/Irak war.

column2: Saddam Hussein explaining what is coronavirus about.
column8: Sound has been edited. It's a video from 2003 where Saddam Hussein is talking about the USA/Irak war.

column2: Healthy ministry sent an email about the new coronavirus.
column8: Colombian Ministry of Health explained that the email was false.

column2: Coronavirus scare began after impeachment.
column8: the outbreak began in China in late 2019, and it led to the World Health Organization to declare a global health emergency on January 30, 2020, before the final impeachment vote.

column2: Supermarkets are recalling coronavirus-infected toilet paper.
column8: The CDC said that coronavirus is spread through respiratory droplets. No reports yet of toilet paper recalls.

column2: Man did pass along coronavirus infection at a WalMart in Louisiana.
column8: The man in the photo who posted it admitted it was a joke.

column2: NYC did implement citywide quarantine.
column8: NY Mayor Bill de Blasio tweeted it was a false alarm.

column2: Spanish Ministry of Interior is closing-off Madrid.
column8: The ministry of Interior has denied releasing that statement.

column2: Drinking hot beverages prevents coronavirus infection.
column8: Fluid intake has nothing to do with the infection process.

column2: Audio from WhatsApp that says there are a doctor and two nurses hospitalized on the ICU in Terrassa (Barcelona)
column8: The hospitals in Terrassa deny this situation.

column2: Film ‘coronavirus’ predicted the current pandemic
column8: That's not the cover of the movie. The original name of the film in Korean is "Gamgi" (Cold), "Flu" in English, and it is translated into Spanish as "Virus".

column2: A viral message listing false and unrelated statements about coronavirus has falsely been attributed to the United Nations International Children’s Emergency Fund (UNICEF).
column8: No such advisory has been released by UNICEF. Nor much is known about novel coronavirus as it is a newly found coronavirus.

column2: Israel has manufactured the coronavirus (COVID-19) vaccine
column8: According to Isreal, work at The Biological Institute is going on and it may take time. 50 of the most senior researchers and scientists are working hard to prepare a vaccine. The Image which is being circulated along with the claim is a reference image, available on shutterstock.

column2: Partially They are not looking for volunteers to be infected with SARS-CoV-2 in British laboratories for 4,000 euros.
column8: Headlines shared on networks do not specify that they will inject other coronavirus strains, 0C43 and 229E.

column2: Partially Zhong Nanshan: shower may cause coronavirus infection according to cases in Hong Kong and Diamond Princess.
column8: Zhong said "sewer", but it was translated as shower in Chinese in one wechat account. Then Taiwanese media misunderstood as "shower" and interviewed Taiwanese officials and experts to command it.

column2: The Minister of Defense of Japan posted a tweet to thank Taiwan for donating 500,000 face masks.
column8: It is a fake tweet.

column2: Asterix comics in 1981 mentioned coronavirus, French people knew the outbreak in advance.
column8: Coronaviruses had been known for a while and are not only referring to COVID-19. 1981 Asterix comic books did not mention coronavirus. The issue from 2017 did refer to coronavirus, but it has nothing to do with the current outbreak.

column2: A Turkish citizen in Yozgat ate yogurt and soap together to get rid of the virus.
column8: The news first published in an parody site. There is no such a guy in Yozgat nor the doctors mentioned.

column2: Central government has announced blanket holiday for schools/colleges in 4 states in India.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: The health service in Ireland is asking people to stockpile food.
column8: The claim was untrue. The health service is not urging people to stockpile food - in fact, the opposite is true - and the supply chains in Ireland remain robust

column2: Ireland is going into a ‘Status Red’ lockdown with the military patrolling the streets.
column8: The claim was untrue. Ireland has not gone into lockdown

column2: COVID-19 Breeds Rapidly In Toilet Paper.
column8: Post claiming COVID-19 breeds rapidly in toilet paper is fake. The post is taken from an unauthentic website.

column2: Singapore checks the Saliva of Indonesian arrivals at Changi Airport
column8: The COVID-19 swab test is only intended for tourists who have symptoms such as fever or other respiratory ailments.

column2: A Twitter post claimed Christiano Ronaldo is transforming his string of hotels to hospitals; to aid in the fight against COVID-19.
column8: A spokesperson from the hotel denied the claim. Moreover, there is no such statement present on any of the footballer’s media accounts.

column2: Advice about coronavirus prevention and remedies, allegedly from Stanford Hospital.
column8: Almost every advice listed in the original and widely spread Facebook messages was false. Facebook did not label these messages as misinformation (neither in English nor in Dutch).

column2: Staff of Gold Coast Hospital in Australia has gifted a volleyball to Tom Hanks in quarantine.
column8: The image has been morphed to claim that Tom Hanks was gifted a volleyball.

column2: An infographic has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts which claim it shows a nine-day timeline of the symptoms of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: This infographic is misleading; it was not distributed by an official health authority and health experts say COVID-19 symptoms vary in duration and severity.

column2: Evo Morales (ex-mandatary of Bolivia) has COVID-19.
column8: Morales continue his normal activities. Moreover, on march twelve he posted in his Twitter account. Also, other followers of the political party Movement to Socialism (MAS) did not refer about the health condition of the ex mandatary.

column2: A post shared more than 165,000 times on Facebook includes a video of a woman turning a baby wipe into a face mask to “protect against coronavirus.”
column8: The company that sells the wipes says they should not be used in this way, and health experts also recommend caution.

column2: Eleven coronavirus patients visited malls and hotels in Metro Manila that are part of a “confidential list.”
column8: The DOH has dismissed the message as fake. The malls and hotels in question have also not posted any advisories regarding possible infection.

column2: A vaccine for the 2019 novel coronavirus has been found and there will be no more deaths due to the coronavirus.
column8: As of Friday morning, March 20, there is no vaccine or cure for the disease caused by the 2019 novel coronavirus and there have been 217,510 cases and 9,020 deaths, across 157 countries.

column2: “It’s actually the safest time to fly.”
column8: Older Americans and those with chronic conditions are advised to reconsider all travel plans to avoid COVID-19. The State Department is advising all citizens to reconsider travel abroad.

column2: Drinking “water a lot and gargling with warm water & salt or vinegar eliminates” the coronavirus.
column8: Neither drinking a lot of water, nor gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar, has been identified as working against the coronavirus.

column2: MOSTLY “President Trump, COVID-19 coronavirus: U.S. cases 1,329; U.S. deaths, 38; panic level: mass hysteria. President Obama, H1N1 virus: U.S. cases, 60.8 million; U.S. deaths, 12,469; panic level: totally chill. Do you all see how the media can manipulate your life.”
column8: Numbers that suggest H1N1 was worse than COVID-19 are misleading. It’s too early to calculate how deadly the coronavirus will be, but there are signs it’s much worse.

column2: Elderly people are left to die in an Italian hospital near Milan.
column8: Information was based on an audio message circulating via WhatsApp. The message was posted by "Il Giornale", which later retracted the message. Niguarda hospital released a statement claiming that the information was false.

column2: Airports and train stations in Lithuania are being closed down.
column8: The article used a statement by the government which claimed that schools are being closed. Authors of the misleading article added information about airports and train stations in a headlines but used the governments statement as main text.

column2: COVID-19 is cured with hot water and baking soda.
column8: Mortality statistics indicate that seasonal flu is at least 60 times less deadly than COVID-19 (based on current data). Hot water and soda have no proven effects to help combat the novel coronavirus.

column2: Claim that disease outbreaks and pandemics correspond with election years.
column8: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found no correlation between election years and virus outbreaks. The outbreaks of SARS, Bird Flu and COVID-19 do not line up with the dates claimed in the post. In the case of Zika virus, the disease has had multiple outbreaks since 2014 in parts of Oceania and in Brazil. Bird Flu, MERS and Ebola have not been reported in Australia and have not been a significant feature of local political discussion or debate. Considering overseas elections, such as US presidential elections, there is also no consistent pattern of outbreaks occurring in election years.

column2: Photo purportedly showing Tom Hanks holding a volleyball, claiming the hospital staff in Australia gave it to him as a tribute and to cheer him up while in quarantine.
column8: The image has been doctored using a 2015 photograph of Hanks and a stock photo of a hospital ward; the doctored photo emerged on a satirical website.

column2: Infographic claiming that the coronavirus pandemic fits a pattern of viral outbreaks that occur every 100 years.
column8: The infographic contains inaccurate information about historical viral outbreaks and ignores other epidemics that do not fit the assumed pattern; health experts told AFP that while certain viruses are seasonal in nature, there is no basis for the claim that viral outbreaks occur once every century.

column2: Photos showing empty shelves at supermarkets.
column8: The photos have circulated online since 2015.

column2: This video purports to show body bags for virus victims in Italy.
column8: It has previously circulated in media reports about people who died after contracting COVID-19 in Iran; a man recording the video can be heard stating that he is inside a mortuary in the Iranian city of Qom.

column2: Warm drinks kill the coronavirus, the virus dies when the ambient temperature is higher than 26ºC, gargling warm water helps treating the disease and the virus stays on your hands for 10 minutes.
column8: None of this claims have any scientific support.

column2: Mexicans can call the Mexican government to get a COVID-19 test at home.
column8: The UIES line was enabled only for suspicious cases and not for the general population.

column2: 3,500 italians potentially infected with the novel coronavirus arrived in Brazil in a cruiseship
column8: The photo that has been shared with the misinformation piece is from the Costa Fascinosa cruise, and the company responsible for the vessel reported that all of its passengers in Brazil are from South America. The ship left Italy on November 17, 2019, has passed through France and Spain and has been on the Brazilian coast since December 2, two months before Italy confirmed its first coronavirus case.

column2: The Brazilian government released additional money for beneficiaries of Bolsa Família, a national conditional cash transfer programme.
column8: The Ministry of Citizenship, responsible for the program, denied on its social networks that there will be such a release and stated that it only announced the inclusion of 1.2 million families in Bolsa Família. In addition, messages circulating on WhatsApp with this misinformation (see here) bring links to fake websites.

column2: News channels suggests drinking tulsi and noni juice will help prevent the Novel coronavirus.
column8: A morphed screenshot of the news channel was used.

column2: Argentine President Alberto Fernández said that coronavirus dies at 26 degrees celsius.
column8:
The WHO maintains that the virus can be transmitted in all climatic areas and that "the virus is too new for us to know how a warmer climate could affect transmissibility".
According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), it is not yet known whether climate and temperature affect the spread of COVID-19. There is still no scientific consensus on the impact of room temperature on this particular virus.

column2: Argentine President Alberto Fernández said that “the WHO recomended to drink hot drinks because heat kills the virus” (about coronavirus)
column8:
The organization did not issue any recommendation on the consumption of beverages for the prevention of coronavirus.
Experts deny this advice and even say that it could be harmful. This version circulates on social media and WhatsApp in Argentina and in other countries.

column2: In Colombia, “First Child registered as Yair coronavirus Mosquera”.
column8: "First Child registered as Yair coronavirus Mosquera". The screenshot of the alleged note from Caracol has been broadcast on social networks.

column2: Hot lemon juice prevents coronavirus.

column2: Iranians have published report saying that coronavirus is a biological warfare.
column8: There was no such report and claims about coronavirus being biological warfare have been already debunked.

column2: Most affected countries by COVID-19 are along the same 40-degree North latitude.

Also, it does not touch Wuhan (Hubei Province – where around 60% of all the positive cases are reported), which is at around 30-degree North latitude.

column8: WHO said that there is no evidence that proves that garlic heals coronavirus.

column8: Medical practitioners and even WHO has rubbished this claim and has said that there is no evidence to prove that turmeric and lemon can be used to cure coronavirus.

column8: There is no medical evidence to support the idea that drinking water every 15 minutes will help protect you from coronavirus.

column2: Private health insurance for public workers does not cover expenses related to coronavirus.
column8: The statement published by Independent Union of the Tax Agency of Spain in March 12 is real but a more updated version of March 23, and the public institution (MUFACE), affirm that all its insured (public workers) have 100% coverage in expenses related to COVID-19.

column2: Vitamin C protects against the spread of the coronavirus. Lemon in hot water fights cancer. COVID-19 arises from the fusion of genetic material of a snake and a bat.
column8: Any of these protect against the coronavirus.

column8: The image of Tom Hanks apparently holding a Wilson volleyball during his COVID-19 quarantine comes from a satirical Australian website.

column2: A video has been viewed hundreds of thousands of times on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim it shows a shaman curing a novel coronavirus patient in Malaysia.
column8: The claim is false; the video has circulated online in posts about a hospital in Indonesia since at least October 2018, more than one year before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan.

column2: A fake quote of Vice President Leni Robredo suggesting to “inhale cough back” to prevent the spread of the 2019 novel coronavirus.
column8: The Vice President did not say what was attributed to her in the graphic. News5 said the graphic was edited using their template.

column2: Says if you donate blood, “they HAVE to test you” for coronavirus.
column8: Blood donors don’t get a coronavirus test if they donate blood.

column2: MOSTLY “During the 2009 swine flu outbreak, Biden made reckless comments unsupported by science & the experts. The Obama Admin had to clean up his mess & apologize for his ineptitude.”
column8: During the 2009 swine flu outbreak, Biden said he would advise his family against traveling in confined places and said when one person sneezes “it goes all the way through an aircraft.” Scientists say that’s not how germs spread. Biden’s comments were met with backlash and his spokesperson issued a clarification.

column2: MOSTLY Donald Trump claims Joe Biden “was in charge of the H1N1 Swine Flu epidemic which killed thousands of people. The response was one of the worst on record. Our response is one of the best, with fast action of border closings & a 78% Approval Rating, the highest on record. His was lowest!”
column8: Joe Biden was not in charge of the Obama administration’s H1N1 response. Trump overstated public confidence in his administration’s response to the coronavirus and downplayed confidence in the Obama administration’s response to H1N1.

column2: Says Nancy Pelosi was “caught trying to include abortion funding in bill to combat coronavirus.”
column8: The U.S. House passed a measure that provides federal funds to people affected by the coronavirus. The bill covers reimbursement laboratory costs for COVID-19 testing. Some raised concerns that language was needed to specifically ensure abortion services weren’t eligible to receive funds. The language was amended by Democrats to limit reimbursements to COVID-19 expenses.

column2: “‘The Simpsons’ predicted Tom Hanks getting coronavirus in 2007.”
column8: In the closing credits of “The Simpson Movie,” Hanks says: "This is Tom Hanks, saying, if you see me in person, leave me be." The movie is about an environmental crisis. There’s no reference to any kind of outbreak.

column2: “The CDC can detain anyone with a fever — indefinitely. … Vaccination (is) a way people could get out of detention.”
column8: In the United States, people can’t be quarantined for just having a fever; they have to be shown to have been exposed to one of a specific set of diseases. Most quarantines are done voluntarily, not by force of the government. And vaccination is not a ticket out of quarantine. Most quarantine decisions are up to states and localities, rather than the CDC.

column2: Says COVID-19 came to the United States in 2019.
column8: The first confirmed COVID-19 case in the United States was reported on Jan. 20, 2020. The patient was a man who had recently returned to Washington state from Wuhan, China.

column2: The new coronavirus dies when a temperature around is 26-27 degrees Celsius.
column8: The virus doesn't die when the temperature is around 27-28 degrees Celsius.

column2: Mostly Saint Luke’s Hospital of USA says that consuming alcohol can reduce the risk of COVID-19.
column8: Saint Luke's Hospital hasn't released any such advisory.

column2: Prime Minister Ana Brnabic claimed that the number of respirators is a state secret in all countries.
column8: Information about number of respirators is available in many countries.

column2: Claim that pic of vegan food products left on otherwise bare supermarket shelf is related to COVID-19 outbreak and panic buying.
column8: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the Facebook post to be incorrectly linking the supermarket shelf image to the 2019/20 COVID-19 coronavirus outbreak. The image of a supermarket shelf full of vegan foods while the shelves either side remain empty has nothing to do with the COVID-19 coronavirus outbreak. It was originally taken in 2017 in the United States when Hurricane Harvey hit the southern state of Texas.

column2: Chart compares COVID-19 with other longstanding diseases.
column8: The graphic is misleading and risks underplaying the danger of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, which is a new disease with a fast-rising mortality rate.

column2: Imported second hand clothes from Europe, Asia or America could spread the novel coronavirus in Africa.

There is no recommendation from the World Health Organization or scientific evidence to support this.
There is also no vaccine or medicine to prevent the disease yet.

Israel’s MIGAL Research Institute is also in the process of producing a vaccine for COVID-19. According to WHO, as on 11 March 2020, there is no vaccine for COVID-19.

It is true that World Health Organization’s advice is there is no evidence that companion animals/pets can be infected with COVID-19 despite a single case in Hong Kong of a dog testing “weak positive”.

column2: Partially Multiple allegations on how to protect oneself from CoV.
column8: Many of the practices detailed in the post are misleading and inaccurate.

column2: Man in hospital after eating bat.
column8: This photo has circulated in an online fundraising page for a man with a lung condition unrelated to the novel coronavirus

column2: Russia said CoV is man-made.
column8: the Russian Ministry of Health said it did not make such a statement; the document cited in the misleading posts states COVID-19 is a “recombinant virus” which can form naturally.

column2: Claim that the coronavirus has been discovered in poultry.
column8: Sri Lankan authorities said the coronavirus has not been discovered in poultry; the photos were taken from various unrelated reports online and show chickens sickened with other diseases.

column2: A Nigerian taxidriver thereatens to spread Cov.
column8: The story originated from a parody account and has been denied by the man pictured in the claim and government officials.

column2: This photos show Indians bathing in cow dung to prevent infection.
column8: The photos show participants at an annual cow dung festival held in the southern region of India in October 2019, several weeks before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan.

column2: Video shows Wuhan residents lining up for death certificates.
column8: The video has previously circulated in reports about Wuhan residents gathering to collect free vegetables.

column2: Chinese official detainted a CoV case.
column8: It was an exercise.

column2: Claims that drinking boiled garlic water cures novel coronavirus.
column8: Medical experts told AFP there was no evidence to support the theory about drinking garlic water; international health organisations do not recommend the remedy and have said there is no specific antiviral treatment for the new strain of the novel coronavirus.

column2: The Simpsons have predicted the coronavirus outbreak.
column8: The frames were taken from different episodes - about the Osaka flu and the housecat flu. One of them was digitally manipulated to include the word "coronavirus".

column2: Vinegar is more effective than alcohol-based hand sanitizers for killing the novel coronavirus.
column8: Vinegar is not effective as a hand sanitizer. Its effects on breaking up the fat protection around viruses are very limited. Meanwhile, alcohol and soap are very effective on breaking up this protection

column2: Drinking hot water prevents the COVID-19
column8: This information is false, health authorities do not recognize hot water as a preventive measure and experts point out that it could be counterproductive.

column2: Insufficient A health expert surmised that the SARS-Cov2 virus might not spread in Nigeria due to hot temperature.
column8: Warmer air holds more moisture; thus preventing airborne viruses from travelling as far as they would in dry air. Still, the jury’s out on whether or not SARS-Cov2 will be resistant or vulnerable to hot temperature.

column2: Ecuadorean doctor develops a vaccine for COVID-19.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: Two cases of coronavirus have been reported in Loja, in Ecuador.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: Azuay Governor in Ecuador seeks the cure of covid-19 in indigenous medicine.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: A new case of coronavirus confirmed in Tulcán, Ecuador.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: This is a video that was suppossedly developed by the Ecuadorean Health Ministry to encourage people to wash constantly their hands.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: An image of a tweet that purportedly shows Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer criticized President Trump’s restrictions on foreign nationals traveling to the US from China.
column8: It was a fake tweet.

column2: The government — or specific states such as Michigan or Florida — has mandated that employers and schools close for two weeks.
column8: No such announcement has been made. It was apparently a prank.

column2: Pope Francis and his 2 aides have infected with COVID-19.
column8: Pope tested negative.

column2: CDC recommends men shave their beards to protect against coronavirus.
column8: A 2017 CDC infographic shows how facial hair could interfere with respirator masks. The graphic is unrelated to coronavirus protection and the CDC has not recommended people should shave their beards to ward off the virus.

column2: A Bovine Vaccine Can Be Used To Inoculate People Against coronavirus.
column8: There is still currently no approved and public vaccine.

column2: Patents Mean Deadly Diseases And Viruses Were Created Or Invented In A Lab.
column8: Instead, the patents are for possible treatments or vaccines, some of which were tested but did not work.

column2: You can’t get infected by kissing the hands of a virgin or saint statue.
column8: Kissing the hands of a virgin or saint statue is a tradition of the Holy Week in some parts of Spain, but it is not free for viruses and therefor can be a way of inffection.

column2: An audio clip circulating on Facebook claiming that Kenya has recorded 63 cases of COVID-19.
column8: An audio clip claiming that Kenya has recorded 63 cases of novel coronavirus has been edited and taken out of context. The clip was part of a training exercise by the Ministry of Health to prepare for a likely outbreak ahead of the opening of a quarantine center in Nairobi.

column2: Pope Francis and two of his aides have infected with COVID-19.
column8: The Vatican and the embassy said the pope recently fell ill with a common cold.

column2: Japanese Asahi Shimbun TV: USA caught COVID-19 before Wuhan, according to American CDC
column8: The original news clip suggested that there could be some COVID-19 cases being misdiagnosing with flu in the USA. But it didn't mention that the COVID-19 is originated in the USA.

column2: A study published by two Chinese research institutions suggested that human semen can cure COVID-19.
column8: The screenshot of the report circulated online was digitally manipulated. The original report suggested another medicine could be the cure, not human semen.

column2: Spices can ward off Corona Virus
column8: Spices can increase endurance but there is no evidence that they can prevent and cure coronavirus.

column2: Coronavirus can be transmitted through imported goods
column8: The virus cannot be outside the human body for a long time.

column2: Coronavirus dies in temperatures 26-27 degrees and when exposed to sunlight?
column8: None of the studies that mention the coronavirus linked with COVID-19 can die in temperatures 26-27 degrees Celsius and when exposed to sunlight.

column2: Turkish raki is prevents COVID-19.
column8: Clipping was doctored on online app. There is no evidence shows raki prevents the disease.

column2: Bloggers say the Vatican reports that Pope Francis tested negative for the coronavirus before a second test came back positive.
column8: An Italian newspaper reported that Pope Francis tested negative for the coronavirus. The Vatican hasn’t confirmed or denied the report.

column2: Video shows President Donald Trump saying COVID-19 is Democrats’ “new hoax.”
column8: The video makes it look like Trump called coronavirus “their new hoax.” In fact, there was nearly a full minute between when the president said “coronavirus” and “hoax” during a Feb. 28 rally in North Charleston, S.C.

column2: One needs to drink (warm) water or gargle throat every 15 minutes to rinse the new coronavirus down.
column8: There is no clinical/scientific support that drinking warm water can protect from the new coronavirus.

column2: This video shows the Coronavirus dead amassed in the Bergamo (or Brescia) hospital.
column8: The video was recorded in Ecuador at the Los Ceibos General Hospital in Guayaquil.

column2: Outbreak of COVID-19 is a worldwide fake, fatality rate too low for an epidemic, WHO admitted causing SARS outbreak in 2003.
column8: Thousands of confirmed cases around the globe, virus confirmed in multiple labs, fatality rate greater than that of some of pandemics in the 20th century.

column2: This photo shows a brothel in Europe where people have been quarantined.
column8: Claim originated on a satirical website based in Spain, the photo is of a nightclub in Marbella.

column2: These are 7 ‘evil’ things that COVID-19 is ‘afraid’ of.
column8: The claim is misleading; health experts say such practices are only effective when applied properly and can even be harmful if used incorrectly.

column2: A runny nose and sputum secretion are not symptoms of novel coronavirus.
column8: WHO listed those as possible symptoms.

column2: Israeli scientists have developed a COVID-19 vaccine.
column8: Israel's migal institute said it was still working to develop a vaccine, the photo is from a stock photo website.

column2: 12 pieces of advice for coronavirus, including symptoms, transmission, how to neutralize the virus.
column8: The majority of the advice is either false or unfounded.

column2: Plant-based cure for coronavirus discovered in Iran.
column8: The plant-based product has not been either approved or submitted for approval to Iranian authorities, according to the official news agency.

column2: Disinfectant gel causes cancer.
column8: There have been no credible studies to prove this, according to health experts.

column2: Twitter users said Adutwumwaa Bitters cures coronavirus.
column8: Adumtwumwaa Bitters does not cure coronavirus. Producers of the medicine, Adumtwumwaa Herbal Industries Limited, have emphatically stated that their product cannot and does not cure the deadly virus. The World Health Organization (WHO) says there’s no cure, vaccine or specific antiviral medicine to prevent or treat coronavirus at the moment.

column2: Constant sex kills coronavirus.
column8: Sex cannot kill or cure coronavirus, the science does not add up. Rather such close contact with an infected person will expose the partner to the disease.

column2: Viral picture message in Nigeria suggests former president Obasanjo said that there is no coronavirus in Nigeria and that the minister of health lied.
column8: President Obasanjo's spokesperson, Kehinde Akinyemi refuted allegations attributed to Baba; a moniker often used to describe the former head of state. Additionally, Dubawa initiated a google reverse image search, which revealed that the "Fox News writer" (the source) used the image out of context.

column2: Ecuadorean youtuber Raùl Alvarez Guene supposedly infected with COVID-19.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: A bovine coronavirus vaccine, for cattle, is proof that the novel coronavirus isn’t “new” and is evidence of “how much the media controls people.”
column8: The cattle vaccine has nothing to do with the COVID-19 virus.

column2: Journalist Claims A coronavirus Patient Was Murdered.
column8: The tweet did go out from a TV reporter, but it was doctored to claim that a murder investigation was underway at the nursing home.

column2: VP Pence Urged People With coronavirus To Go To The Police.
column8: This is a fake Tweet by Pence. He never said this.

column2: Ministry of Health (Spain) sends WhatsApp chain with advices against coronavirus outbreak.
column8: It's not a real alert by the Ministery of Health.

column2: 3.000 people from Elche (Spain) infected by coronavirus after coming back from Milan’s international footwear industry fair.
column8: There currently aren't any coronavirus cases in Elche and the Ministery of Health has not released any statement claiming so.

column2: The Pope has COVID-19.
column8: Vatican's press office announced that the Pope just has a common cold. He is continuing his schedule. If he had the virus, his age would make it difficult for him to do so.

column2: Whatsapp message contains multiple health advises.
column8: The text message is based on the advices lacking scientific evidences. WHO advices does not include any of them.

column2: Man Critical With Novel coronavirus In Barhalganj, India.
column8: There is no confirmed case of the novel coronavirus in Barhalganj, a town in Gorakhpur, Uttar Pradesh. And the man did not get infected with coronavirus in Barhalganj by consuming chicken. The viral post is fake.

column2: Alcohol kills coronavirus
column8: Post claiming alcohol kills coronavirus is fake.

column2: Ambulance health care workers are transporting a corona patient in The Hague (The Netherlands), dressed in white protective suits.
column8: Medical personel and news websites had already explicitly stated that this patiënt was not infected with the coronavirus.

column2: Post says “sanitizer will do nothing for the coronavirus.”
column8: Although it is not effective against all viruses, hand sanitizers with high alcohol content have proven effective against human coronaviruses.

column2: Post says two patients at Valley Regional Medical Center in Brownsville, Texas, “are being looked at” for possible coronavirus infections.
column8: Health officials say there are no coronavirus patients in the Rio Grande Valley as of March 3, 2020.

column2: MOSTLY The United States is “actually screening fewer people (for the coronavirus than other countries) because we don’t have appropriate testing.”
column8: The CDC has stopped publicly reporting the number of tests it’s administered. As of March 4, the United States has lagged behind other nations in terms of coronavirus testing.

column2: “Coronavirus Hoax: Fake Virus Pandemic Fabricated to Cover-Up Global Outbreak of 5G Syndrome.”
column8: No credible evidence has emerged to show that the current coronavirus spreading around the world was fabricated.

column2: Multiple videos seen tens of thousands of times on Facebook claim garlic and onions can prevent and cure infection from novel coronavirus.
column8: This is false; the World Health Organization says garlic cannot prevent or treat COVID-19.

column2: Indonesia has provided 1000 free tickets for nationals to return home from abroad.

column2: This is a video of alleged panicked shoppers storming a supermarket amid the coronavirus pandemic.

column2: Four patients infected with virus hospitalized in Sri Lanka.
column8: Only two suspect patients were hospitalized and both later tested negative.

column8: No food or diet, neither alkaline or otherwise, can prevent the infection

column2: “Florida hospital reports a coronavirus ‘infestation’ with multiple confirmed patients.”
column8: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention presumptively confirmed two cases of the 2019 coronavirus in Florida.

column2: Says a photo shows a man wearing a “government issue Saint Laurent hazardous materials suit.”
column8: The image was posted by a self-described parody account.

column2: “Shands Hospital of Gainesville Florida has confirmed its first case of coronavirus.”
column8: As of March 2, 2020, the CDC has confirmed two cases of COVID-19 in Florida. Shands Hospital in Gainesville, Florida, has not confirmed a coronavirus case.

column2: Post says no one has died from the coronavirus in the United States.
column8: As of March 3, nine people have died from the coronavirus in the United States. The first death was on March 1.

column2: Post says the coronavirus is “simply the common cold.”
column8: The 2019 coronavirus is part of a family of viruses that produce illnesses ranging from the common cold to more critical diseases such as SARS or MERS, but is a new virus that had not been previously identified.

column2: This video has been shot in a mall in Germany during the pandemia.
column8: It has been filmed years before the pandemia.

column8: Yellow rain is not a real rain, it's how to call an chemical weapon in the past. Even a storm is coming, it's unable to bring virus from China to Thailand.

column8: The photo has circulated in reports since 2014, after one of Iran's vice-presidents was injured in a traffic accident.

column2: Vatican says Pope Francis has been infected with the novel coronavirus.
column8: The Vatican said the pope recently fell ill with a common cold..

column2: 14 points that are expert advice on coronavirus, including symptoms, prevention and how it spreads
column8: Some points are outright false, some misleading -- there isn't enough research on the virus to make these claims.

column2: Mongolia donates 30000 sheep to china during the virus epidemic
column8: The videos circulated before Mongolia announced the donation on Feb 27, 2020.

column2: Volcanic ash can kill the coronavirus.
column8: WHO says there is no evidence that volcanic ash can destroy COVID-19.

column2: Germany gave medical protection equipment like masks to China, now it’s missing in Germany.
column8: Germany sent protection equipment to China twice in February.

column2: The coronavirus is more dangerous for animals than for humans.
column8: There is no proof that animals can get or spread the new coronavirus.

column8: The video was made in 2011 and shows people who wanted to buy laptops at an Aldi store in Kiel.

column2: This virus must be old because a bottle of desinfectant from 2015 shows „coronavirus“.

column2: Doctors Recommend Carbon Filter Face Masks To Prevent coronavirus Spread.
column8: Videos falsely claims that doctors are recommending carbon filter masks as a way to protect families, although the FDA and CDC both concluded that they are not effective for children and are not recommended for home use. The videos are used to sell the masks to people concerned about the coronavirus outbreak.

column2: Garlic water can treat coronavirus.
column8: WHO says there is no evidence.

column2: Pangolin is the original cause of the COVID-19.
column8: The scientists that first pointed to pangolin as the original cause of the infection have since then rectified.

column2: Russia announces the closure of airspace and suspension of all its incoming and outgoing flights to China.
column8: Russian government had imposed some temporary and partial ban on the movement of Chinese nationals. All Russian airlines, with the exception of national airline Aeroflot (AFLT.MM), stopped flying to China from Jan. 31. Small airline Ikar will also continue flights between Moscow and China. All planes arriving from China will be sent to a separate terminal in the Moscow Sheremetyevo airport. Aeroflot reduced the frequency of flights to Beijing, Shanghai, and Guangzhou until Feb. 29.

column2: Taiwanese president and the former president were infected. The former president died.
column8: The imagines of screenshots of news outlets and official documents are either doctored or forged. As to the date, the claim appeared online, President Tsai had a public speech at 228 memorial event.

column2: Police in China have started killing COVID-19 patients, killing 25,000 so far.
column8: None of the four clips spliced together shows cops “shooting” COVID-19 patients. In fact, one of the clips is actually of a road crash. Another one features not the sound of gunshots, but the explosion of Lunar New Year Fireworks in the background.

column2: COVID-19 came from Chinese people eating human babies, which they supposedly do to get good skin.
column8: The netizen’s claim about COVID-19 coming from eating babies is false and baseless. The photos used are also all over a decade old, some of which show a Chinese man "eating babies" as a protest art in 2000.

column2: Post says President Barack Obama “waited six months to call swine flu an emergency after thousands died.”
column8: The Obama administration declared swine flu, or H1N1, a public health emergency six weeks before H1N1 was declared a pandemic. No H1N1 deaths had yet been recorded in the United States.

column2: The Vatican confirmed that Pope Francis and two aides tested positive for coronavirus.
column8: The Vatican denied allegations that Pope Francis contracted the novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19).

column2: A video showing chaos in a shop, claiming that people are panicking after a first confirmed case of coronavirus in Lithuania.
column8: The video was made in May 2018 in Romania, during a sale at a supermarket.

column2: Doctors in Japan advise people to drink water every 15 minutes to prevent an infection.
column8: WHO says drinking water does not prevent novel coronavirus.

column2: Vitamin helps against CoV.
column8: Health experts told AFP there is insufficient science to definitively say vitamin D can protect from the viral epidemic.

column2: Elections years in the United States coincide with major disease outbreaks.
column8: Several years of discovery or the associated spread of a disease do not match election years, national and international health organizations said.

column2: Cambodian Prime Minister has CoV.
column8: 2017 photo of the PM, treated for something else.

column2: Beef meat is the best vaccine against CoV.

column8: This video of a person infected with coronavirus being detained by the police is not real, it´s a drill. It was shot last February 21 at Henan Tongbai by the police and the emergency response team.

column2: The wife of a Chinese shop owner of Totana (Murcia) has coronavirus.
column8: She did not have the virus.

column2: A post says that a “poll finds 38% of Americans Say They Will Not Drink Corona Beer Because of Virus.”
column8: The poll was conducted by a PR firm. The firm did not release full details about the poll.

column2: “Every election year has a disease” … SARS in 2004; avian flu in 2008; swine flu in 2010; MERS in 2012; Ebola in 2014 and 2018; Zika in 2016 and the coronavirus in 2020.
column8: Most of these diseases were discovered and spread before the election years and were minimally mentioned during campaigns. SARS, avian flu and MERS had virtually no effect on the U.S. during election years.

column2: COVID-19 is just a big flu.
column8: It is far too soon to make such assumptions. Statistics of the first months of the pandemia show that it is not just a genuine virus.

column2: It is better to shave your beard to avoid being infected by the coronavirus.
column8: Unless you are in contact with people infected by the virus for your work, there is no need to shave your beard.

column2: Chinese experts warns about a scars in lung made by COVID-19. This is more severe than SARS 17 years ago.

column8: Text post is a false one since instructions to stay at home if infected were not given out by any authorities, some of the "facts" about the disease were straight up made up.

column8: Is false that an argentinian doctor discovered a vaccine against coronavirus in Spain. The men shown in a photo attached with the message is an actor. The World Health Organization informed that "there is no vaccine and no specific antiviral medicine to prevent or treat".

column2: Partially The WHO says the coronavirus might be spread via food.

column2: Coronavirus is not reproducing in warm places.

column2: Taiwan has severe community transmission. Many people died.

column2: MOSTLY Post says “the blood test for coronavirus costs $3,200.”
column8: The CDC isn’t charging for coronavirus testing but patients could be stuck with associated costs, such as a trip to the emergency room. In Florida, a man who worried he was infected initially faced a $3,270 bill even though he never received a coronavirus test.

column2: Post says starting in March if you travel outside of the United States you won’t be allowed back in the country “due to high risk of the coronavirus.”
column8: As of March 6, there is currently no mandate that states Americans are barred from returning to the U.S. from anywhere overseas.

column2: “Akira’ is a 1988 movie about an apocalyptic event taking place months before Tokyo 2020 Olympics, showing the (World Health Organization) advising Japan to postpone the Olympics because of a pandemic risk”.
column8: The movie does not feature a pandemic of any sort. The WHO is never mentioned in the movie.

column2: A video has been viewed thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim that it shows bodies being removed from a hospital in Iran during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; the video has circulated in reports since at least August 2019 about a funeral procession for pilgrims who died during the annual Islamic pilgrimage to Saudi Arabia's Grand Mosque.

column2: A “Letter” from an uncle in Wuhan claims COVID-19 can be cured with hot water.
column8: There is no evidence hot water can cure COVID-19, other facts stated in the said letter are not accurate as well.

column2: CDC issued facial hair recommendation for novel coronavirus prevention.
column8: Graphic is more than two years old and is unrelated to current outbreak.

column2: There is a confirmed case of coronavirus in a Bogotá hospital.
column8: The case was never treated under the suspicion it was coronavirus.

column2: You can maintain the alkaline state of the body to avoid contagion.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: Is it useful to close borders to stop the outbreak?
column8: French medical experts say closing borders in order to prevent infected people from entering in France is ineffective. Likewise, health tests before entering the country have little effect.

column2: Letters and packages sent from China can be a way of infection.
column8: Viruses can live for some time in objects like door knobs. WHO has declares COVID-19 can't live very long in envelopes and boxes.

column2: Mostly Face masks are a good protection system against coronavirus.
column8: Masks are not a good way of protection unless your are a health professional or your are in contact with somebody infected.

column2: The new coronavirus was registered in 2004.
column8: It was another type of coronavirus that was registered in 2004, not the one that caused the current outbreak.

column2: School has been suspended in Catalonia until March 2.
column8: It's not a real statement by the Catalonian education department.

column2: New cases of coronavirus in Madrid linked to two universities and a club.
column8: Images of articles published by El Mundo related to coronavirus were manipulated.

column2: Two cases confirmed of coronavirus in Huelva, Andalucía (February 26th)
column8: Andalusian health ministry denied cases of coronavirus in the Spanish region.

column2: Italian Red Cross gives the recipe for making amuchina (hand sanitizer) at home.
column8: Italian Red Cross has never shared any receipe. The receipe shared isn't the real one and could be useful only to disinfect vegetables.

column2: Says the CDC recommends men shave their beards to protect against coronavirus.
column8: A 2017 CDC infographic shows how facial hair could interfere with respirator masks. The graphic is unrelated to coronavirus protection and the CDC has not recommended people should shave their beards to ward off the virus.

column2: China took advantage of the coronavirus crisis to buy back stocks of its technology companies belonging to foreign investors.
column8:
This is the story in full : Previously, stocks of technology companies, belonged to Europeans and Americans foreign investors.
Due to the situation in Wuhan, Juan began to decline, but the Central Bank did nothing to support Juan.
And when the price fell, below the allowable limit, XI JINPING gave the order, at one point, to buy ALL the shares of Europeans and Americans.
Not only has China made $ 20 billion, but these days it has returned the shares of its companies to China. The story is completely fabricated and there is no evidence for it. In fact, the story was published back in 2014 - but it was not the Chinese but the Russian president at the time, and the emergency was not because of the corona but because of the crime. The media only changed the name of the country, the president, the currency and the reason for the emergency and re-published the story.

column2: Partially Russian CDC admitted that COVID-19 is human-made.
column8:
The original document from the Russian health ministry only mentions that COVID-19 is
a recombinant virus. It doesn't suggest the COVID-19 is a human-made virus.

column2: Many corposes floated in the river in Tainan, Southern city in Taiwan.
column8: They are stage photos from Korean movies "Deranged" and "Train To Busan".

column2: “DDP (Democratic Progressive Party) legislator Kao Chia-yu gave my mom two boxed of face mask since DDP has plenty and said that the outbreak is out of control.”
column8: Legislator Kao denied making such a comment. There are several factual inaccuracies in the claim.

column2: My son, who works as a public servant in the Central government, got one box of face mask while the public is restricted to two per week.
column8: All public officials of the central government whose duty are not related to disease control are not allowed to apply for official face masks.

column2: Singapore government said the confirmed case no. 12 is a prostitute. As a result, many of her clients are under quarantine.
column8: According to the Singapore health ministry, case no. 12 showed symptoms during the family trip in Singapore. The department hasn't released the occupation of case no. 12.

column2: Multiple allegations around how coronavirus was produced by China.
column8: The alleged connection between tha spies is fictional. No scientific evidence shows the virus is produced as a bioweapon.

column2: An information about a man allegedly selling medical masks for 80 denars on a bus owned by the Skopje Public Transportation Enterprise.
column8: After a short investigation, it was found out that the photo has already been posted on other sites, such as the Facebook page of the site 3minute.net, where the photo was posted on 25 February. According to the status, the photo was taken in the town of Craiova, Romania, and not in Skopje, North Macedonia.

column2: Partially Multiple allegations on how to protect oneself from CoV.
column8: Many of the practices detailed in the post are misleading and inaccurate.

column2: Cov infects chickens in Pakistan.
column8: Authorities say it's related to another disease.

column2: Infected taxi driver demands money from his government otherwise he’ll infect others.
column8: Story originated from a parody account, no driver is threatneing to spread covid-19 across Nigeria.

column2: Photos of Muslims in Italy allegedly praying outside because of the novel coronavirus.
column8: The photos have been published long before the COVID-19 outbreak.

column2: Indian Government and World Health Organization advised people to not purchase colours from China for Holi.
column8: No such advisory was shared by the government or the Ministry.

column2: There is a crowd waiting to greet the Colombians living in Wuhan who are being flown to Bogotá.
column8: The images are from 2018, when crowds gathered to meet the Colombian National Football Team after the World Cup in Russia.

column2: In Poland, people who are not insured have to pay for medical test for coronavirus, so if they can’t afford it, they will spread it.
column8: He included a document from hospital which named the price for voluntary coronavirus test, for those who are not suspected of having coronavirus (they haven't been to affected areas nor they have medical signs of disease). Anyone who IS suspected of having coronavirus, will have medical examination free of charge, no matter if he's insured or not.

column2: China needs coronavirus SWAT (special weapons and tactics) police team to arrest this drop dead virus victim.
column8: Video shows a mock drill by Tongbai police practicing to take down coronavirus infected patients in case they are uncooperative.

column2: The claim that the book The Eyes of Darkness predict the spread of coronavirus in 1981.
column8: The book is a work of fiction that mentions a biological weapon called Wuhan-400 (Originally Gorki-400) that has no similarities to the COVID-19. The other page, is from a totally different book “End of Days” by American psychic Sylvia Browne.

column2: The name coronavirus on disinfecting spray can reaffirms that the virus was known before the outbreak and might be planned.
column8: Coronaviruses have been known for decades. SARS and MERS were caused by coronaviruses. The companies (Lysol, Clorox,etc) have stated that their products have demonstrated effectiveness against viruses “similar” to COVID-19.

column2: Coronavirus is bioweapon leaked from Wuhan lab.
column8: Already disproved similar claims. Scientists in Wuhan insisted no link between virus and labs.

column2: Bats that hide under Wuhan rooftops caused the COVID-19 outbreak.
column8: The video was recorded in the US in 2011.

column2: Partially Video of a road traffic control in China to detect people infected with coronavirus.
column8: The video was filmed in China, but it's a simulation, not a real incident.

column2: Coronavirus patients are being “cremated alive” in China.
column8: The Chinese government has ordered the swift cremation of patients who die after contracting the coronavirus. But there is no evidence they are being cremated alive.

column2: Evidence indicates COVID-19 virus escaped a Chinese lab that was researching it, thus causing the outbreak.
column8: Overall, Mosher’s argument is based on unfounded speculation and scientific inaccuracies. Multiple scientific studies have indicated that the virus has a natural origin, not the result of human engineering.

column2: It is a weird and unusual year. An ice tunami occurred on Xingkai Lake in Heilongjiang.
column8: The video of the ice tsunami was filmed at River Yenisey in Dudinka, Russia, in June 2019. Not in China.

column2: An armored vehicle was so full of corpses so that it slipped off a trailer.
column8: It is a picture of an armored vehicle accident in Taichung. It has been miscaptioned.

column2: The DPP (Democratic Progressive Party) politician Wang Shijian said that Taiwan has more than 500 confirmed cases.
column8: The DPP councilor Wang Shijian has denied making such a statement. As to Feb. 25., 2020, Taiwan has 31 confirmed cases, one death toll

column2: Vaccine for COVID-19 has been found.
column8: Chinese ambrassador to Russia announced that they are making progress. No vaccine for COVID-19 yet.

column2: Said the mortality rate for the flu is “right around” that of the new coronavirus: “It’s right around 2%.”
column8: The mortality rate for the flu is considered by most experts to be about 0.1%. Estimates for the mortality rate for coronavirus are currently around 2%, but this number could change depending on how cases are diagnosed.

column2: The Chinese accept Islam en masse (20 millions).
column8: Video was published with misleading header. After our fact-check some authors changed descriptions for their videos but this hoax is still circulating on WhatsApp.

column2: A book by D.Koontz (The Eyes of Darkness) predicted COVID-19 in 1981.
column8: The first edition of the book mentioned that the virus was invented by the Russians, rather then the Chinese. Moreover, real and imaginary viruses have almost nothing in common.

column2: Chinese people convert to islam because of cov.
column8: Video is from May 2019.

column2: Radio host Rush Limbaugh compres novel coronavirus to ‘common cold’.
column8: Novel coronavirus is more deadly from the viruses that can cause a cold, according to experts.

column2: Cov case in Uttar Pradesh district.
column8: Authorities denied.

column2: Shoppers in China storm supermarket after cov outbreak.
column8: The video has circulated in media reports since at least October 2019, two months before the viral outbreak was first reported.

column2: A Chinese SWAT Team takes down a coronavirus suspect
column8: A mock drill video was shared as China committing atrocites on its patients.

column2: Partly A 1981 book predicted the coronavirus outbreak.
column8: The book does talk about a virus called Wuhan-400, but it's not the same as COVID-19.

column2: The link between COVID-19 and 5G is being hidden.
column8: The link is not being hidden because it doesn't exist.

column2: 2 coronavirus Sars-Cov-2 cases in Bovalino (Reggio Calabria, Italy).
column8: No Sars-Cov-2 cases at that time.

column2: Coronavirus Sars-Cov-2 in Sant’Egidio (Abruzzo, Italy).
column8: No Sars-Cov-2 cases at that time.

column2: Coronavirus Sars-Cov-2 sites in Parabiago e Nerviano (Lombardia, Italy)
column8: No coronavirus Sars-Cov-2 sites there at that time.

column2: Coronavirus Sars-Cov-2 at Bosch company in Bari (Puglia) because Chinese people visited the week before.
column8: No Sars-Cov-2 cases at that time.

column2: “The coronavirus is the common cold, folks.”
column8: The 2019 coronavirus is a new virus that had not been previously identified.

column2: Taiwanese manufacturing is awesome. One machine can produce 2.5 million face masks per day.
column8: According to the Taiwanese Economy Ministry, each production line of face mask produces around 100,000 masks per day. The claimed video is miscaptioned as well.

column2: Video shows the suspected infected people in eastern Turkey, Van.
column8: Video is not new. There is no proved COVID-19 case in Turkey by now.

column2: Author Dean Koontz foresaw the outbreak in his book.
column8: There is nothing common between the fictional virus in the book and current COVID-19 rather than Wuhan.

column2: Sensationalist article claiming Nostradamus predicted the coronavirus.
column8: The predictions of Nostradamus are not correctly translated, and even if Nostradamus truly predicted a “plague”, the title of the original article says that it is taking place in a seaside town. The coronavirus originated in the city of Wuhan in China, which is not a seaside town, which can be confirmed by a simple Google search.

column2: A video showing an anti-China protest amid the COVID-19 outbreak in Italy.
column8: The video show a march in Rome to commemorate the 40th anniversary of the assassination of Valerio Verbano, an Italian left-wing activist murdered in 1980.

column2: A Facebook status from 2012 talked about the spread of coronavirus in 2020.
column8: The facebook status was updated on 27 Jan 2020.

column2: Years ago, there was a hand sanitizer active against Sars-Cov-2.
column8: The hand sanitizer is active against coronavirus in general. There is no specific sanitizer against Sars-Cov-2. Pagella Politica contacted the manufacturing company.

column2: TV news said: Ketamine can cure COVID-19.
column8: There is no evidence that Ketamine can prevent or treat COVID-19.

column2: Many corpses from South Taiwan were sent to Taichung to burn. Taiwan has serious communuity infection.
column8: The number of cremation in Taiwan hasn't increased significantly since the COVID-19 outbreak.

column2: Chinese official detainted a CoV case.
column8: It was an exercise.

column2: Pigs are burried alive due to coronavirus.
column8: The video is not recent and has nothing to do with coronavirus.

column2: Post says “People Of Color May Be Immune To The Coronavirus Because Of Melanin.”
column8: Melanin is a natural pigment that gives color to skin and eyes. It does not make you any less susceptible to coronavirus.

column2: This is a snow artwork from Wuhan.
column8: It's in another city, Shandong.

column2: This map shows high sulphur dioxide in Wuhan now due to burning of corpses.
column8: Those are only forecasts based on past emissions.

column2: Chinese people flee to Vietnam due to cov.
column8: The video is from november 2019.

column2: Video showing racist reactions towards Asian people.
column8: Those are actors.

column2: WHO considers canceling Mecca’s pilgrimage.
column8: WHO did not and could not take such a measure.

column2: These charts claim to show the difference among COVID-19, flu, common cold.
column8: Charts include inaccurate information about symptoms. They claim people suffering from the novel coronavirus do not develop some symptoms seen in flu or common cold patients, such as a runny or stuffy nose, a sore throat, vomiting, diarrhea and muscle pain, among others -- most of which can actually be seen among COVID-19 patients as well.

column2: A suspicious case of coronavirus in Militay Hospital in Maracay from a army member who claimed have visited China in December.
column8: The journalist was misinformed and rushed to publish the information. Every source consulted explained the patient was never suspect or examinated for coronavirus becaue he came from Chine one month and a half ago.

column2: Chinse people fleeing China to Vietnam because of coronavirus.
column8: People are actually going from Vietnam to China for work.

column2: Six coronavirus cases confirmed in Wichita, Kansas.
column8: No cases were confirmed there, and claim came from non-credible websites.

column2: Four people have died in Zanzibar after handling a chicken infected with COVID-19.
column8: A post claiming that four individuals in Zanzibar died from COVID-19 after handling a diseased chicken is false. The post contains images of a diseased chicken that circulated in other countries claiming to show symptoms of COVID-19.

column2: Coronavirus arrived in Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina.
column8: Since the allegation that the coronavirus arrived in Sarajevo is presented in the title as fact and that there are no confirmations in the text of the articles, all the articles are rated as misinformation and clickbait.

column2: Cannabis boosts immunity against CoV.
column8: There is no evidence to suggest that cannabis improves immunity against the virus.

column2: Rainbow shimmers behind cov disinfectant truck in China.
column8: It's from March 2019.

column2: Those are corpses on the street in Wuhan.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article.

column2: Social media posts claim Chloroquine, an antimalarial drug can cure COVID-19.
column8: No health authorities have certified chloroquine as a cure for coronavirus. WHO, the foremost authority on the subject, according to the Director-General of the body, Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, says while the organisation is currently conducting a number of drug trials, it does not expect a result before three weeks. More so, the “malarial chloroquine used in China was not one of the drugs.”

column2: Chinese converting to Islam after realizing that no Muslim was affected by COVD19 in the country.
column8: Viral video is available on the internet since June 2019 and has no relation with the current outbreak of coronavirus in China.

column2: 20 million Chinese convert to Islam, and coronavirus does not affect Muslims.
column8: The video doesn't feature Chinese people, but rather Filipino men. Video footage predates major coronavirus reports.

column2: A Chinese man has been lynched because he pretended to have coronavirus.
column8: The man was Philippine and not Chinese. He was lynched because other people thought that he could potentially start spreading coronavirus Sars-Cov-2 in their city.

column2: Is It Really That Mosques Across China Reopened After Corona Virus Plague?
column8: a video of worship activities in the Dongguan Mosque, China. However, no news was found that the mosque was ever closed or reopened.

column2: Chinese businessman Guo Wengui’s multiple allegations on coronavirus outbreak.
column8:
- The outbreak was not a disaster in the mid of December. 
- The disease did not spread in US quickly after 18th of Feb. 
- Death rate is being updated day by day; not always same. 
- Wuhan's hospital capacity rise doesn't show the real number of infected. 
- Isolation centers in Wuhan are not concentration camps.

column2: The drug “arbidol” can help from the new coronavirus.
column8: The drug "arbidol" (other name - Umifenovir) is not proved to be a cure from coronavirus.

column2: People queue in Singapore for Halal food.
column8: They are queuing for masks.

column2: In Japan, if the new coronavirus test is negative, the cost is 80,000 yen. If positive, the state will bear the cost.
column8: No voluntary testing of the new coronavirus has been performed. The test is "when it is determined that the prefecture is necessary based on travel history and contact history with patients", but in this case, the test cost is public expense regardless of negative or positive, and it is "free".

column2: This video shows corpses on the streets of Wuhan.
column8: It is in Shenzhen and shows people coming from Hubei sleeping in the streets because no one wants to rent them a rool.

column2: World labs confirm: coronavirus was bioengineered.
column8: There is no evidence of this.

column2: Article suggests African skin and blood is resistant to coronavirus.
column8: There is no evidence to suggest “black people’s” immunity to the virus, or conversely “white people’s” vulnerability to it. The World Health Organisation (WHO) already stated that anyone in proximity to an infected person is at risk of contracting it (COVID-19).

column2: In Nigerian, Ibrahim Magu, Acting EFCC Chairman attributed corruption as the reason for coronavirus.
column8: Coronavirus recently named COVID-19 by the World Health Organisation is a disease. Further, health authorities surmise it emanated from the wet markets in China; being a zoonotic disease. And while the jury’s out on the full clinical picture for COVID-19’s, no evidence suggests it to be a function of moral misconduct or the activities of corrupt individuals.

column2: Chinese police kill a woman escaping a COVID-19 quarantine in China.
column8: The scene actually shows a motorbike accident.

column2: Coronavirus is a biological warfare weapon.
column8: Dr. Francis Boyle did say that coronvirus is a biological warfare weapon, but the story lacks context. There is no supporting evidence to back up that suggestion. It was debunked as a rumor and untrue that coronavirus was made in a lab.

column2: Chinese converting to Islam after realising that no muslim was affected by #coronavirus #COVD19 in the country.
column8: The viral video is old and not related to coronavirus.

column2: Says the 2008 book “End of Days” predicted the current coronavirus outbreak.
column8: Dean Koontz, not Sylvia Browne, wrote about “Wuhan-400”.

column2: This is Dr. Li-wen Liang’s funeral ceremony.
column8: Dr. Li died on Feb. 7., 2020. The video was uploaded on Nov. 19. 2018.

column2: The amount of ACE2 East Asian people have is 4-5 times more than non-East-Asians. That is why they get infected easily.
column8: The claim quoted a 2005 study regarding SARS, not COVID-19.

column2: Really Chinese Citizens Cram For Friday Prayer After Corona Virus Plague?
column8: The video is a video of Chinese citizens carrying out Friday prayers taken in 2016, before the coronavirus was first reported in December 2019.

column2: Massive live-pig burials after COVID-19 outbreak.
column8: The burial is not new. Chinese goverment decided to kill pigs after African swine fever in 2018.

column2: China Seeks Court’s Approval To Kill 20000 coronavirus Patients.
column8: Post claiming China seeks court’s approval to kill 20000 coronavirus patients is fake.

column2: This coronavirus-infected patient reached to Dr. Vinod Kumar but he wasn’t given the treatment. He was later referred to Bhagalpur. It further states that one should avoid meat and fish for 3 months and wear mask to protect yourself from coronavirus.
column8: The post claiming that coronavirus infected patient reached Bihar and is not given treatment is fake. Health authorities dismiss the hoax report. Further, WHO has also not recommended to avoid fish and meat. It recommended thoroughly cooking meat and eggs. Wearing mask is, however, advisable.

column2: Video says “the coronavirus was invented and patented in the USA and then planted in China.”
column8: There is no evidence the coronavirus was “invented.”

column2: Mostly India has developed treatment for coronavirus.
column8: The headline of the viral article is misleading. So far, India has not claimed any such discovery.

column2: An Australian couple ordered wine by drone on princess cruise ship.
column8: The couple said it was a prank.

column2: This map shows the global spread of cov.
column8: This map shows flight paths worldwide -- it does not show the movement of Wuhan residents.

column2: Drinking alcohol kills the coronavirus.
column8: Drinking alcohol does not cure coronavirus, alcohol in sanitizers does have an effect.

column2: 7 children die of coronavirus with 1 week in Karimganj (Assam, India).
column8: Public Health Officials have denied any coronavirus death, these clildren died in a span of 2 months due to fever and other illness.

column2: Data shows massive release of sulfur dioxide gas near Wuhan.
column8: The images in the Twitter posts are not satellite measurements, and a member of NASA said the images did not show significantly increased SO2 measurements. Some other websites cited the images as evidence -- though false -- of bodies being burned due to coronavirus.

column2: Popping bubble wrap does not exposes people to coronavirus.
column8: Bubble wrap is not produced by people blowing air into the plastic. Claim originated from a satirical Facebook page that was shut down.

column2: Cocaine kills coronavirus.
column8: Post claiming cocaine kills coronavirus is fake.

column2: False A blog post claiming that COVID-19 is the name of the vaccine against novel coronavirus.
column8: A blog post claiming that the World Health Organization has announced COVID-19 as a vaccine against the novel coronavirus has a false headline. There is no vaccine yet for the disease.

column2: This is a video of the late Chinese doctor Li-wen Liang’s wedding party
column8: The video is about the wedding of a Taiwanese couple filmed in Taiwan.

column2: Dr. Chao Chien Kuo from Wuhan Central hospital said: drinking alcohol can prevent COVID-19.
column8: Dr. Chao Chien Kuo had had such a comment, but it was a joke in his private chat group, not an official recommendation. There is no evidence that drinking alcohol can prevent or treat COVID-19.

column2: Having 14 face masks is enough. You can reuse them every 14 days since the incubation period is 14 days.
column8: 14 days of incubation doesn't mean that the coronavirus can be alive for 14 days. People should not reuse single-use-mask.

column2: Are Chinese Really Converting Islam to Avoid Corona Virus?
column8: The video is a religious activity carried out by ICDO in the Philippines which circulated on the internet before the coronavirus was first reported in December 2019.

column2: Is It Really the Video of Crow Attack and Jumbo Mosquito in China when Corona Virus Plague?
column8: The video is edited by combining several different videos and images.

column2: A post shared repeatedly on Facebook claims that taking a hot bath is an effective remedy against the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: Health experts say there is no scientific evidence that bathing in hot water can prevent people from catching the virus; the World Health Organisation (WHO) warned that bathing or showering in very hot water can be “harmful”.

column2: Exactly every 100 years a viral epidemic breaks out.
column8: These epidemics have not arisen exactly 20 years after the beginning of each century.

column2: This bottle of disinfectant gel prooves that the coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 existed before 2019.
column8: Different kinds of coronavirus existed years before SARS-CoV-2, the one which is responsible of COVID-19. That's why the term coronavirus is written on this bottle.

column2: A video claims to be showing an Eid prayer in China in dec 19.
column8: This is a prayer in China in June 19, not related to Cov.

column2: Video showing quarantined people in a building in Shanghai.
column8: This video shows tower blocks in Shanghai, not Wuhan – and the clip has been edited to include the audio

column2: Thailnd cures CoV with anti-HIV drugs.
column8: Thai doctors say their treatment helped a coronavirus patient recover, but it was not a ‘cure’.

column2: COVID-19 case in east Indian state.
column8: Local health authority said that there are no confirmed novel coronavirus patients in the area at the time.

column2: Cov case in Ethiopia.
column8: No case at this date.

column2: Cuban medicine cures COVID-19.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: Bus driver in China vomits blood after becoming unconscious behind the wheel.
column8: This video dates back to 2015 when a driver in Xiamen, China was suffering from gastrointestinal bleeding.

column2: Video showing Massive Explosion in Wuhan, China to control the spread of coronavirus.
column8: Viral video on social media dates back to 2015 when there were giant explosions at the Chinese port of Tianjin. This video is old and has no relation with coronavirus.

column2: Latest research by Chinese scientists said coronavirus will render most male patients infertile.
column8: The study has not been peer-reviewed. But the study also does not go as far as to say coronavirus will definitely cause infertility in men.

column2: Consuming magnesium chloride, sodium bicarbonate, ginger and lemon juice prevents coronavirus infection.
column8: No health organization has recommended eating any of these products to prevent coronavirus.

column2: Cloud and rain from Wuhan brought the virus to Taiwan.
column8: COVID-19 spreads from person to person through small droplets from the nose or mouth which are spread when a person with COVID-19 coughs or exhales. Plus, coronavirus can't survive in clouds.

column2: This Burned Building Is a Place of Corona Virus Patient Isolation
column8: The burning building was an apartment in California Park, Yubei District, Chongqing City on January 1, 2020, not a hotel where COVID-19 patients were isolated.

column2: SO2 map proves the massive human cremation in Wuhan.
column8: Calculations about the possible sulfur burning and certain degree of air pollution are not consistant.

column2: An “official” mask to combat the novel coronavirus was released.
column8: The mask for sale is the Monata reusable dust pollution mask, which is used for woodworking, house cleaning, gardening, and other outdoor activities.

column2: China has announced the sucess of Egyptian serum form Dr. Hala, Ealth Miniter of Egypt, against coronavirus
column8: WHO says there is no known cure of vaccine to the coronavirus for now.

column2: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte orders state hospital to accept COVID-19 patients from Wuhan.
column8: Duterte’s speeches prior to the publication of City News’ false report have made no mention of PGH being used for Chinese patients with COVID-19. Neither have legitimate news media organizations reported on this.

column2: Upon approval from Supreme People’s Court, China will kill 20,000 patients with novel coronavirus.
column8: There is no such case being tried at the Supreme People’s Court of China. The high court’s record of scheduled hearings on its official website does not show that it was set to decide on such a case on Feb. 7, and neither is there a record of it on the resolved cases tab and press releases.

column2: This is map “based on traces of Wuhan citizens”,during the period between the outbreak of the new coronavirus and the blockade of Wuhan.
column8: This map is an image showing the routes of passenger aircraft around the world, and it is incorrect to use "maps based on traces of movement"

column2: A large amount of sulfur dioxide was observed in Wuhan because up to 14000 bodies were incinerated.
