column2: Conspiracy Coronavirus was spread via bananas
column8: Coronavirus has transmitted from living organisms - animals - and any evidence, as if bananas or other food products transmit it, has not yet been revealed. Moreover, bananas have been a source of various conspiracies for years, and was considered to be a source of spreading the Ebola, then AIDS and swine flu groundlessly and without any scientific justification. 'Myth Detector's developed banana 'timeline' reflecting the conspiracies that were inspired by a banana and banana-caused viruses at different times.

column2: A video has gone viral on social media which claims to feature one of the victims of the deadly virus.
column8: The same video was posted YouTube on October 24th, 2019, which was before the first case of coronavirus got reported in China in December 2019.

column2: This video showing a market of animals is claimed to be shot in Wuhan.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article.

column2: There is an alert of coronavirus in Madrid, Barcelona and Valencia (January 28).
column8: There are no cases of coronavirus detected in Spain.

column2: Coronavirus in China: 2.8 million infected and 112,000 dead.
column8: It's not true that in Cina there are 2.8 million people infected and 112,000 dead.

column2: This video connected with coronavirus shows a wholesale market in China and its low–hygiene environment.
column8: The video is highly misleading: the market is located in Indonesia and not in China.

column2: Says a “Clorox bottle claimed it could kill (the 2019 coronavirus)… before it was developed.”
column8: There is no evidence that the 2019 coronavirus was "developed" prior to the outbreak.

column2: Can garlic cure patients infected with the coronavirus?
column8: There has been no research or evidence that garlic can cure patients infected with the coronavirus.

column2: Grape vinegar is the antidote of the coronavirus.
column8: There is no scientific evidence the benefits of vinegat to fight with the disease. The virus is not poison, an antidote would not be useful at all.

column2: The animals in the list in the photo were served at a meeting for 40 thousand people in China, and the virus spread after that day.
column8: The animal list, which presented with the prices in the photo, belongs to the list of animals sold in live animal markets in China. And there is no information regarding a meeting of 40 thousand people in this city.

column2: The studies initiated by the “Military Research Institute” transformed the form of virus in 2018.
column8: The claim that the virus was developed by a "military institute" is based on an article authored by Dan Hu, who works for Third Military Medical University in China. However, the article does not mention the experiments changed the genetics of the virus. Again, the examples used in the article are stored in the gene bank with a code and these codes are also included in the study. This allows scientists to work on the virus.

column2: The animals in the list in the photo were served at a meeting for 40 thousand people in China, and the virus spread after that day.
column8: The animal list, which presented with the prices in the photo, belongs to the list of animals sold in live animal markets in China. And there is no information regarding a meeting of 40 thousand people in this city.

column2: Turkish doctor allegedly found coronavirus vaccine.
column8: There is no doctor called "Tamer Yirmiüçoğlu." The doctor in the photo is gynecologist Op. Dr. Tamer Gültekin who became famous in 2016 with the vagina bleaching operations.

column2: False YouTube channel published a radio-show-style report with false headline saying novel coronavirus is in the Philippines
column8: Kabisnes’s false and clickbait headline does not reflect its content. In the video’s first 10 seconds, the show host reads the phrase “Coronavirus, nasa Pilipinas na (coronavirus, already in the Philippines)” then proceeds to say that it was a claim circulating on social media, currently being debunked by Malacanang and DOH.

column2: A FB post giving information and safety precautions about coronaviruses is misleading readers by falsely claiming in its premise that a positive case of the 2019 novel coronavirus was “confirmed” to be found in Cebu province.
column8: The Department of Health announced on Jan. 28 there remains to be no positive case of the 2019 nCoV in the country, only that there are 27 people under investigation for suspected infection.

column2: The video shown shows effects of coronavirus and avoid icecream, cold drinks for 90 days.
column8: Video shown in the viral post showing a person removing larvae from the lips using a pair of tweezers is old and unrelated to coronavirus. The claim in the viral post is also refuted by medical professionals.

column2: The novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) “will not last long” in the Philippines because of its warm climate.
column8: The World Health Organization (WHO) has not said that temperature affects the spread of 2019-nCoV and they don't recommend exposure to heat as protection or a treatment for the virus.

column2: Two Filipinos ate bat soup in Wuhan, China, the epicenter of the 2019 novel coronavirus (nCoV), as seen in a video uploaded on Facebook.
column8: The original video was taken in Palau and was uploaded on YouTube on July 17, 2019 – at least 5 months before a case of the 2019-nCoV was first reported in Wuhan, China.

column2: The following statement of the Wuhan nurse: Don’t go out, don’t go to parties, don’t eat out, there are 98.000 infected not 2.700, sensationaly transmitted by the Macedonian media outlet Republika.
column8: On 28 January 2020 official figures as of day before were about 4,500 infected in China, not 2,700. Official figures are published by Johns Hopkins University, which has no connection to the Chinese government propaganda and is trying to objectively monitor the outbreak of the new coronavirus. A relevant source for an epidemic situation is always a health institution or operational headquarters to fight the epidemic, not an individual.

column2: A Saudi Arabian study for a MERS vaccine is linked to the outbreak of coronavirus.
column8: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the Facebook post to be false. The Saudi clinical trial is investigating a vaccine for the MERS coronavirus strain, not the 2019 Novel coronavirus.

column2: Post claims food products such as rice, fortune cookies, mi goreng noodles, ice tea and “Chinese red bull” are contaminated with coronavirus in Australia. Also some areas of Sydney are supposedly identified as contaminated.
column8: AAP FactCheck found the Facebook post to be false. A viral infectious diseases expert says there is no evidence of food being a source of any coronavirus transmission. The Facebook post also lists information from the “Department of Diseasology Parramatta” conducting tests showing “positive readings” for the virus at train stations in four Sydney suburbs. NSW Health confirmed to AAP FactCheck there is no such organisation as the “Department of Diseasology Parramatta” and there have been no “positive readings” at train stations.

column2: There are several new confirmed cases in several French cities.
column8: Hospitals and authorities denied such claims in various cities.

column2: Food and locations are contaminated in Australia.
column8: Authorities denied those claims.

column2: This woman in Malaysia died of coronavirus.
column8: Family says no evidence of Cov.

column2: Water used in an islamic ablution ritual can kill the novel coronavirus.
column8: Health experts warn that water alone cannot kill the virus and recommend that people wash their hands with soap and water for effective protection.

column2: “How to prevent the coronavirus (…) Drink fennel tea twice a day. Fennel tea has the same component as Tamiflu medicine, used to treat H1N1”.
column8: Fennel tea doesn't has the same component as Tamiflu and Tamiflu is not recommended by WHO to treat the new coronavirus.

column2: Raúl Rodolfo Abhduz Khan, biochemical engineer from Karmalah Laboratories, is the creator of the novel coronavirus.
column8: The person in the image is a YouTuber from Spain named Raúl Álvarez, aka AuronPlay. His image is commonly used to create disinformation, i.e. he was blamed for the fire in Notredame and in the Amazonas. The image is manipulated in order to show that is a news from CNN en Español.

column2: Partially The Indian health department has issued a notification advising people to drink only 50-80ml of water, avoid spicy food, and not travel in crowded spaces till March 2020.
column8: There has been no notification suggesting drinking only a certain amount of water, avoiding spicy food and improving the intake of vitamin C prevent coronavirus. The children are more vulnerable theory is also not scientifically backed. At the time of the story, there were no confirmed cases in India and the death toll had reached 106 in China.

column2: Mostly New strain of virus was already patented; Bill Gates funds institute which holds patent; Bill Gates predicted the outbreak and 65 Million Deaths.
column8: There are many patents for coronaviruses, but those are for different strains, not the one that recently broke out in China. Bill Gates has not predicted the outbreak.

column2: Partially Everything is much worse than reported; the current virus is worse than SARS; it causes red rashes on the skin, media is not reporting enough; people are falling over from the virus in the streets.
column8: The video is spreading unproven, misleading and partly false claims about the outbreak of the new coronavirus.

column2: A seafood market is the source of the novel coronavirus, strange animals and foods were sold there, such as batsoup and snakes.
column8: It is possible that animals transmitted the virus to people. Many of the first patiens had visited the market. However, a direct link has not yet been proven.

column2: 156 thousand people died in China due to the coronavirus, 90 thousands in Wuhan itself.
column8: Article was based on Russian YouTube video, which was based on another article written by infamous conspiracy fake-news website. Figures had no reliable source of information.

column2: Coronavirus spreads in Ecuadorian cities (Quito – Guayaquil).
column8: The Ministry of Public Health analyzes a suspicious case. There is no confirmation about the presence of the virus in Ecuador.

column2: The Health Authority confirmed 3 cases of coronavirus in the country.
column8: There were no confirmed cases at that time.

column2: According to a news report, a doctor in the Wuhan hospital was seen collapsing and later lost his life as a result of being infected from the coronavirus 2019-nCoV in front of patients and hospital staff.
column8: "The incident which was captured in the video in question was a violent attack in the public hospital at the city of Quzhou, at the Hejing county in China. The doctor and two of his collegues were injured by the relative of a patient who lost his life after an acute myocardial infarction."

column2: Coronavirus killed 112,000 people in China.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: Coronavirus may have originated in lab linked to China’s biowarfare program.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: “CORONAVIRUS: Reports of 10,000 DEAD in Wuhan, China.”
column8: As of early Jan. 27, the estimated death toll is 81 — all of them in China.

column2: A “Chinese spy team” working in a Canadian government lab sent “pathogens to the Wuhan facility” prior to the coronavirus outbreak.
column8: Eric Morrissette, a spokesman for the Public Health Agency of Canada, told us by email, “this is misinformation and there is no factual basis for claims being made on social media.”

column2: Coronavirus has an effect on a person’s lips.
column8: The video shared a effectof Coronovirus on a patient lip is found to be on the internet at least since November-2019 i.e. before the recent epidemic broke out. So, it is not related to the recent coronavirus epidemic.

column2: BIll Gates contributed to the spread of coronavirus.
column8: The work that Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation does on healthcare has in no way contributed to the spread of coronavirus.

column2: Video of Wuhan market with dogs, snakes, rats and bats…
column8: Video taken in Indonesia (Langowan)

column2: Close-up of a bat soup bowl that is eaten in Wuhan, or elsewhre in China.
column8: A local source in Palau said he recognized a specific local restaurant. Table, room setting and plates' decorations match with other pictures found online showing tourist dining in unspecified restaurant in Palau. Not enough elements for us to call it false but pretty close.

column2: This video shows a woman eating a bat soup in Wuhan.
column8: Video shot in Palau in 2016.

column2: This video shows a man eating a bat soup in a restaurant in China.
column8: With identified many elements in the video that matched pictures published by Chinese bloggers who visited Palau and documented their trip.

column2: Filipinos are eating a bat soup in Wuhan.
column8: YouTubers made the video last July in Palau.

column2: Bat market and bat meat being sold in Wuhan.
column8: Video taken in Indonesia (Manado)

column2: Video of Wuhan market with dogs, snakes, rats and bats…
column8: Video taken in Indonesia (Langowan)

column2: A package from AliExpress sent from China can spread the new coronavirus.
column8: The coronavirus need a living host to grow. This kind of virus lives only a few days in a liquid and only a few hours on an object. The virus would die during the long transport from China to France, for example. The scientist never observed this king of contamination before with any kind of coronavirus.

column2: The coronavirus was created and patented by an American lab two years before the pandemic.
column8: These pre-existing patents are referring to other viruses and coronaviruses.

column2: An explosion that occured in Wuhan, China, is tied to the coronavirus outbreak.
column8: It was a video supposedly of an explosion in Wuhan, China. A search showed it was actually footage of the first of several explosions in Tianjin, China, from 2015.

column2: False Spreading coronavirus is the interest of the USA, because American laboratories are operating not only around Russia but in the surroundings of Asian countries and in Georgia (Lugar lab).
column8: There are several conspiracy narratives developed in the report, including on US Labs artificially linked to the coronavirus. In the context of conspiracy narrative, the story author names Tbilisi-based Lugar Laboratory of biological research, making an unreasonable parallel between virus found in China and Tbilisi Laboratory. Moreover, the story features the archive material from 2018, in which former Georgian Minister of Security Igor Giorgadze talks about the threats coming from the Lugar Lab. Lugar Laboratory is a part of the National Center for Disease Control and Public Health of Ministry of Health of Georgia. For years, Lugar Lab has been a target of Kremlin, Russia affiliated media, Russian politicians and high officials. Except for US-financed C Hepatitis Treatment program, there are other conspiracies linked to the lab.

column2: Mostly Event 201 “gave out stuffed souvenir coronavirus toys” to “commemorate” novel coronavirus outbreak.
column8: Event 201 used a fictionalized coronavirus outbreak as its pandemic scenario but did not "predict" the outbreak of a strain that would be detected two months later in December 2019 in Wuhan, China.

column2: China “stole coronavirus from Canada and weaponized it into a Bioweapon.”
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: The Chinese Communist Party “will finally admit that the real source of the coronavirus is from ‘a lab in Wuhan’ linked to its covert biological weapon programs.”
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: A post says the coronavirus can be slowed or stopped with the “immediate widespread use of high doses of vitamin C.”
column8: The claim was originally shared on an alternative medical website that promotes nutritional supplementation.

column2: A message saying a “patient tested positive” for the 2019 novel coronavirus (nCoV) at the Makati Medical Center circulated on messaging apps and social media platforms on Monday, January 27.
column8: There is still no confirmed case of the 2019 nCoV in the Philippines as of January 28, according to the Department of Health (DOH).

column2: Videos of people infected with coronavirus in China.
column8: In both cases, it can't corroborate the origin of the material. Besides, does not exist an official pronouncement of any Chinese authority in health matter.

column2: Is the Corona Virus Really Relating to Chinese Treatment of Uighur Muslims?
column8: The claim that the emergence of the Corona 2019 virus is related to Chinese treatment of Uighur Muslims is a misleading claim. There is no link at all between the emergence of the coronavirus with how China treats Muslim Uighurs. The spread of the coronavirus has become a global health challenge after the advent of SARS in 2002 and MERS in 2013.

column2: A FB user published a collage of tweets claiming novel coronavirus has reached Cebu province and Boracay Island, which are popular tourists destinations.
column8: There is no confirmed positive case of the newly-detected 2019 nCoV in the Philippines at this time. This was clarified by Health Secretary Francisco Duque III in a Jan. 27 interview with CNN Philippines. He emphasized this in a separate press conference in Malacanang, where he also reported that the five-year-old boy suspected of having the disease tested negative.

column2: In Ukrainian media, it was written about a confirmed case of a Chinese coronavirus strain.
column8: We have described that this is not the case and indicated that there are several strains.

column2: A post says the coronavirus can be slowed or stopped with the “immediate widespread use of high doses of vitamin C.”
column8: The claim was originally shared on an alternative medical website that promotes nutritional supplementation.

column2: “In ‘Resident Evil’ the Umbrella Corporation releases a virus that infects the people of Raccoon City. A biological research lab with the exact same logo as the Umbrella Corporation can be found in the city where the coronavirus outbreak originated.”
column8: There’s no evidence that the 2019 coronavirus that was first detected in Wuhan was created in a lab. It likely has its origins in bats, according to the CDC.

column2: This video shows the Wuhan market where the virus comes from.
column8: It's a market in Indonesia.

column2: Queensland issued travel warning for Wuhan and Chinese-populated areas in Australia.
column8: Queensland said they did not.

column2: Coronavirus is a type of rabies.
column8: Authorities say it's a hoax, the two viruses are different.

column2: First infected in Almaty (Kazakhstan).
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: Indian nurse in Jeddah (Saudi Arabia) detected with novel coronavirus(2019-nCOV).
column8: Official Goverment handles have clarified that The Indian Nurse is not suffering from the deadly 2019-Ncov.

column2: A screenshot of a text message that spread on Facebook claimed that there is a Chinese patient at the Hi-Precision Diagnostics clinic in Alabang, Philippines, who was tested positive for the novel coronavirus or 2019 nCoV.
column8: In a press briefing on Tuesday, January 28, the Department of Health (DOH) announced that there was still no confirmed case of 2019 nCoV in the country. The patient at Asian Hospital and Medical Center in Alabang, Muntinlupa City is among the 24 persons under investigation (PUIs) for the possible 2019 nCoV infection.

column2: The 2019 novel coronavirus (nCoV) is a “type of rabies” that can be contracted by eating bats.
column8: In a press briefing on Tuesday, January 28, Health Secretary Francisco Duque III clarified that the 2019 nCoV belongs to the Coronaviridae family of viruses. Meanwhile, rabies is from Rhabdoviridae.

column2: Partially “Wuhan Virus” is named SARI. Steroid is the medicine to cure it. Acetic acid can be used to prevent it.
column8: 1."Wuhan Virus" is named as "2019n-Cov".2.Steroid is not used for curing it. 3. Spraying acetic acid in air can not help prevent it.

column2: Partially Coronavirus dies at 56°C, so eat cooked food and turn on AC. Plus, Ethanol can kill the “Wuhan Virus”.
column8: Turning on the heater can not kill coronavirus. Both alcohol and chlorine can be useful to disinfect surfaces, but they can not cure COVID-19 and need to be used under appropriate recommendations.

column2: Chinese doctor Zhong Nanshan adviced to  to rinse your mouth with salty water to prevent 2019n-Cov.
column8: Nan-shan Zhong hasn't had such a comment. There is no evidence that rinsing the mouth with slaty water can prevent COVID-19, either.

column2: Partially The coronavirus is patented by Pirbright University.
column8: Coronaviruses are a group of similar looking viruses. The patent by Pirbright University is for the Avian Infectious bronchitis virus (IBV) which is found in fowls, pheasants and turkeys. This patent is not linked to the current 2019-novel coronavirus.

column2: A salesman in Medellín’s El Hueco market was sent to a hospital with coronavirus symptoms.
column8: Colombia's Ministry of Health reports no confirmed cases of coronavirus infections in Colombia. Medellín's Secretary of Health also reports no cases in their city.

column2: The virus was created by humans and patented.
column8: The patents exist but are not for the current coronavirus.

column2: Chinese scientists expelled from a Canadian microbiology lab took the novel coronavirus strain with them to China.
column8: The two scientists at the National Microbiology Lab (Winnipeg, Canada) are suspected to have sent live Ebola and Henipah viruses to Beijing in March 2019, but it has nothing to do with the coronavirus. They were expelled from the lab, but are not considered spies.

column2: A CBC news report would have said that Chinese scientists from a Canadian lab sent the coronavirus to Wuhan.
column8: Nothing in the CBC report (and 2 subsequent reports) said anything about "spies", or even coronavirus, and no link is done between the expulsion of these two scientists in July 2019 and the virus.

column2: Authorities have identified that the international chemical-warfare terrorist ‘Samuel Whitcomb Hyde’ is behind the deadly China ‘coronavirus.’”
column8: It's a long-running internet hoax. Sam Hyde is a comedian who is the frequent target of such hoaxes

column2: DailyMail reported that a virus leaked from the Wuhan National Biosafety Laboratory was responsible for the pandemic.
column8: The DailyMail article didn’t report that. Rutgers University microbiologist Dr Richard Ebright told DailyMail that "at this point there’s no reason to harbour suspicions" that the facility had anything to do with the outbreak, besides being responsible for the crucial genome sequencing that lets doctors diagnose it.

column2: A spray could protect against the coronavirus outbreak.
column8: The product being hawked by the Genesis Church 2 is essentially bleach.

column2: A tabletop exercise using a model of the current outbreak “predicted” 65 million people could die from the coronavirus.
column8: There was no prediction made at the tabletop exercise. It was held in October of 2019 and used a different model of the coronavirus, and no predicted death toll was estimated by the groups.

column2: Coronavirus has been originated in a laboratory linked to China’s biowarfare program.
column8: There is no evidence that the coronavirus 2019-nCoV was born in a China laboratory.

column2: A French member of parliament, Dominique Da Silva, said he hopes the coronavirus will kill people older than 70.
column8: The deputy's speech was meant to be satire, but it was misleading and shocked some people.

column2: The SARS-CoV-2 was created in 2003 in the United States.
column8: The patent that some people shared isn't related to the SARS-Cov-2 but to another coronavirus.

column2: Doctors said the entire Wuhan populaiton will die of the novel coronavirus.
column8: Authorities never said that and US CDC said most people will recover on their own.

column2: “They create diseases to offer vaccines. There is already a patent for an attenuated coronavirus.”
column8: The Pirbright Institute has a patent for an attenuated form of a different strain of coronavirus, the infectious bronchitis virus (IBV). It only affects poultry.

column2: Coronavirus may have spread due to the consumption of bat soup, according to scientists.
column8: There is no evidence to support the claim that the consumption of bat soup is connected to the transmisson of the 2019-nCoV. One recent study indicates that the new virus does share genetic information with other kinds of coroviruses that infect bats, but it is still unclear which animals may have transmitted the virus to humans. Analysing a genetic database, researchers concluded that Chinese snakes are the most likely reservoir for the new pathogen, but the hypothesis has yet to be tested experimentally.

column2: A Chinese person, who was taken from Kansai airport (in Osaka, Japan) to a hospital, has run away before they could be tested.
column8: According to the Kansai Airport Quarantine Station, this information is absolutely false.

column2: A new case of novel coronavirus was registered in Saudi Arabia. A nurse from India was diagnosed with the sepcific strain of the virus.
column8: "Acording to Dr. Tarik Al Azraqi, head of the commitee for infectious diseases in Saudi Arabia, the nurse was diagnosed and received treatment for MERS not 2019-nCoV."

column2: A Chinese woman from Wuhan arrived in France with suspected symptoms of coronavirus.
column8: The Chinese embassy in France confirmed the presence of this Chinese woman in France and said that she gave reassuring news. According to French authorities, investigations are underway, but this suspicious case has never been officially reported.

column2: Not That the China-centered coronvirus had infected 2.8 million people and killed 112,000.
column8: This was a wild exaggeration of the facts. It supposedly relied on reporting from "covert intelligence sources." At the time of the story, some 900 people had been infected and 26 had died.

column2: There’s a ‘coronavirus patent’, FEMA ‘proposes martial law’, Gates Foundation predicted virus, ‘funded group who owns virus patent’, coronavirus was ‘created in a lab’ as a ‘bioweapon for population control’.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column2: “Confirmed cases” of the novel coronavirus or 2019 nCoV were recorded at the Philippine Bank of Communications (PBCom) Tower in Makati City, according to a message that circulated Friday, January 24.
column8: Speaking to reporters on January 24, Health Undersecretary Eric Domingo maintained that there is still no confirmed case of the 2019 nCov in the Philippines. The management of PBCom Tower also said there is “no truth” to the information.

column2: There is a first case in Venezuela in the Bolivar state.
column8: The Association of Doctors in the State of Bolivar has publicly denied the information.

column2: “[The coronavirus is] “new” yet it was lab-created and patented in 2015”.
column8: The post references the Wuhan coronavirus, but the patent filed is clearly stated to be for the SARS coronavirus, which caused the 2003 outbreak. Neither the SARS nor Wuhan coronavirus is lab-created; evidence points to an animal reservoir as the source of infection.

column2: Saline solution can kill coronavirus.
column8: Doctor and WHO deny this claim.

column2: A post claims that you have to wear a disposable mask with the blue side out if you are sick and white side out if you are not.
column8: The only way to wear a mask is with blue face out, experts say to AFP.

column2: Not “There’s magically already a vaccine available.”
column8: Anthony S. Fauci, a top official at the National Institutes of Health (NIH), told Bloomberg Law that a potential vaccine "could move into early-stage human testing in the next three months."

column2: Not “There’s magically already a vaccine available.”
column8: Anthony S. Fauci, a top official at the National Institutes of Health (NIH), told Bloomberg Law that a potential vaccine "could move into early-stage human testing in the next three months."

column2: Warning: the virus is spreading in Italy (January 22).
column8: This news is not confirmed by any national or local newspaper nor by the Italian government.

column2: Clickbait / Russian scientists have a cure for fighting the new Chinese virus.
column8: There has been no new information on Triazavirin drug testing or its results. By the date of publication of this analysis, Triazavirin had not been confirmed as a cure for the new coronavirus. Because the title of Sputnik's article claims that the Russian drug Triazavirin for COVID-19 is "ready", although the article does not contain this claim, the article receives clickbait and misinformation ratings.

column2: Coronavirus outbreak linked to eating bats.
column8: Bats are known natural reservoirs for coronaviruses. However, many other animals, such as civet cats and snakes, can also carry these viruses. There is currently not enough evidence to conclude that the 2019 coronavirus outbreak resulted from people eating bats in Wuhan, China.

column2: The coronavirus was created in a lab and patented.
column8: The patents circulating are linked to other coronaviruses and a patent for a virus does not mean it's man made.

column2: partially The peak of the virus will be in two weeks. Normally, during those two weeks all the infections will occur, then there will be two weeks of calm and then two weeks where it goes down.
column8: The chance of getting SARS-CoV-2 only comes down to the next two weeks. What lasts two weeks or less is the incubation period.

column2: Stores and supermarkets in Veracruz, Mexico will close due to coronavirus. Local government asks to buy supplies.
column8: Authorities ask not to make panic purchases. As of March 18, stores have not said they will close.

column2: A chain message circulated on Tuesday, January 14, warning people to avoid going to Shangri-La Plaza, a mall in Mandaluyong City, because of a supposed case of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) reported in one of the mall’s medical clinics.
column8: The Department of Health (DOH) and Healthway Medical both issued advisories denying the claim in the chain message.

column2: WhatsApp text that says, among other things, that the Chinese created the virus and that the main cities in China did not suffer from the pandemic.
column8: The cities of Shanghai and Beijing registered cases of COVID-19 and even adopted restrictive measures against the coronavirus. The Chinese economy has indeed felt the economic effects of the outbreak, differently from what the piece of disinformation states. The country's main stock exchange indices, CSI 300 and compound Shanghai, fell 8.7% and 6.4% only in March, respectively.
